loans.name: Ciriaca

texts.en:
Ciriaca is 28 years old and married with two children.

Ciriaca works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items, such as canned goods, snack foods, candies, soft drinks, noodles, etc., to sell.

Ciriaca has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Ciriaca aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items, such as canned goods, snack foods, candies, soft drinks, noodles, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is 54 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Paz has a baking business in the Philippines. Paz requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like flour, eggs, baking powder, etc., for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Paz has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Paz would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like flour, eggs, baking powder, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Carlisle

texts.en:
Carlisle is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 41 years old, and her two children are in school.

Carlisle has a buy-and-sell mangoes business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more mangoes to sell to her customers.

Carlisle has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more mangoes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Xien's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Xien, an Thai ethnic woman, has been participating in the program of M7-MFI since January 2000. She currently lives with her husband and son in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from cultivation and animal breeding.  The income is just enough to cover the family’s living expense and she manages to save a small amount. She wants to expand the model of pig raising for meat but the saved amount is not enough to buy breeding pigs and food for them.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time, and she hopes that the loan amount will help her family to invest effectively in breeding, and next year the sale of the pigs will bring her family a considerable profit.

loans.use: to buy breeding pigs and pig food.

loans.name: Dia's Group

texts.en:
Dia was born in 1972 and is a Thai ethic woman.  She has been participating in the program of M7-MFI since March 2015. She currently lives with her husband and her son in Son La city, in Son La province. 

Her family’s main income is from cultivation and pig breeding, so the income is just enough to cover the family’s living expenses.  She saves a small amount. She wants to invest in expanding into pig breeding and pigs for meat, but she does not have enough money. That is why she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time. In addition, she hopes that the loan amount will help her invest effectively in pig breeding with high productivity.  Next year when she sells the sow and pigs it will bring her family a considerable profit.

loans.use: to invest in purchasing a sow for breeding pigs and for meat

loans.name: Dúo Fuente Del Cielo Group

texts.es:
Dúo Fuente del Cielo
Doña Rutilia Magali es originaria del municipio de tecpan, ella tiene 39 años de edad bajo su responsabilidad están sus 3 hijos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías y a la crianza de pollos.
El esposo de ella trabaja como chofer y gracias al apoyo de el y el apoyo de sus hijos a podido salir adelante con su familia.
El crédito que ella recibió lo invirtió en compra de matera prima para la elaboración de sus artesanías.
El sueño de ella es ampliar mas su negocio surtirlo con mas variedad de productos asi ella obtendrá mejores ganancias y mandar a sus hijos a la escuela para un futuro mejor. esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para elavorar tejidos tipicos para vender
texts.en: Rutilia Magali is from the town of Tecpan. She is 39 years old and is responsible for three underage children. Her livelihood is making artisanal crafts and raising chickens. Her husband works as a driver and with his support and the assistance of their children, the family has been able to get by. With the previous loan she received, she invested in the materials she needs to make her crafts. Her dream is to grow her business by stocking it with a wider variety of merchandise, and thus attain a higher income and send her kids to school for a better future. She is taking out this loan to buy materials for making traditional textiles to sell.

loans.use: to buy crafts materials and animals to raise.

loans.name: Uyen's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Uyen, born in 1980, is an ethnic Kinh. The family has 4 members, herself, her husband, son, and daughter. The family lives in Son La city, in Son La province.

The family’s main income is from a civil servant salary of the couple; and the children are still at school. The salary is just enough to cover the family’s living expenses and she saves a small amount.  For the last two years, her husband is working on his doctorate thesis, so the saved amount is not enough to pay the fees.  She wants to take a loan to pay for her husband’s education fee.
	
She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time, and hopes that the loan amount will help her husband to be able to study and he will have a stable job when he graduates.

loans.use: to pay for her husband’s advanced education fee

loans.name: Villa Conavi Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama Villa Conavi, ya que varias señoras del mismo lugar  se juntaron y conformaron el comité, actualmente se encuentran en el 5to ciclo, todas ellas son mujeres independientes y emprendedoras.
La Sra. Mirian, es una señora muy guapa, se dedica a las ventas, cuenta con una despensa en su propia casa y también hace carga de saldo de las líneas telefónicas, es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere salir adelante, es por ello que pone todo de sí para poder crecer y ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, frutas, panificado, lácteo, bebidas varias y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo y sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir luchando para crecer por su familia.
texts.en:
The group called Villa Conavi, saw a number of women from the same place get together and make up the committee, which is in their 5th loan cycle. All of them are independent and enterprising women.

Mirian is a very pretty woman who works selling. She has a store in her house and also takes payment for telephone lines. She is a very hard-working and enterprising person who wants to get ahead. For this reason she puts her all into be able to grow and help her family.

She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of fruit, vegetables, baked goods, dairy products, a variety of drinks and others. In this way she can continue with her sales as she has been doing. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to be able to continue to struggle for her family.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, bakery products, dairy products, a variety of drinks and others.

loans.name: May's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. May, 29 years old, is a Thai ethnic woman. Her family has four members, including her husband, her son and her daughter, and she. Currently, they are living in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main source of income is from cultivation and animal breeding. Each year, after harvesting and deducting all costs, the income is enough to cover the family’s living expenses and save a small amount. Her son is at primary school and she wants to invest in his education but the saved amount is not enough to pay for the education fees. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.
  	
She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time, and she hopes that the loan amount will help her son have better conditions for learning so he will have a brighter future.

loans.use: to invest in her son's education fees

loans.name: Xum's Group

texts.en:
Xum was born in 1982 and is a Thai ethnic man. He is currently living with his wife and daughter in Son La city, which is an under level of Son La province.

His family’s main income is from his wife’s civil servant salary, so it is just enough to cover the family’s living expenses and save a little amount. He wants to build a sanitary works (latrine), but the saved amount is not enough. Therefore, he wants to borrow a loan to buy materials to build the sanitary works.

He hopes the loan amount will help his family have a clean sanitary facility and that they will have a better environment for living. He will work hard to get money to repay the loan to M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to build the sanitary works (latrine).

loans.name: Thom's Group

texts.en:
Thom, born in 1974, is an Thai ethnic woman.  She joined the program of M7-MFI in January 2010. She currently lives with her husband and her two children, one daughter and one son, in Mai Son district, Son La province. 

Her family’s main income is animal breeding. Each year she can sell several pig herds and receive an income of VND 50 to 60 million. However, after deducting all the costs, the income is just enough to cover the family’s living expenses and to save a small amount. She wants to raise goats, but the saved amount is not enough to invest. Therefore, she wants to take a loan to invest in expanding into the breeding of goats.
 
She hopes the loan amount will help her family have money to invest effectively in the breeding, with high productivity, and in the coming period her family will have a goat herd with all goats plump.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the breeding of goats

loans.name: Duyen's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Duyen, a Thai ethnic woman, has joined in the program of M7-MFI since 2009. She currently lives with her husband, her husband’s parents and her two children (one son and one daughter) in Mai Son district, Son La province. 

Her family’s main income is from cultivation and animal breeding, so the income is just enough to cover the family’s living expenses and save a small amount. However, the saved amount is not enough to buy fertilizer for the coffee and the rice for the coming crop. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan to buy fertilizer for the coming crop.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time, and she hopes that the loan amount will help her have money to buy fertilizer for the coffee field and the rice field with high productivity, double again last year's yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the coming crop

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
For almost a year now, Rosalinda, 44 years of age and married to Anthony, an electrician, has been engaged in selling peanut butter in her community at Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines now. Since sustaining the family and their daily needs is a very hard thing to do, most especially as they have eight children, Rosalinda is working very hard to be able to be good enough in her craft. Aside from this, she also has a food stall where she sells barbecue and other products that help her have additional income on hand. 

Because food is considered an inevitable need of every individual, the trade Rosalinda has taken up is a very wise choice. Customers are attracted to buy since the price of the food products she sells retail is affordable. 

Now, Rosalinda wants to improve her business more. With an amount of PHP 12,000, she can certainly purchase a larger quantity of raw ingredients that she can use in creating peanut butter and other products she sells. This will surely help her have additional income and profit as well. Ahead of time, Rosalinda wants to thank you for your generosity and sincere kindness. 

All of us dream. Someday, Rosalinda wants to expand her business. She also prays for more blessings to come and as well as good health to abide in each member of their family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of raw ingredients that she can use in making peanut butter and other products she sells.

loans.name: La's Group

texts.en:
Mrs La, born in 1992, is a Thai ethnic woman. Her family has five members, including her husband, her husband’s parents and her son. Her family lives in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from cultivation and breeding; her family has 6,000 square meters of land for growing corn, for the purpose of supporting breeding. She expects that after three months she can sell the livestock and gain revenue of about VND 30 to 40 million. But after deducting all costs, the income is just enough to cover food and save a small amount. The saved amount is not enough to buy fertilizer for the coming season of corn. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan to buy fertilizer for corn trees.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time, and she hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest effectively in growing corn, with productivity half much again as in the last year.

loans.use: to borrow a loan to buy fertilizer for corn trees.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase basic grains, yogurt, and soft drinks, among other products.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 29 years old, married with 2 children and she runs a clothes shop that sells both new and used clothing along a busy street in Ibanda town. The shop has an average of UGX,3,500,000 capital. Besides selling clothes, she also has sewing machines in the shop, which she uses to train young ladies who have dropped out of school, to equip them with work skills. These two sources of income are supplemented by agricultural output, like green bananas and seasonal maize harvest that she has in a neighboring village. She has applied for a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to help her add more stock to her business. She also uses the rest of the money to pay school fees for her children. Esther is a very hard working and honest woman.

loans.use: to buy used clothing for sale

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
To be able raise income, Cecilia, 62, cooks food and sells it  within her community for almost twelve years now, at Pasay City, Philippines.  Since her husband is deceased, she has to put double effort and determination in working hard for her family. 

Filipinos love eating. They are more fond of buying food from stalls along the way just to relieve hunger. And since most families only cook and eat together at home during dinner, it is an wide-open opportunity for entrepreneurs to make food-selling business as their craft.  

With this fact, Cecilia is really wanting to cook more recipes, but she doesn't have enough capital. For this reason, she would like to take a loan amounting to 20,000 PHP to buy additional raw products to be displayed on her stall like corn, bananas, eggs and the like. This will become a great help for her in generating an increase in her profit for sure. 

Cecilia dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of his family. She also wants to see her children finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional raw products to be displayed on her stall.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Analie works hard to support her family.

She has a food processing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Analie is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business like wrappers, plastic bags, etc., for her food processing business.

Analie has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business like lumpia wrappers, etc

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 61 years old and has four children. Delia is a widow.

Delia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Delia has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Delia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for raising her livestock

loans.name: Elda

texts.en:
Elda is a woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Elda is 49 years old and has one child in school.

Elda has a vegetable farming business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Elda has been in this business for two years. In the future, Elda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is divorced with two children, He lives in Kitooma cell in Kamwenge district. 
He deals in motorcycle spare parts and simple mechanics. He has requested for a loan of UGX2,000,000 to help him buy more stock to add to his business. He hopes to grow his business and to obtain all the spare parts needed by his customers. This will increase his sales and income. He dreams of constructing a permanent house for his children. His major challenge is his customers who delay or even fail to pay after they have taken goods on credit which affects his cash flow.
Patrick is a very hard working and honest man. He appreciates the UGAFODE support and Kiva partnership.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Alan

texts.en:
This is Alan. He is 42 years old and married to Malyn. They are blessed with four children, who are currently still in school.  Together, they work diligently to provide and support all the needs of their family. To be able to do that, they operate an egg store business. Through this, they are able to earn a good profit from the trade.

Here, they buy large quantities of eggs and sell them in a retail or wholesale basis to vendors and consumers in the market. Eggs at retail cost a  minimum of PHP 5.00 while eggs per tray are sold at PHP 120 to PHP 200 approximately. They will get an income from this because eggs are highly consumed in the food industry most especially in making pastries and dishes. The same reason is applied for simple homes too. 

This is why Alan is planning to expand his business. He is requesting a PHP 50000 loan to buy additional supplies of eggs to sell in his store. The bigger supply, the better. This means a larger opportunity to sell and gain money. Alan is truly hoping that your generosity and support will help him enhance and improve his business. 

In due time, Alan wants to gradually experience progress and have a better living condition. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies of eggs to sell in his store.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Erlinda is 58 years old and has one child in school.

Erlinda has a buy-and-sell accessories business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more accessories to sell.

Erlinda has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more accessories to sell

loans.name: John Bosco

texts.en:
John Bosco is married and has four children, who are all in school. He deals in fish farming, where he derives most of his income to look after his family and to raise school tuition fees for his children. John Bosco has applied for a loan of 2,500,000 UGX to buy more fish to restock his pond. The breed of fish he wants to put in his pond is found in the Nakasongola district. He is confident that his yields will increase after stocking and he will have a strong market. John Bosco's dream is to dig many fish ponds and stock them with fish, which will help him supply the neighboring towns. He hopes to build a permanent home for his family and take his children to good schools.
He is hard working and resilient.

loans.use: to buy fish stock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies and breeding chickens.

loans.name: Erlyn

texts.en:
Erlyn is 32 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk foods, canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

Erlyn has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from farming vegetables. Erlyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk foods, canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Carolina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Desde que estas en la puerta de la casa de doña Carolina, una mujer de cuarenta y un años de edad, podes sentir el calor de la leña de su cocina artesanal donde está puesto el caldero de sus deliciosos nacatamales. Desde hace treinta años, ella inicia todos los días desde muy temprano vendiendo nacatamales de carne, cerdo y pollo. Esta esforzada mujer ya ha recibido la ayuda de Kiva y MiCrédito, está muy agradecida y confiada que siempre va a tener un buenos aliados que le ayudaran al desarrollo de su negocio.
En estos momentos, Carolina, está segura de que puede producir más porque sus clientes demandan más, es por eso que ella ha vuelto a recurrir a Kiva junto MiCrédito, para que se le brinde un préstamo con el que pueda comprar todo su materia prima, por ejemplo: carne, cerdo, pollo, tomates, chiltomas, cebollas, maíz, entre muchos otros ingredientes. En un futuro desea poner un negocio más grande donde ofrezca comida variada.
texts.en:
Once you are inside the door of Carolina's house, a 41 year old woman, you can feel the warmth of her artisan stove which has a cauldron of natatamales (traditional Nicaraguan food) cooking on it. For 30 years she has started every day very early selling beef, pork and chicken nacatamales.

This vigorous woman has received the help of Kiva and MiCrédito and she is very grateful and confident that she will always have such a good alliances that help her develop her business. At this time Carolina is sure that she can produce more as her clients are demanding more. For this reason she has returned to Kiva together with MiCrédito so they can award her a loan so she can buy all her raw material such as : beef, pork, chicken, tomatoes, green peppers, onions, corn amongst many other ingredients. in the future she wants to have a larger business where she can offer a variety of dishes.

loans.use: to buy her raw material, for example, beef, pork, chicken, tomatoes, green peppers, onions, corn amongst many other ingredients.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Gina works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell frozen goods business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling personal care products. Gina is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more frozen goods to sell like hotdogs, etc. for her buy-and-sell frozen goods business.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more frozen goods to sell like hotdogs, etc.

loans.name: Jessa

texts.en:
Jessa is 21 years old with two children. She works very hard to provide for them. Jessa runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, home care products and other groceries.

Jessa has been in this business for six years now.  In the future, Jessa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Ma. Cristina

texts.en: Ma. Cristina, 25 years old, has two children, and she works very hard to provide for them. For the past 4 years, Ma. Cristina has run a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as canned goods, home care products and other groceries to sell. In the future, Ma. Cristina  would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items such as canned goods, home care products and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 59 years old and married. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past 10 years, Marilou has run a general store in the Philippines. She also earns an income from tailoring. Marilou has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as beverages, cigarettes, canned goods, personal care products and other groceries to sell.

Marilou has previously borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF. Marilou aspires to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy items such as beverages, cigarettes, canned goods, personal care products and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha, 54 years old, is from the village of Khabume. He has pensioner parents, a wife, two daughters and a son. His children are temporarily unemployed and Gocha and his wife work hard to make good living conditions for themselves. The main source of income for this large family is from agribusiness. In order to tackle their financial difficulties, Gocha and his wife are engaged in cattle breeding and cultivating a plot of agricultural land, where they grow nuts and maize. Gocha earns some income from selling cheese, maize and nuts at the local market; however, he finds it hard to achieve financial stability as the income is mostly seasonal. 

Gocha has a great desire to start his own stable activity and thus requested a loan from local financial institutions. Gocha’s request was approved within the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, which gives poor people a chance to start or restart businesses. Gocha will use the requested money to purchase a car and start a taxi business. He will serve local people and generate his own income. The loan will greatly assist Gocha and his family members, as he will get the chance to satisfy his family’s increased needs. Gocha awaits your support.

loans.use: To purchase a car and start a taxi business

loans.name: Darejani

texts.en:
Darejani is a 58-year-old single woman from Tskaltubo District. She lives alone and in poverty as she has no source of income to tackle her financial difficulties. 

Darejani needs assistance to satisfy even basic needs and somehow make financial stability for herself. She has sought credit among local financial institutions, but was rejected each time as the creditors didn’t find enough family income to be sufficient to approve the loan.  

The start-up program, that was created by Kiva and Credo, enabled her to get the loan to start a trading business. Darejani will purchase stocks of clothing and home products at wholesale prices and will sell these at increased prices in her community. She will get private orders also and have her own loyal customers. 

The loan will greatly assist Darejani as she will be involved in her own activity and generate some income. Darejani is thankful to Kiva lenders for the financial support and kindness.

loans.use: To trade clothing and home products

loans.name: Daniel Del Cristo

texts.es:
Daniel, de 40 años, tiene muy claro que es lo que quiere para su vida y está decidido a salir adelante y tener una buena vida al lado de su familia.

El desea desempeñarse como proveedor de servicios de lavandería en el municipio de Chinu.
Esta actividad desea iniciarla con el afán de buscar los recursos necesarios para su sostenimiento y el de sus 4 hijos
Es un hombre emprendedor y muy disciplinado.

El solicita un crédito para comprar 2 lavadoras y una moto con carretilla para poder transportarlas a los lugares donde requieran de sus servicios.

Tiene la esperanza de poder progresar como empresario y tener unos ingresos más estables y agradece a todas las personas que puedan contribuir con su sueño.
texts.en:
Daniel, who is 40 years old, has a clear vision of what he wants for his life, and he is dedicated to succeeding and having a good life along with his family.

He wants to become a provider of laundry services in the city of Chinu. He wants to start this business with the goal of finding the resources he needs to support himself and his 4 children. He is an enterprising and very disciplined man.

He is requesting a loan to buy 2 washing machines and a motorcycle with a sidecar to transport them to sites where his services are needed.

He hopes to be able to progress as a businessman and to have a more stable income. He is thankful to all the people who are able to contribute to his dream.

loans.use: to buy 2 washing machines and a motorcycle with a sidecar to transport them to sites where his services are needed

loans.name: The Group

texts.en: The is a 45-year-old married rice farmer with two children in her care. She resides in the Tbong Khmum province in Cambodia. She has cultivated rice over the past 17 years. Her husband is a 52-year-old farmer, and he is also a worker. Together, they can earn approximately $11.70 each day. Now The, the group leader, would like to request a group loan with three members (one of the three members is in the hospital, giving a birth to a baby and the man is her husband). She will use her portion to buy foundation parts to build a latrine. With this loan, she will be able to have enough finances to build a latrine and live in hygienic conditions. In the future, she is going to expand her farmland, renovate her house, and help her children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy foundation parts to build a latrine.

loans.name: Roselda

texts.en:
Roselda is 38 years old and is married with three children.

Roselda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, bread, soft drinks, spices, coffee, milk, sugar, cooking oil, etc.

Roselda has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Roselda aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, bread, soft drinks, spices, coffee, milk, sugar, cooking oil, etc

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lorna works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Lorna is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy fish nets for her fishing business and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Luzviminda works hard to support her family. She has a vegetable farming business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from bicycle transport.  She is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her vegetable farming business.

Luzviminda has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane is 38 years old and is married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell, such as bread, canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, coffee, soft-drinks, etc. Mary Jane has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from raising pigs. Mary Jane aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, such as bread, canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, coffee, soft-drinks, etc.

loans.name: Judelyn

texts.en:
Judelyn is 27 years old, and a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a business buying and selling used clothing in the Philippines. 

Judelyn has requested a loan of 16,000 PHP, through NWTF, to buy more stock of used clothing to sell to her customers.

Judelyn has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of used clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Vaghinak

texts.en:
Vaghinak is a farmer who lives in Ijevan city in the Tavush region. For five years already, he has been a farmer, but before he worked at the gas station, then as a worker but now all his time is spent on the care of his nice farm. He manages all the work here with his retired mother and wife. His three children are still school-aged and only after finishing their lessons they manage to do some work in the farm with their family. In his farm Vaghinak has a lot of chickens, rabbits and two cows. So he sells a lot of eggs, poultry and rabbit, milk and macun (national dairy-products). Vaghinak also seasonally goes to the Russian Federation to work abroad to enlarge his family income. 

He hopes that Kiva lenders will help him with this loan, which he plans to spend on the purchase of several pigs(he wants to start swine breeding) and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to purchase several pigs and also fodder for all his farm cattle

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a 48-year-old, married woman with three children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Monica has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle. Monica has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Monica would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Milagros, 57 years old, is married and has five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past ten years, Milagros has operated a tailoring business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials such as scissors, needles, thread, fabric, etc. In the future, Milagros would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials such as scissors, needles, thread, fabric, etc. for her business

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en: Sonia, 47 years old, is married and has four children. For the past two years, she has been raising pigs in the Philippines. Sonia also earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear. Sonia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock. She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 50 years old, married with four children, 3 of which are still at school.

Francisca is in the agricultural business, buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell.

Francisca has been buying and selling livestock for 15 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Francisca would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Nasly Del Carmen

texts.es:
Nasly, una madre de 32 años de edad con 2 hijos a su cuidado, es madre responsable y ha podido sostener a su numerosa familia gracias a que trabaja como productora agropecuaria en la finca que comparte con su esposo. 

Solicita un crédito para iniciar su propio negocio, una pequeña empresa que iniciaría con cerdos pequeños cuales criara y alimentara en un chiquero, la iniciativa la tomo básicamente por sus hijos porque quiere disfrutar con ellos de una mejor vida, que estudien y que todos los días tengan un motivo para sonreír. 

Por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de cerdos, y materiales como madera para la construcción de una marranera.

Apoyen a esta empresaria que quiere demostrar que el papel de madre y padre no le queda pequeño solo necesita tu voto de confianza
texts.en:
Nasly is a 32-year-old mother with 2 children in her care. She is a responsible mother, and has been able to support her large family because she works as a farmer on the plantation that she shares with her husband.

She is requesting a loan to start her own business, a small enterprise that she will start with little pigs that she will raise and feed in a pigsty. She took this initiative for her children, basically, because she wants to enjoy a better life with them: so that they can go to school and have a reason to smile everyday.

For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy pigs and materials, such as wood, to build a pigsty.

Support this businesswoman who wants to show that being a mother and father is no small role. She just needs your vote of confidence!

loans.use: to buy pigs and materials, such as wood, to build a pigsty

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seedlings and organic fertilizers, and hire labor

loans.name: Dali

texts.en:
Dali is 60-year-old woman from the village of Narazeni. She has only one son who gets monthly assistance for his illness. The family has very poor living conditions and lives under poverty.  Dali gets a pension for their exile. Also, she has a small agricultural activity and sells products locally. Dali can’t satisfy even the basic needs of her family and requires financial support to expand her agribusiness. 

According to the above-mentioned situation, she lacks access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting a business, as they require stable income and business experience.  The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Dali to get a loan of 2,000 GEL. She will purchase cattle and after raising them, will start milking them. Dali will sell cheese and yogurt at a good price and will be able to generate additional income and take care of her son. The family’s living conditions will be improved. Regarding Kiva lenders, Dali will be very grateful for their support and kindness.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and expand her agribusiness

loans.name: Irakli

texts.en:
Irakli, who is a 25-year-old young man, lives in Tbilisi, the capital of Georgia. He has a wife who is temporarily unemployed. Irakli works at the store and gets a fixed salary. In order to make his activity more productive and give his wife a better style of life, Irakli wants to start an additional business in his free time. He received the credit in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo - Startup Program that gives people the chance to start or re-start businesses. 

With the received credit, Irakli decided to purchase a secondhand car and start providing a taxi service. He will work as a taxi driver during his free time and generate additional income that will help him to meet all his family expenses more effectively.

Irakli and his wife await your support and kindness, as their income will significantly increase because of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy a secondhand car and start a taxi business

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia is a 38-year-old married woman, from Tbilisi City, the capital of Georgia. She lives with mother, husband, sister and brother-in-law.  

Two family members have their own activities, but Maia and her husband are temporarily unemployed and require a source of income to get financial independence. Maia requested a loan among local credit providers for starting their own business. According to the above mentioned situation, she lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions as they require stable income and business experience.  

The startup program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Maia to get a loan of $850 USD to install gas in her husband's car; he will work as a taxi driver and generate some income. 

The business will be a great support to this young couple, as they will get the chance to earn their own income and cover even basic needs. After starting the business activity and making some savings, Maia plans to invest money in the agribusiness and develop trading with agricultural products. 

This motivated couple rely on the goodwill of Kiva lenders and will be very grateful for the assistance.

loans.use: To install gas in her husband's car and earn a source of income

loans.name: Niaz

texts.en:
Niaz is a married man, from a small village Nakhiduri. He lives with his parents, wife and little son. Niaz is busy with a small scale agricultural business. He has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for agricultural business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected all the time because of his low income. The only source of income for the family is monthly income from their agricultural business. They cultivate potatoes and vegetables seasonally and sell locally. The income is hardly enough for food for a five member family. 

According to Credo estimates, the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category. Niaz requested a loan from Credo and was approved in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to the rural poor, who do not have access to credit products and who are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Niaz plans to purchase a mini-bus, which he will use for trading with the harvested products through other districts. Niaz and his wife will sell products door-to-door and generate more income.

This new business initiative, financed with a Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the income and the family members will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a mini-bus and start trading in other districts

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, 37 years old, is divorced and has 4 children and 2 dependants (her parents), whom she is taking care of because they are aged. Grace deals in retail sales and owns a bar which mostly sells local brew processed from her banana plants. She has managed to look after her family and has paid school fees for the two of her children attending school.

Grace is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX  to buy a plot of land in her neighborhood on which she plans to construct her residential house. Grace’s major challenge is rent, which is too high, yet her sales are low. Grace wants to construct a permanent house for her family and also see all her children attend formal education. She is honest and hardworking. Grace appreciates Kiva and Ugafode support.

loans.use: To pay for a plot of land

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 40 years old and a widow with four children. She comes from Kyaruhimbi cell and operates a retail shop in Ibanda town where she gets her daily income to take care of her family's basic needs. She has requested a loan of UGX 1,500,000 to help her boost her business and buy daily household use items like sugar, bread, soap and beverages. She will use the rest of the money to pay school fees for her children. 

Her major challenge is the lack of enough capital to run her business and pay other expenses like rent. Rose is a very hardworking and honest woman. She appreciates the support.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her retail shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: compra de mas chatarra, plástico, papel, cobre, hierro entre otros

loans.name: To

texts.en:
To is a 49-year-old married fish seller who resides in Siem Reap Province in Cambodia. He has been in the fish selling business since 2000. His wife is 56 years old, and she is also a fish seller and sells porridge as well. Together, they can earn around $10.50 per day.

He would like to buy a motorcycle to carry fish to sell at the market, but he lacks the finances to do so, so he is requesting a loan. With this loan, he will be able to improve his mode of traveling and reduce his traveling expenses. In the future, he is going to save money to open a small business in his house, and he will be able to renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to carry fish to sell at the market

loans.name: Ernadale

texts.en:
Ernadale, 53 years old, is from the town of Badian, Cebu. For the past eight years, she has operated a sari-sari (convenience) store in her community. Ernadale sells basic household items such as detergent, seasonings, toiletries, chips, canned goods, rice and soft drinks. The income that she earns allows her to send her 14-year-old daughter to school and also helps her husband, who is a carpenter. 

Ernadale is asking for a loan to buy more items such as coffee, sugar, toiletries, canned goods, noodles, insect repellent, rice and eggs. These items sell well. She will use her profits for her child's school fees and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, toiletries, canned goods, noodles, insect repellent, rice and eggs

loans.name: Benedicto

texts.en:
Benedicto operates a tricycle transportation service. He transport passengers from one barrio to remote areas. He is a 53-year-old married man with three children from Talibon, Bohol. His youngest child is 20 years old. To be able to continue operate his livelihood, he decided to take a loan. 

He is asking for a loan to be able to pay for business permit, franchise fee, and other necessary requirements. These are essential tools in order for Benedicto to continue to operate his livelihood. In this way, he could freely transport customers from one place to another without hassles. In this way his earnings will improve.

He is hoping that his business would be successful in the near future.

loans.use: to be able to pay for  business permit,  franchise fee, and other necessary requirements

loans.name: Malak

texts.en:
Malak is a 25-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her parents and three siblings. She is working hardly, and trying her best to be as helpful as she can in her family; she helps her siblings fulfill their daily needs. 

She started her own job at an early age. She opened a beauty salon in her house seven years ago. She has her loyal customers, and she is glad with the results she has attained so far. 

Today, Malek is looking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase new tools for her business, such as a hairdryer. 

In this way, she will be able to serve her customers with good results. In the future, she plans to open her own beauty center.

loans.use: to purchase new tools for her business such, as a hairdryer

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 51 years old and has seven children. Vivian is married and two of her children are in school.

Vivian is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Vivian requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Vivian has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Vivian would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Eugenia is 51 years old and married with four children. With four children are currently in school, Eugenia works very hard to provide for them.

Eugenia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, cooking oil, noodles, spices, milk, sugar, coffee and other personal product care items.

Eugenia has been in this business for 3 years. 

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, cooking oil, noodles, spices, milk, sugar, coffee and other personal product care items.

loans.name: Ambrocia

texts.en:
Ambrocia is a 57-year-old married woman with one child who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Ambrocia has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items, such as soft drinks, canned goods, diapers and school supplies, to sell.

Ambrocia has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items, such as soft drinks, canned goods, diapers and school supplies, to sell.

loans.name: Quirina

texts.en:
Quirina is 50 years old, married with two children.

Quirina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like snack foods, canned goods, soft-drinks, coffee, noodles, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

Quirina has borrowed and paid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from raising chicken.

Quirina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like snack foods, canned goods, soft-drinks, coffee, noodles, detergent soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married, and she works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Josephine is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of clothing to resell to customers.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothing to resell to customers.

loans.name: Eduard

texts.en:
Eduard is 27-year-old hard-working man, who lives in Bolnisi District. He has a housekeeper wife, little daughter and pensioner grandmother. 

Eduard works hard to make good living conditions for his family members. In spite of his high education, Eduard was unable to start a stable job, so in order to earn a living he started private activities. 

In particular, he is in agribusiness where he is engaged in cattle and pig-breeding, beekeeping, and cultivating agricultural land where he harvests maize and potatoes. He sells his agricultural products at the local market. In addition, he is a private artisan of wood, getting private orders from local people and generating additional income. 

Mostly, he is employed with agribusiness and has a great desire to make it wider and start dairy farming. He will also start producing cheese and yogurt for trading and for family-use. 

Eduard has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions for informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

The loan will greatly assist Eduard as he will be able to run his lovely business in a more profitable way making better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and start dairy farming

loans.name: Marina Isabel

texts.es:
Marina es una mujer de campo y madre de 6 hijos por los que ha tenido que pasar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando con su familia.
Desde hace tiempo ha querido montar un negocio de cría y venta de cerdos en el municipio de Momil.

Es por eso que solicita un gran aliento económico para comprar algunos cerdos para cría y alimento para los mismos.

Con este nuevo negocio podrá generar ingresos para su familia que es todo para ella y podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su esposo y sus hijos.

Trabajara todos los días para impulsar su negocio y hacerlo una actividad sostenible y rentable.

Apoya a una mujer trabajadora con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Marina is a woman from the country, and the mother of 6 children, for whom she has had to face many adversities in her life. However, she has always had the strength to fight on through and continue moving forward with her family.

For some time now, she has wanted to start a business raising and selling pigs in the city of Momil. Because of this, she is requesting major economic support to buy some pigs to raise and feed.

Through this new business, she will be able to generate an income for her family, who are everything to her. She will be able to improve the quality of life for her husband and children.

She will work every day to drive her business and make it a sustainable and profitable occupation.

Support this hard-working woman with a loan!

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise and feed

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is a 56-year-old married woman, with eight children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Laura runs a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP, through NWTF, to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Laura has previously borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for 2 years, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Laura aspires to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Cristian David

texts.es:
Cristian es un joven muy emprendedor y creativo, desde hace mucho tiempo ha querido ser independiente y tener su propio negocio de restaurante.

Actualmente puede materializar su sueño gracias su gran capacidad de trabajo, al apoyo que recibe de la Corporación Interactuar y de las personas que deseen que él salga adelante con su negocio.

De este negocio dependerán su compañera sentimental y sus estudios.

Solicita un apoyo económico para comprar insumos para la preparación de alimentos, horno, sillas, mesas, y en general todo el entable necesario para el montaje de su negocio.

Con un préstamo podrás a poyar a un joven lleno de vida y empuje para su familia!
texts.en:
Cristian is a very enterprising, creative, young man, who has wanted to be independent and have his own restaurant business for a long time.

Now he can make his dream a reality, thanks to his great capacity for work, and the support that he receives from Interactuar Corporation and people who want him to move forward with his business. His life partner and his education will depend on his business.

He is requesting a loan to purchase supplies for food preparation, an oven, chairs, tables, and in general, all the start-up materials that are necessary for setting up his business. 

With a loan, you will be able to support a young man who is full of life and drive for his family.
,

loans.use: to purchase supplies for food preparation, an oven, chairs, tables, and in general, all that is necessary for setting up his business.

loans.name: Sisinia

texts.en:
Sisinia is 46 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Sisinia is borrowing PHP 9000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Sisinia has been farming vegetables for 5 years and also earns additional income from vegetable vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Tamila

texts.en:
Tamila, 51 years old, lives in the Kaspi district. She has a pensioner mother and works as a saleslady at a newspaper cabin. Tamila earns a small income that is hardly enough to satisfy even the basic needs of the family. Due to this financial situation, Tamila decided to be involved in her own business, parallel to her work, in order to generate additional income. 

Tamila needs financial support to purchase stocks of clothing and stationery items which she will sell in her community at increased prices. She couldn’t receive a loan from the local financial institutions because of their requirements to have business experience or sufficient income. The Start Up program, a joint product of Kiva and Credo, allows poor people like Tamila to get a chance for starting or restarting a business. Tamila will sell clothing and stationery and make savings for her family's welfare. She awaits your support and kindness.

loans.use: To start selling clothing and stationery items

loans.name: Lamzira

texts.en:
Lamzira is 45 years old and married from the Tskaltubo district. She has a son, pensioner mother-in-law and husband, who works as a private artisan. Lamzira works on family-owned agricultural land and sells some products locally. She generates 200 GEL per month, approximately. However, the family finds it hard to satisfy even the basic needs and Lamzira decided to expand her agribusiness and make her work more productive for her family. 

She requested a loan from local financial institutions and received credit in the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, the Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. Lamzira will purchase a dairy cow with the received credit and will start selling cheese at the local market. She will also use milk products for her family's needs.
 
With support of the Start Up program, Lamzira will get an opportunity to expand her own business and tackle the financial difficulties. She awaits Kiva lenders' support and kindness.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow and start producing milk products

loans.name: Guram

texts.en:
Guram is a 59-year-old man, from Tbilisi city, the capital of Georgia. He has a pensioner mother, a wife and three sons. All family members are temporarily unemployed and the only breadwinner is his wife, who works at the local bakery and gets a small income. The family has poor living conditions, because they have no source of significant income. 

Guram wants to make his bit to tackle the financial difficulties and start his own business. He has found a car and wishes to purchase it, and start providing taxi service through the town. His loan request was rejected several times, as the creditors didn’t find enough family-income to be sufficient to approve the loan. Finally Guram has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. 

The startup loan program provides business startup loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will greatly assist Guram, and he will be able to improve his economic situation and give his family a better style of life.  He thanks Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a car and start providing taxi service.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina KUÑA KATUPYRY es un grupo nuevo, están en el primer ciclo con 16 (dieciséis) integrantes. Todas con espíritu emprendedor y ganas de superación, son mujeres emprendedoras, que están luchando por poder salir adelante y ayudar a sus seres queridos.
La Sra. Juana quien conforma el comité se la distingue por su espíritu activo y emprendedurismo, es de una familia humilde y muy solidaria, se desempeña como modista, hace trabajos de todo tipo ya sea arreglos, modificaciones y por supuesto confecciones de nuevas prendas.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, gomas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus confecciones como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de ser alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
The committee called Kuña Katupyry is a new group. They are in their first loan cycle and have 16 members. All of them have an entrepreneurial spirit and are eager to succeed. They are enterprising women, who are fighting to succeed and help their loved ones.

Juana is one member of the group and stands out for her active and enterprising spirit. She comes from a humble and very tight-nit family. She works as a tailor, doing projects of all kinds, whether that be repairs, modifications, or of course, making new pieces of clothing.

She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of fabric, thread, rubber bands, and other things, so that she can continue her projects as she currently does. She is thankful for the opportunity she has received to be someone in life.

loans.use: to buy cloth, thread, rubber bands, etc.

loans.name: Khaticha

texts.en: Khatija is an active woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1967. She is living in a small town with her family. For almost seven years, she has been working at a school cleaning the land. She is poor and her annual income is not enough to have good living conditions. She is a generous, responsible and kind person. Khatija is well known among school workers and friends. She does her duty very well and her employer is satisfied with her. She wanted to live better and asked for a loan from Kiva lenders to renovate her apartment. She is hoping to be supported and awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To renovate her apartment

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is thankful that she was granted a 11,000 PHP loan which she used to buy materials like fish net and other supplies to makes laundry brush nets to sell. Her earnings helped to send her children to school and to meet their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for a 15,000 PHP loan which she will use to pay for rolled fish nets, thread and other materials to make more laundry brush nets to sell. Her regular members are her neighbors and the local community. She is thankful both to God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her, and her good sales from this loan will surely cover their daily sustenance and fund her children's education. 

Lucy dreams of developing her business to improve her income. She aims to send her children to college to allow them to have better opportunities in life. 

Every week Lucy meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials to make laundry brush nets.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 51 years old and is married with three children ages 11, 13 and 15. Her family resides in Badian, Cebu. Vilma sells fish for a living. She sells her husband’s catch and also from other fishermen. Vilma has applied for a loan to buy a new fishing nets and a new fishing boat. 

This is her way to ensure daily fishing and to replace the old fishing net. This will help her husband to catch more and they will earn better. Vilma will use their income to send her children to school and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and a new boat.

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Monina works hard to support her family.

She has a rickshaw transport business in the Philippines. Monina is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase an additional rickshaw unit for her business.

Monina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional rickshaw unit for her business

loans.name: Ma. Elezabeth

texts.en:
Ma. Elezabeth is 48 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Elezabeth is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Ma. Elezabeth has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Raponcil

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Raponcil works hard to support her family. She has a direct sales business, selling Avon products in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from food vending. Raponcil is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more products from Avon to sell to her customers. 

Raponcil has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more products from Avon to sell to her customers

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.en:
Aquilina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling dried coconut meat in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years and earns additional income from raising chickens and food vending.

Aquilina successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell. Aquilina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Leonida is 56 years old and has two children who are in school.

Leonida has a welding shop business in the Philippines. Leonida requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy equipment for her business.

Leonida has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Leonida would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build an electric pump at their home.

loans.name: Iamze

texts.en: Iamze, who is a 42-year-old married woman, lives in Kutaisi city with her family members. Her husband works at a building company and gets a fixed salary. As Iamze was unable to start any stable job, she started trading in clothing and sells it door-to-door in order to get her own income. The job is hard for her and she has a great desire to start another more profitable business. Iamze requested a loan from local financial institutions but was approved within the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provisions to business start-up credits, which don't have access to regular financial institutions. Iamze has been approved for a loan of 2000 USD and plans to use it to open a store of fruits and vegetables at the local market and get a stable source of income. She will sell various kinds of fresh products and will offer them to local people and passersby as well. With the help of Kiva lenders she will have the chance to make significant income for her family's welfare and her children's good education. Iamze awaits your support.

loans.use: To open a store for fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Carlita

texts.en:
Carlita is 58 years old and married with two children. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Carlita has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She has been in pig fattening for four years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Carlita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 42 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Rosemary works very hard to provide for them.

Rosemary runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Rosemary has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items, such as shampoo, sugar, detergent soap, juice, beer, candies, etc.

In the future, Rosemary would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Dúo Hombres De Valor Group

texts.es: EL SEÑOR MAYCON JORDAN es originario de patzicia, El se dedica a la elaboración de cajas de madera para empaque de verduras como lechuga,  rábanos, remolacha, apio etc. es la actividad a la que se dedica y gracias a Dios tiene demanda, el quieren aprovechar que tienen varios pedidos ya que cuando empieza la competencia ya no hay mucho negocio por esa razón solicita su crédito para poder invertir y cubrir los pedidos que tiene y así poder obtener ganancias que le va a servir más adelante  para otro negocio ya que tiene en planes cultivar verduras que primeramente Dios estará realizando lo que desea.
texts.en: Mr. Mayco Jordan is original from Patzicia. He works building wood crates to package vegetables such as lettuce, radishes, cabbage, celery, etc. He is committed to this activity and he gives thanks to God that it is in demand. He wants to take advantage that he has several orders because when the competition starts, there is not much business. Therefore, he is asking for a loan to invest in and cover his current orders,  to obtain profits that he can utilize in the future for another business. He has plans to grow vegetables, and he mainly thinks that this will be God's will.

loans.use: To buy wood to build crates to transport vegetables.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.en: Enrique is 52 years old and works as a veterinarian. He also has a small retail shop were he sells products for pets. He is asking for a loan to buy inventory for his store, such as pet food and accessories. He also provides training for pets. He says that he has been doing this work for more than 20 years and his biggest achievement is providing financial stability for his family.

loans.use: to buy pet products to sell.

loans.name: Seda

texts.en:
Seda, 49 years old, lives in the village of Ddamashen in the Gegharkunik region. Seda is a mother of five very clever and nice children. One of her sons and two of her daughters are already married and live with their families. All the family is mainly busy with farming and agriculture but since the family is large, Seda’s husband also earns some income from working abroad seasonally in the Russian Federation. 

Seda’s youngest daughter is a student and, in the future, she will become an educator. Seda says that she likes the profession that her daughter chose and she would like her daughter to stay and work in their village school as a teacher after graduation, since there is really a lack of teachers in the village. Seda is asking for this loan as she must pay her daughter’s tuition fees for the second semester. Seda and her daughter thank Kiva lenders in advance for the loan which they really hope to receive.

loans.use: to pay her daughter’s tuition fees for the second semester

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 41 years old, married, and has three children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Raquel has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies for her pigs.

Raquel has been in pig fattening for 15 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Hrachik

texts.en:
Hrachik, 57 years old, lives in the city of Kadjaran in the Syunik region. Hrachik has vocational skills and worked for a long time at the Kapan city’s combine as a locksmith. He works at his city’s combine as a tractor driver. Hrachik is married and has two sons who are both married and living with their families. Hrachik now lives with his wife who is unemployed. 

Hrachik will be thankful if Kiva lenders help him with this loan amount since has some health problems which he is unable to solve now since he has a lack of money. Since he is the only breadwinner in his family, Hrachik really needs this loan which can return him to his usual active life and back to his beloved work.

loans.use: to solve some health problems and to return to his beloved work

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Anecita is 57 years old now.

Anecita has a buy and sell copra business in the Philippines. Anecita requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more copra to sell.

Anecita has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Anecita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more copra to sell

loans.name: Sevak

texts.en:
Sevak lives in the village Ddmashen of Gegharkunik region. He is married and has two sons. Now, Sevak’s wife temporally lives and works abroad, so Sevak cares for his sons, his house and farm alone. In 2009 Sevak bought a tractor and some land cultivation equipment. He takes orders from his villagers to doing different work on their land on his tractor. 

Sevak also has farm cattle (cows, a calf, a bull, pigs, sheep and chickens) of which his sons greatly help him.  They sell his farm’s milk, meat, and eggs mainly to his neighbors, and they have some of it left for his family’s use. 

As Sevak mentions, his family’s main income comes from his tractor services and he tries always to keep it in order.  With this loan of 700,000 AMD, Sevak must buy tires for his tractor and also some spare parts for it.

loans.use: to buy tires and some spare parts for his tractor.

loans.name: Consorcia

texts.en:
Consorcia is 62 years old and has four children. Consorcia is a married woman.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Consorcia has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Consorcia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Yermonya

texts.en: Yermonya, her husband, and her nice daughter live in the village of Ddmashen in Gegharkunik region. This family has no other occupation than farming and agriculture. Consequently, they have no other source of income than farming. They care for each cow on their farm properly, because it is only through the income the cows bring that they are able to provide their only daughter with minimal living conditions. Yermonya has a higher education and the specialty of a psychologist, but she never managed to work in her specialty. So she hopes that her daughter will be more successful and be able to work in her chosen field. Now Yermonya’s daughter is 18 years old and a student. Yermonya is asking for this loan to pay for her daughter’s tuition fee for the second semester. She is hopeful that Kiva lenders will notice and understand the importance of this loan, and support her with it.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s tuition fee for the second semester

loans.name: Nune

texts.en:
Nune, 43 years old, lives in the city of Kapan in the Syunik region. Nune has higher education, having graduated from the Polytechnic Institute. For several years, she worked at the post office. She is also employed as a secretary at a private company. Nune is married and has two sons (her older son is in the army and the younger one is school-aged). Nune’s husband is a driver at a military unit. 

In the nearby village of Geghi, Nune finds time to be busy with land cultivation. Here she cultivates potatoes, carrots, cucumbers, tomatoes and greens. In her fruit garden, there are nice apple, apricot and cherry trees. She sells all the harvest to resellers and, of course, takes some part of it for her family.
