Nune has asked for this loan as, with the coming of spring, she wants to repair the fence of her fruit garden. She will also buy vegetable seedlings and young apple and apricot trees.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seedlings and young apple and apricot trees and to repair the fruit garden's fence

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fruits to sell.

loans.name: Nerma

texts.en:
Nerma is 27 years old and has two children. Nerma is married and one of her children is currently in school.

Nerma is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Nerma requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Nerma has been in pig fattening for seven years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nerma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 40 years old with one child in school, Marissa works very hard to provide for them.

Marissa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, canned good, home product care and other groceries.

Marissa has been in this business for 4 years now. 

In the future, Marissa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, canned good, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Virginita

texts.en:
As a parent of two children, Virginita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell meat business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables. Virginita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more meat to sell in her food stall.

Virginita has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more meat to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Sargis

texts.en:
Sargis is happy and thankful for his first Kiva and Nor Horizon support, and he greatly hopes for his second deal with them. Sargis lives in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region with his wife and two daughters. Sargis’ daughters are still students; his elder daughter studies at the Yerevan State University in the faculty of Government and Economics, while his younger daughter studies at the Yerevan State Pedagogical Institute at the faculty of Fine Arts. 

He says he is very happy that his daughters have a chance of having higher education, but still, the lack of finances does not allow Sargis to solve the problem of their tuition fees easily. So this time, Sargis hopes to receive his Kiva loan in an amount of 400,000 AMD, in order both to pay his elder and smaller daughters’ tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay his elder and smaller daughters’ tuition fees.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is a 29 year old woman with three children, two of which are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a charcoal making business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase coconut shells and plastic to use for her business.

Eliza has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Eliza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase coconut shells and plastic to use for her business

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Lucinda works hard to support her family.

She has a raising pigs business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Lucinda is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Lucinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Garegin

texts.en:
Garegin, with his wife and son, lives in the village Ddmashen of Gegharkunik region. He has vocational education. For several years he worked at the poultry factory, and now he works at the city’s electrician networks as an electrician, and he simultaneously does farming. 

In his farm, Garegin has cows, bulls, a pig, sheep and chickens. He has farm products such as milk, curd, macun (national dairy-product), meat and eggs. Potato cultivation is also profitable for his farm, and he sells at the city’s wholesale market to re-sellers. 

Garegin greatly wants to make his farm richer with cattle. He especially wants to sell more meat. With this loan of 500,000 AMD, Garegin wants to buy a calf, a cow, and three sheep for his farm.

loans.use: to buy a calf, a cow, and three sheep for his farm.

loans.name: Vano

texts.en:
Vano is 50 years old and lives in Stepanavan city of Lori region. Vano is married, and he has a year-old daughter. Vano has already been engaged for 25 years in construction work in his city. Since he is already a master in his work, he is already famous in the whole Lori region. He is also a good tiler.

Vano has a lot of orders, so he starts his work very early in the morning and returns home late at night. As Vano says, he does any construction work by order in a way that he would do it in his house for his family’s comfort. That is why his work turns out to be cute, nice, and of high quality.

He says the results can be much better if he could refresh his tools. He asks for this Kiva loan, as he wants to buy a new electric machine for tile-cutting, and also an assortment of tools that he uses every day during his work.

loans.use: to buy a new electric machine for tile-cutting, and also an assortment of tools.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 49 years old, and six of her children are in school.

Yolanda has a vegetables farming business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Yolanda has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 41 years old and has five children, three of which are in school. 

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Vilma has been in this business for 1 year now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is a 29 year old married woman, with four children, two of which are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ana Marie has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell.

Ana Marie has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, Ana Marie would like to save enough to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a 52 year old married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Carmelita has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Carmelita has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Carmelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is a 63 year old married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell.

Cresencia has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Cresencia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a 50 year old married woman with five children, one of which is still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Delia requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Delia has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Delia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert, with his wife, two sons, and retired mother, lives at the frontier village Vazashen of Tavush region. He earns his family’s living by farming, agricultural activities, and also with the help of seasonal work abroad at the Russian Federation. 

In his farm Albert has only 20 chickens, but he also has a big land on which he cultivates potatoes, beans, corn and carrots. He also has good harvests from his fruit garden with apples, figs, persimmons, peaches and apricots. His wife sells all of these goods at the city’s wholesale market to her customers from the city or to re-sellers. 

Albert wants to make his farm richer with cattle. He especially wants to start swine breeding. In order to start it, he wants the help of a Kiva loan to buy several pigs, fodder for them and he will also use the money that is left for his spring sowing activities.

loans.use: to buy several pigs, fodder for them, and also to organize spring sowing activities.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 50 years old, married, and has five children, two of whom are in school. Editha works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, and other groceries.

Editha has been in this business for 20 years now. 

In the future, Editha would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Claudette

texts.en:
Claudette is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Claudette is 34 years old and both of her children are in school.

Claudette has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Claudette requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional unit of motorcycle for her business.

Claudette has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Claudette would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional unit of motorcycle for her business

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 51 years old and married with six children. With one child in school, Milagros works very hard to provide for them.

Milagros runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, beverages, canned goods, personal product care and other groceries.

Milagros has been in this business for 3 years now. 

In the future, Milagros would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, beverages, canned goods, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a 50 year old married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Nenita has a bakery business in the Philippines. Nenita requested a PHP 22000 loan amount through NWTF to buy flour and others ingredients for her business.

Nenita has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Nenita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy flour and others ingredients for her business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell spices business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.  Evelyn is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to buy more spices to sell.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more spices to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 47 years old and married with two children. With two children in school, Evelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Evelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, spicies and other groceries.

Evelyn has been in this business for 4 years now. 

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, spicies and other groceries

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is 44 years old and married with two children.

Isabel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, spices and other groceries.

Isabel has borrowed and paid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 18 years and also earns an income from buying and selling vegetables.

Isabel aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, spices and other groceries

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 53 years old and has seven children. Milagros is married and has one child in school.

Milagros is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Milagros has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Milagros would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: David Didier

texts.es:
David, de 32 años, tiene muy claro que es lo que quiere para su vida y está decidido a culminar sus estudios para salir adelante y tener una buena vida.

El desea desempeñarse como vendedor de mercancía variada tales como ropa, accesorios como billeteras y gorras, entre otros, en el municipio de Medellín. Aprovechando la oportunidad que tiene de aplicar el conocimiento obtenido en su actual trabajo de vendedor en un almacén de ropa.

Esta actividad desea iniciarla con el afán de buscar los recursos necesarios para su sostenimiento y para sus estudios, además de poder contribuir con los gastos en su hogar.
Es un hombre emprendedor y muy disciplinado.

El solicita un crédito para comprar un amplio surtido de ropa y gorras al por mayor y de este modo poder tener un inventario inicial para trabajar.

Tiene la esperanza de poder progresar como empresario y tener unos ingresos más estables y agradece a todas las personas que puedan contribuir con su sueño.
texts.en:
David at 32 years old has a very clear idea of what he wants in his life and has decided to complete his studies to get ahead and have a good life. He wants to work as a vendor of a variety of merchandise such as clothing and accessories like wallets and hats amongst others in the municipality of Medellín.

He will take advantage of the knowledge he gained in his current job of a salesman in a clothing store. He wants to start this activity in his eagerness to find the resources he needs to sustain himself and for his studies and also to be able to contribute to the household expenses.

He is an enterprising and disciplined man. he is requesting a loan to buy an ample assortment of clothing and hats wholesale and in this way have an initial inventory to work. He hopes to be able to progress as an entrepreneur and have a more stable income and he thanks all the people who can contribute to his dream.

loans.use: to buy an ample assortment of clothing and hats wholesale and in this way be able to have an initial inventory to work.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph lives in a rural area in Ibanda. He is age 42 and married with three kids. He deals in cattle rearing and slaughtering (butcher). He has requested a loan of UGX 1,500,000 to help him buy more bulls, which he will first rear and later slaughter when they have gained flesh. These he anticipates to buy cheaply in the rural communities. His major challenge is thieves who steal his animals after he has invested his loan money.

He hopes also to venture into a restaurant business if he accumulates the needed capital. This will help him diversify his income sources. He appreciates Kiva and UGAFODE support.

loans.use: To buy baby bulls

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy animal feed and vet drugs

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en:
Noreen is 35 years old and widowed with three children. With three children in school, Noreen works very hard to provide for them.

Noreen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care and other groceries.

Noreen has been in this business for 5 years now. 

In the future, Noreen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Restituta

texts.en:
Restituta is a 59 year old married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell .

Restituta has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Restituta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Rochel

texts.en:
Rochel is 23 years old with one child. Rochel works very hard to provide for the two of them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, cigarettes, beverages, personal product care and other groceries.

Rochel has been in this business for 2 years now. 

In the future, Rochel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, cigarettes, beverages, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Solita

texts.en:
Solita is married, 54 years old and has nine children, two of which are in school. 

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines and  requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Solita has been in this business for 1 year now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Solita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Abdulaziz

texts.en:
Abdulaziz is an electrician with many years of experience. He lives with his wife and two little kids, and is the only breadwinner in his family so he works hard to provide a living for them. He is 39 years old. 

Abdulaziz provides high quality work so his work is in demand every month. He is an ambitious man who wants to expand his work to increase his income. Therefore he has now applied for this loan to purchase tools and materials needed to provide electrician services.

In the future he expects good results from his business, and he wishes to be able to educate his kids at college and provide the best life for them.

loans.use: to purchase tools and materials needed to provide electrician services.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai is a student at university, majoring in foreign languages (Spanish and English). She is 22 years old and single.

Mai, a helpful lady, is working hard to finish her education and start work in a good job, because she wants to help her family with household expenses.  She is from a simple, low income family.  Her father could not help Mai to cover her university fees, but she did not give up and resolved to complete her education, in order to complete her success path.  Therefore she requested an educational loan to help with her university fees and to achieve her goals.

Therefore she needs your help and support.

loans.use: to help with her university fees and complete her path to success.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a 59 year old married woman with four children, one of which is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Zenaida requested a PHP 18000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Zenaida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines.

Myrna requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more containers of purified drinking water to sell to her customers.

Myrna has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Myrna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more containers of purified drinking water to sell to her customers

loans.name: Viktor

texts.en:
Viktor, who is 37 years old and married, lives in Kutaisi city, west Geogria with his wife, Rada. The only breadwinner is Rada, who is involved in private trading at the local market. Her salary, however, isn't enough to meet all daily costs and Viktor wants to make his bit for the family's welfare. He sought  credit among the local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. The startup program, a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 900 USD for purchasing a car. He will start transporting scrap iron from the regions and generate his own income.
 
Viktor and his wife will be very grateful for the financial support as the family's income will significantly increase because of the Kiva lenders and Victor will have financial independence.

loans.use: To purchase a car and start transportation of scrap iron

loans.name: Salem

texts.en:
Salem is an ambitious man who always looks for a good life. He is 22 years old and is a student at university, majoring in nutrition. 
Salem is in his graduation semester. He is close to his dream, the day that he will graduate and find a good job. Lately his father could not cover Salem`s university fees because he is facing a financial crises.  Therefore he requested a loan to help pay for his tuition fees and achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees and achieve his dreams.

loans.name: Siham

texts.en:
Siham is a 63-year-old woman, mother and grandmother. She is selling accessories in her house. She had started this business many years ago due to financial need, looking for a better quality of life, to live better, to have her family eat better.

She has very clear objectives, therefore she is committed to make her business grow in such a way that it generates a profit to buy a house of her own and achieve her goals.

Having her purpose well defined, Siham wants to request a loan to buy more products to sell and expand her work.  She will buy in large quantities and increase her income.  This will help her to achieve her dreams and improve the standards of living for her family.

loans.use: buy more products to sell and expand her work, that will help her achieve her dreams

loans.name: Posiano

texts.en:
Posiano is 35 years and married with two children and one dependent who is a distant relative that he looks after and meets her needs. He is an agriculturalist who majors in coffee growing and also works as a teacher as his profession. Posiano has been able to provide his family with the basic necessities. 

He is applying for a loan of UGX 3,000,000 to buy fertilizers, mulch his garden and expand his coffee garden.

His major challenge is the low income generated from his coffee due to pests and diseases, which leads to poor quality and low output. Posiano wants to be the leading supplier of quality coffee in his region. He is honest, resilient and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for his university fees and become able to find work with a good income

loans.name: Abd Almajeed

texts.en:
Abd Almajeed is 22 years old, lives in Irbid and is a single man. He is an example of an ambitious and well-powered guy. He is a student in university majoring in foreign languages. He chose this major because he believes that it is easy to find a job in this field.

Abd Almajeed's parents could not help him to pay for his university fees because of the financial problems faced by them. Therefore, he requested an educational loan to help him cover his university fees and complete his road to his dreams.

loans.use: To help him cover his university fees and complete his road to his dreams.

loans.name: Razmik

texts.en: Razmik and his wife live in the village of Tsovagyugh in Gegharkunik region. Razmik does various construction work in his village, but his main occupation is farming. Razmik has cows, calves, a bull, heifers, sheep, and chickens. Razmik manages the care of the cattle, and his wife is in charge of selling the farm products. She sells milk, macun (national dairy product), cheese, curd, meat, and eggs mainly to their neighbors and regular customers from Sevan city. Razmik mentions that he regularly increases the number of livestock on his farm, each time buying different animals. One year, it can be sheep, then bulls or cows. Little by little, he makes his farm richer with cattle. With this Kiva loan that Razmik hopes to receive, he wants to buy two cows for his farm and also fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy two cows and fodder for all his farm cattle

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen and his family send their greatest thanks and regards to Kiva and Nor Horizon. They hope that this time again their family can be supported by Kiva lenders. 

Armen works at the mineral water factory as an executive director and his wife is still unemployed. Their daughter and son are still students. Since Armen’s son studies at the paid division of Yerevan State Economical University, in the second year of the faculty of Government, so their family has some hardships with paying for his education. This time again it will be great if Kiva lenders help Armen with the loan amount of 235.000 Armenian drams, in order to pay for his son’s tuition fee for the second semester.

loans.use: to pay for his son’s tuition fee for the second semester

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto es un hombre muy trabajador y organizado, desea ganarse la vida prestando el servicio de transporte de personas en un taxi a través de las veredas del municipio de Barbosa posibilitando el desplazamiento de la comunidad hasta las distintitas áreas del municipio.

Es un hombre amable, servicial y muy emprendedor, es separado y un hijo al cual siempre ha procurado ofrecerle la mejor vida posible.

Solicita un préstamo para realizar el pago inicial de un carro el cual se transformara en su principal medio de ingresos.

Con este crédito podrá tener un empleo digno y una oportunidad de salir adelante.

Apoya a Roberto con un préstamo hoy!
texts.en:
Roberto is a very hard-working and organized man. He wants to earn a living offering the service of transporting people in a taxi through the routes of the town of Barbosa, making it possible for the people of the community to move to the different areas of the town.

He is a friendly, helpful, and very entrepreneurial man. He is separated and has a son to whom he has always tried to offer the best life possible.

He is applying for a loan to make the down payment on a car that will become his principal means of income.

With this loan he will be able to have a dignified job and an opportunity to get ahead.

Help Roberto with a loan today!

loans.use: to make the down payment on a car that will become his principal means of income

loans.name: Noong Het 14 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mai is a 21-year-old Thai ethnic lady who has been married and become the mother of a two-year-old girl. She lives with her in-laws, her husband and her daughter in a Thai ethnic traditional house. She supports her family doing agricultural production with plenty of activities such as growing fruit (dragon fruit, longan), raising chickens, musk ducks, buffalo, and pigs. Her husband works as a welder to earn extra income for the family. 

This is the second time that Mrs. Mai has received a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program and she will use it to buy piglets and food for the pigs. She hopes that her investment will bring a good income and improve significantly the living conditions for her family. 

Mrs. Mai dreams that her child will have a more abundant life, go to college, have a good job and escape from poverty. In the picture, she stands first on the right.

loans.use: to buy piglets and food for the pigs

loans.name: Noong Luong 25 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Kim, 48, is a Thai ethnic woman, who is the mother of four sons, and now she has a grandchild. Her family mainly relies on agricultural production for a living, with plenty of activities such as growing rice, corn, and raising buffalo, pigs, chickens and ducks. Mrs. Kim is a very hard-working farmer and she has always wanted to diversify to animal husbandry to provide a better life for her family. 

To deal with the deficiency of capital for investment, she has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program. This is the second time she has received a loan from the program and she will use it to buy young fish and food for the fish. She believes that with the financial support as well as the training and counseling of the Program's staff, she will gain good earnings from fish farming. 

Mrs. Kim dreams of a more abundant life for her family and hopes that her children will escape from poverty. In the picture, she stands at the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy young fish and food for the fish

loans.name: Noong Het 15 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhan, 49, is a Thai ethnic lady who lives with her in-laws, her husband, and her adult son in a Thai ethnic traditional house. While her son is studying at the college of teachers and her in-laws are at an advanced age, the income of the family is mainly generated by her and her husband. They work at agricultural production for a living with plenty of activities including cultivating rice, raising buffalo, chickens, and pigs. 

Because of the instability of earnings from cultivation and animal husbandry, Mrs. Nhan has always wanted to expand and diversify the production. This has motivated her to continuously take out loans from the Anh Chi Em Program to have enough capital for investment and this time she will use the loan to buy chicks, ducklings and food for the chickens and ducks. She hopes her investment will go smoothly so that she can provide better as well as significantly improved living conditions for her family. 

Mrs. Nhan dreams that her son will have a good job after graduation and have a better life than her. In the picture, she is the woman who wears the Thai ethnic traditional bag and stands first from the right.

loans.use: to buy chicks, ducklings and food for the chickens and ducks

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
El grupo “San Francisco” está en su ciclo número 4 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan para salir adelante, es un grupo muy unido, donde todas ponen su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer y salir adelante.
La Sra. Griselda, es una de las integrantes de este grupo, pide este préstamo para  la compra de  productos varios y volver a venderlas ya sea: carne, lácteos, lencerías, ropas para criaturas, remeras y otros. para así tener más ingresos para  su familia.
Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que quiere salir adelante para poder dar lo mejor a su familia, y que no tengan que pasar por necesidades como las que tuvo que pasar. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y mejorando cada día.
texts.en:
The "San Francisco" group is in its fourth loan cycle in the women's committee program, where everyone works and helps each other to get ahead. It is a very united group, where everyone puts in her best effort in order to be able to grow and get ahead.

Señora Griselda is one of the members of this group. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of various products to sell, such as meat, dairy products, lingerie, baby clothing, knit shirts, and other items, to thus have more income for her family.

She is a very hard-working person who wants to get ahead so that she can give the best to her family so that they don't have to go through the hardships that she had to go through. She is grateful for this opportunity that she is receiving to be able to continue growing and improving each day.

loans.use: to buy meat, dairy products, lingerie, baby clothes, knit shirts, and other items.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en: This woman’s name is Karine and she lives alone in Sevan city in the Gegharkunik region. Karine’s husband and son are in the Russian Federation now doing different construction work there and they return home for the autumn and winter seasons, while Karine takes care of her farm in her native city. On her farm, Karine has cows, calves and bulls. From her farm she sells milk, macun (a national dairy-product), cheese and meat. She mentions that some parts of her farm products are sold to local market holders and other parts she sells to her regular customers.  She hopes that soon her son will get married and at least he will stay in his native city and start developing farming with her. Now she asks for this Kiva loan, as she wants to increase her farm cattle with one more cow and she will also buy fodder for the farm cattle.

loans.use: to enlarge her cattle farm with one more cow and she will also buy fodder for her cattle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure, seeds and insecticides to treat his crops.

loans.name: Siran

texts.en: Siran is 58 years old and she lives in the frontier village of Khachatryan in the Tavush region. Here she lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and her grandchild. Siran works as a cook at the school and simultaneously, with her husband, she is engaged in farming and agriculture. On her farm Siran has cows, several bee families and chickens. On her plot of land, she cultivates potatoes, beans, garlic, onions, etc. So the sale of her farm milk, meat, eggs and vegetables makes up her family income plus her and her son’s cute salaries that they get. Siran would like to enlarge her farm’s meat production. That is why she wants, with this Kiva deal, to make a purchase of pigs for her farm and start selling pork. She will also buy fodder for her farm cattle with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase pigs for her farm and to buy fodder for her farm cattle

loans.name: Noong Luong 24 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngoc is a 28-year-old Thai ethnic lady who is married and lives with her husband and two small sons. She works very hard at agricultural production to provide for the family. Besides cultivating rice, she grows corn, raises goats, chickens and ducks to earn income. Because of the instability of the earnings from agriculture activities, she has expanded and diversified cultivation and animal husbandry. 

To deal with the lack of capital for investment, she has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program. This is the fifth time she has received a loan from the Program and she will use it to buy young fish. She hopes that her investment will go smoothly, so that she could better cover living expenses for her family. 

Mrs. Ngoc dreams of a more abundant life for her family and a bright future for her children. In the picture, she is the woman who wears a pink shirt and stand on the first line, first from the right.

loans.use: to buy young fish

loans.name: Lianna

texts.en: Lianna is 35 years old and she lives with her husband and parents-in-law in Geghamavan village of Gegharkunik region. Lianna has higher pedagogical education but she never managed to work in her specialty and very early, with her husband, she got engaged in farming and agriculture. On the farm she has cows, calves, bulls, a heifer, sheep, a horse and chickens. With her beloved husband, who simultaneously works as a driver, on their plot of land they cultivate potatoes and greens, which they sell to re-sellers. Her farm’s milk, meat and eggs are also sold at the wholesale market. Lianna asks for a loan of 700,000 Armenian drams, as she needs to buy potato seedlings and diesel fuel for her land cultivation and also fodder for the farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings and diesel fuel for her land cultivation and also fodder for farm cattle

loans.name: Edwin Alexander

texts.es:
Edwin, está haciendo una nueva solicitud de crédito para tener disponibilidad económica y así poder comprar insumos agrícolas como abono, insecticidas y herbicidas que utilizara para continuar trabajando en el campo.
Sus condiciones familiares son mucho más dignas, las cosechas de granos básicos han sido abundantes y tiene a sus clientes satisfechos, estos beneficios han sido posibles por la buena administración del crédito anterior.
texts.en:
Edwin is making a new application for a loan in order to have economic accessibility and thus be able to buy agricultural supplies such as compost, insecticides, and herbicides that he will use to continue working in his field.

His family conditions are much more dignified. The harvests of basic grains have been abundant, and he has satisfied his customers. These benefits have been possible because of the good administration of the previous loan.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as compost, insecticides, and herbicides that he will use to continue working in his field

loans.name: Edy Moises

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando alk negocio de venta de libros educativos,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el socio por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia.El socio solicita el credito para comprar libros educativos.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This [communal bank] member continues working in the business of selling educational books. He works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. He wants to raise his family through this business. He is applying for the loan to purchase educational books.

He is happy about the loan and promises to make the payments on his account.

loans.use: to buy educational books

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
La  Joven Aurelia de 32 años de edad es soltera radica en la ciudad de Nacaome Valle, se dedica desde hace 04 años a la venta de tortillas por mayor, Ella vende a los restaurantes donde venden almuerzo, cenas, golosinas
Aurelia  es una mujer  trabajadora  con muchos deseos de salir adelante, y agradece a  PRISMA, por darle la oportunidad de crédito.  
Aurelia esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de granos básicos como Maiz y Frijoles además de Leña y otros productos que le gustaría vender. Con el apoyo del crédito ella  pretende surtir y mejorar su negocio y vivienda.
Aurelia solicita 7,000 lempiras con el apoyo de este préstamo espera invertirlo y mejorar más sus ingresos y sus ventas. Su sueño es comprarse una casa en un futuro ya que ella alquila.
San Lorenzo, Valle – Marzo 2015.
texts.en:
Aurelia is 32 years old, is single and lives in the city of Nacaome, Valle. She has worked for 4 years selling tortillas wholesale. She sells to restaurants where they sell lunches, dinners and sweets. Aurelia is a hard-working woman with much desire to get ahead and is grateful to PRISMA to give her the opportunity of getting a loan.

Aurelia is requesting this loan to buy basic grains like corn, beans, wood and other products she would like to sell. With the help of the loan she hopes to stock and improve her business and house. Aurelia is requesting 7,000 HNL and with the help of this loan she hopes to invest and improve her income and sales. Her dream is to buy a house in the future as she now rents.

San Lorenzo, Valle Department – March 2015.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, wood and other products for her business.

loans.name: Mukhran

texts.en:
Mukhran is 43 years old. He earns a living with part-time work, as a supervisor at the parking. Mukhran has an unstable financial condition, as having no stable job. In the region there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make a living.  So, he decided to start a trading business with the requested loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. Mukhran's credit requests were rejected several times, as he was unable to satisfy their requirements. 

He received the credit in the framework of the joint initiative of Kiva and Credo - Startup Program that gives poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. Mukhran will purchase stocks of fruits and vegetables and start local trading. He will have fresh products and have his own loyal costumers. 
This motivated man will be very thankful for the financial support, as he will be able to make a stable income and get financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase stock of fruits and vegetables and start trading

loans.name: Archil

texts.en:
Archil, who is a 35 year-old married man, lives in Rustavi city. His wife is a housekeeper. Archil gets a small income working as a steel founder and wants somehow to improve his family's living condition. After several unsuccessful attempts, Archil applied for the credit at MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is joint initiative with Kiva, permitting people to start or re-start businesses. The loan will be great help for Archil, as he will purchase a second-hand car with the money and start serving local people as a taxi driver. Archil will do his private activity in his free time and will generate additional income.  This will help the couple to tackle their financial difficulties.
 
Archil and his wife rely on the goodwill of Kiva lenders and will be very grateful for the help. They await your support.

loans.use: to start a private business as a taxi driver

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is married, 49 years old and has four children, one of which is in school. 

She is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Anecita requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Anecita has been farming rice for 20 years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Anecita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Berlina

texts.en:
Berlina is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Berlina is 42 years old and two of her children are in school.

Berlina has a cattle rearing business in the Philippines. Berlina has been in this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her cattle.

In the future, Berlina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her cattle

loans.name: Clotilda

texts.en:
Clotilda is 51 years old and married. Clotilda works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 5 years. She sells a variety of items such as candies, biscuits and other groceries. Now she has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, candies, cigarettes, home care products and other supplies.

In the future, Clotilda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, candies, cigarettes, home care products and other supplies

loans.name: Ira

texts.en:
Ira is a 43 years old married woman from Senaki district. She has a husband, 2 children and a pensioner mother-in-law. Her husband works as a private artisan and gets a small income. Ira is very hard-working person, who does her bit for the family's welfare. She takes care of milk cows and sells cheese locally. Also Ira trades with linens, which she buys at wholesale prices and sells in increased prices in her community. Ira wants to expand her agribusiness, which is the productive activity in the region. 

She requested a loan to realize her purpose and received the credit in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo - Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. Ira will purchase the equipment for building a greenhouse and will cultivate cucumbers. Ira will sell the harvested products to the local retailers in a good price. 
Ira will get significant income after the harvest of cucumbers and will satisfy her family's increased needs. The loan will greatly assist Ira, and she will be able to continue her lovely job. Due to her kind and nice attitude towards clients, she has a big list of loyal customers. She will be very thankful for the loan.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse and expand her agribusiness

loans.name: Dúo Mariposa Monarca Group

texts.es:
Dúo Mariposa Monarca
Este grupo esta conformado por la señora Mirian Lorena de 34 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles desde hace varios años, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para comprar mas mercaderia por mayor para obtener mejores precios al comprar, espera que le puedan dar el apoyo que nececita para agrandar aun mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Mariposa Monarca Dúo (monarch butterfly duo) 

This group was formed by Señora Mirian Lorena, who is 34 years old. She has been selling food products for a number of years. Now she is applying for this loan to purchase more merchandise wholesale in order to obtain better purchase prices. She hopes that you can give her the support that she needs in order to further enlarge her business.

loans.use: to buy food products to sell.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 51 years old and has four children. Edna is a married woman.

Edna is in the agricultural business of farming rice in the Philippines. Edna requested a loan in the amount of PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Edna has been farming rice for 25 years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Edna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita is 43 years old and has three children. She is married and all three of her children are in school.

Emerita is in the agricultural business of farming rice in the Philippines and requested a loan in the amount of PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Emerita has been farming rice for 15 years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

loans.name: Iuri

texts.en:
Iuri, a 32 year old married man, has a wife and 2 little sons. The family has a very poor living condition, as they don't have any source of income and live in poverty. Iuri can't find any job and wants to start his own business, in order to satisfy his family's even basic needs. He has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected all the time because of the family’s poor living conditions. 

Finally his loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Iuri plans to open a restaurant in the railway station. His regular costumers will be passengers and Iuri will be able to get significant income and earn his family's living on his own. 

Iuri and his family members rely on the good will of Kiva lenders and will highly appreciate your support.

loans.use: to open a restaurant and make it the source of income

loans.name: Gloria Oneida

texts.es:
Laboriosa y soñadora, son dos palabras que describen perfectamente a Gloria, una mujer trabajadora y de familia, que hace lo que este a su alcance para ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.

Se dedica a la cría y venta de cerdos en el municipio de San Cristóbal.
Esta es una actividad muy común en esta región y gran parte de sus habitantes la practican.

Ella posee gran conocimiento en esta materia y considera que necesita un pequeño impulso para incrementar sus ventas y aumentar su negocio, es por esta razón que solicita un auxilio económico para invertirlo en la compra de cerdos para la cría pues solo así podrá aumentar su producción.

Con este préstamo podrá continuar con su actividad que es la única fuente de ingresos de su familia.

Se siente agradecida con los prestamistas de Kiva y con la Corporación Interactuar que hacen posible que su negocio crezca y mejore.
texts.en:
Hard-working and visionary are the two words that describe Gloria perfectly. She is a hard-working family woman who does what she can to offer a better quality of life to her children.

She raises and sells pigs in the town of San Cristóbal. This is a very common business in this region, and a large number of the inhabitants practice it.

She has great knowledge in this area and feels that she needs a little boost to increase her sales and expand her business. It is for this reason that she is applying for economic help to invest in the purchase of pigs to raise, since this is the only way she can increase her production.

With this loan she will be able to continue with her business, which is the only source of income for her family.

She feels grateful to the Kiva lenders and the Interactuar Corporation, which make it possible for her business to grow and improve.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise, since only this way can she increase her production

loans.name: Aguacate Group

texts.es:
Está conformado por tres mujeres luchadoras (AURA NUVIA, BERTA y REGINA) que se organizaron hace 3 años, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento para mejorar sus condiciones de vida, poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar, asegurar la educación de sus hijos y ampliar sus negocios.

REGINA: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una señora alegre, de la etnia miskita de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Tiene 55 años de edad, con cualidades de líder, viuda con un hijo mayor de edad. Con el propósito de apoyar con los gastos del hogar y tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de ropa usada en las comunidades, que es intercambiada por granos básicos. Esta solicitando financiamiento para comprar en Managua una paca de ropa usada mixta. Ella sueña con establecer  pulpería donde oferte productos básicos que demanda la población.
texts.en:
[This group] consists of three hard-working women (Aura Nuvia, Berta, and Regina) who organized themselves three years ago with the purpose of accessing financing to improve their living conditions, cover the basic needs of their households, assure the education of their children, and expand their businesses.

Regina is the coordinator of the group. She is a happy woman of Miskito ethnicity from Bilwi, the town of Puerto Cabezas. She is 55 years old and has leadership qualities. She is a widow with an adult son. With the goal of supporting the household expenses and having her own source of income, she has been selling used clothing, which is exchanged for basic grains, in the communities for three years, 

She is applying for financing to purchase a bale of mixed used clothing in Managua. She dreams of setting up a grocery store where she can offer the basic products that the populace demands.

loans.use: to buy a bale of mixed used clothing in Managua

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
As a way of generating income, Judith has been engaged in cooking and selling street foods, particularly barbecue, in her community for almost five years now at Baseco, Manila. She is 40 years of age with five children. Her husband, Celso, works as an electrician and they work hand-in-hand to provide for their needs. 

In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

Judith wants to improve her business. But due to financial insufficiency, she would like to avail a loan of 16,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy additional raw products like pork, chicken and seasonings that are needed for her barbecue store. Having a positive perspective, she is hoping that she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

Judith dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional raw products like pork, chicken and seasonings that are needed for her barbecue store.

loans.name: Jainema

texts.en:
Jainema is 49 years old and married with six children.

Jainema works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries like canned goods, soft drinks, noodles and other personal care products.

Jainema has been in this business for 24 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Jainema aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries like canned goods, soft drinks, noodles and other personal care products

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Erlinda has been in this business for 6 years. She would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

Enjie dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

Maria has been in this business for 23 years. In the future, Maria would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help these members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.name: Shirley Janneth

texts.es:
Shirley es una mujer de 26 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 6 años y una hija de 2 años, y su negocio es la venta de juguetes.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, optimista, de buen trato, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘16 de julio’ un lugar caracterizado por el comercio y manufactura en todas las áreas, también por su tradicional feria los días jueves y domingo; dónde se puede encontrar desde un alfiler hasta un tractor. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Shirley es de tez morena, ojos pardos, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el español y conoce el Aymará por herencia familiar. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al transporte y con sus dos hijos; el mayor estudia en la escuela y la menor ya sabe caminar. Viven en la casa propiedad de su madre construida de adobe, ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de juguetes; para bebés, para niños/as, educativos y para todas las edades. En un puesto de venta propio los días de feria que son los domingos y jueves, durante el día. “inicié mi negocio gracias a la ayuda de mi suegra y ya llevo 2 años trabajando en esta actividad…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que en el tiempo que trabaja logró conseguir clientes continuos, la desventaja es que su puesto de venta es a la intemperie y toda su mercadería se encuentra expuesta a los cambios climáticos como el sol y la lluvia. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de juguetes, ella desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de juguetes por mayor. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que desarrolla esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Shirley solicita un préstamo para la compra de juguetes por mayor para abrir una tienda de juguetes.
texts.en:
Shirley is a 26-year old woman who lives with her partner, 6-year old son and 2-year old daughter. She makes a living selling toys and she is a good mother, an entrepreneur, optimistic, easygoing, responsible and hard-working. She works in the "16 de julio" neighborhood, popular for its trade and manufacturing businesses in every area, as well as for its traditional market on Thursdays and Sundays, where you can find from a pin to a tractor. The weather is cold and dry, with temperatures varying between 0 and 12ºC during the day. 

Shirley has tanned skin, brown eyes, medium height, long black hair in a ponytail and thin complexion. Spanish is her mother tongue, but she also speaks Aymará as family heritage. She shares her life with her partner, who works in transportation, and her two children. The oldest one attends school and the youngest already knows how to walk. They live in a house property of her mother and built with adobe, brick and cement with the ceiling made of corrugated iron. They have drinking water, electric energy, gas and sewage system. She sells educational toys for babies and children of all ages. She has a fixed stand at the market every Thursday and Sunday during the day. "I started my business thanks to the help of my mother-in-law and I've been working in it for 2 years", she says. The advantage she has is that she has been able to get regular clients; her disadvantage is that her stand is outdoors and her toys are exposed to the weather, including sun and rain. 

Her dream is to open a toy store. She wants to invest in her business buying toys in bulk. This is her second loan with the institution in 2 years. 

Shirley is requesting a loan to buy toys in bulk to open a toy store.

loans.use: to buy toys in bulk to open a toy store.

As a married parent of three children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items to sell like biscuits, canned goods, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: María Elsi

texts.es:
María, de 55 años de edad, no posee ningún grado académico, ya que desde muy pequeña tuvo que trabajar y no le quedo tiempo de estudiar, actualmente está acompañada y su pareja trabaja en una pequeña tienda.

María, desde que era una niña, trabajaba en el mercado lavando platos, barriendo, limpiando, entre otras cosas más y de esa manera fue como aprendió cómo funciona el negocio en el mercado, luego con una pequeña ayuda de sus padres, logró colocar su propio negocio, actualmente tiene una amplia venta de pupusas y refrescos.

El dinero del crédito será invertido para comprar una plancha más grande, porque con la que tiene no alcanza a cubrir la demanda de pupusas y además ya está oxidada.  

El sueño de María, es seguir trabajando para superarse económicamente y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
María is 55 years old and never went to school as, when she was very young, she had to work and did not have time to study. María has a partner, who works at a small shop.

Since she was a girl, María has worked in the market washing plates, cleaning up, sweeping and doing other jobs. She thus learned how businesses at the market work. Later, with a little help from her parents, she was able to open her own business. María now sells plenty of “pupusas” (a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans) and soft drinks.

María will use this loan in order to buy a larger griddle. The griddle that she currently is not enough to cover demand for “pupusas” and is also rusting.

María’s dream is to continue working in order to earn more money and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a larger griddle.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La señora María Elena es una joven proveniente de la ciudad de Aiquile quien busca mejorar su calidad de vida. Se fue a vivir al trópico de Cochabamba junto a su madre. Ella se compró una pequeña parcela, donde trabaja como agricultora y se dedica a la producción de piña y cítricos. La señora María Elena no tiene hijos, es soltera y trabaja ocasionalmente en compañía de su familia, en una modalidad andina conocida como “Ayni”. Según cuentan sus amigos y vecinos del lugar, la joven es una emprendedora dedicada y responsable en su actividad. Con el crédito solicitado la señora María Elena quiere ampliar su parcela de piña y realizar un mantenimiento en su plantación de cítricos y piña. Con esto podrá incrementar el rendimiento de producción en su parcela,  generar mayores  ingresos y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Elena is a young woman from the city of Aiquile. She is looking to improve her quality of life and went to live with her mother in tropical Cochabamba. María bought a small plot of land where she works as a farmer and makes a living growing pineapples and citric fruits.

María does not have children; she is single and occasionally works in the company of her family at an Andean organisation called “Ayni”. According to María’s friends and neighbours, this young woman is enterprising, dedicated and responsible at her work.

María will use this loan to increase the land where she grows pineapples, and to carry out maintenance work on her plantation. She can thus increase her yield, earn a higher income, and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to increase the land where she grows pineapples, and to carry out maintenance work in order to increase her yield and earn a higher income.

loans.name: Fabiola Estefania

texts.es:
Fabiola es una joven mujer de 22 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos y trabaja como cajera de un restaurante.
Ella es independiente, inteligente, responsable y muy trabajadora, su trabajo es la contabilidad que realiza en una churrasquería situada en la localidad de ‘Sacaba’, a 14 kilómetros de la ciudad, donde tienen sus viviendas los agricultores que cultivan la tierra en el trópico, y son usadas cuando sacan sus cosechas del trópico a comercializarlos en la ciudad. De clima templado con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 18-25 grados centígrados.
Fabiola es de tez trigueña, ojos pardos, cabello castaño largo lo usa amarrado, estatura mediana, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el trabajo que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su abuelo y sus dos hermanos menores porque sus padres se encuentran trabajando en el país de Italia, viven en una casa propiedad del abuelo que se encuentra a medio construir, hecha de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante una bomba eléctrica. Su trabajo es la contabilidad de un restaurante, paralelamente estudia la carrera de contabilidad en la universidad y se encuentra en cuarto año. “estudio y trabajo para terminar de construir la casa de mi familia y contar con todos los servicios básicos…” comenta. La ventaja de su trabajo es que es turno nocturno y le deja todo el día para ocuparse de sus estudios, la desventaja son algunas clases extras o recuperatorias que se cruzan con su trabajo. Su sueño es terminar su profesión y conseguir un empleo estable para ayudar a su familia, y desea realizar la instalación de agua potable en la casa de su abuelo que es donde vive, para dejar de usar el pozo de agua que tiene actualmente y que extrae agua sucia y sin purificar. Esta es la segunda secuencia de préstamos con la institución en dos años y medio que trabaja y estudia.
Es por esos motivos que Fabiola solicita un préstamo para la instalación de agua potable en su baño, cocina y lavandería para dejar de beber agua sucia de pozo.
texts.en:
Fabiola is a 22-year-old young woman. She is single and does not have any children. She works as a restaurant cashier. She is independent, intelligent, responsible, and very hard-working. She does bookkeeping at a barbecue place in the area of Sacaba, located 14 kilometers from the city. The farmers taht live here cultivate the land in this tropic region and sell their harvest in the city. There's a moderate climate with the temperature varying between 18 and 25 °C [64 - 77 °F] during the day.

Fabiola is olive-skinned, has long brown hair, which she wears tied back, is of medium height, and has a thin physique. Her native language is Quechua, and she also speaks Spanish on a daily basis and at work.

She lives with her grandfather and her two younger siblings because her parents are working in Italy. They live in her grandfather's partially completed house, made of bricks and cement, with electricity and well water, using an electrical pump.

She works as a bookkeeper at a restaurant. At the same time she studies accountancy in her fourth year in university. She says: "I study and work to finish the constructions of my family's house and equip it with the basic commodities..." The advantage of her work is that it is at night, so she has all day to study. The downside is that some extra classes are overlapping with her work schedule.

Her dream is to have a profession and a stable job, so she can help her family, and to install drinking water in her grandfather's house, so they can stop using the dirty and unfiltered water from the well.

This is the second loan she will receive from the institution in the two and a half years in which she has been working and studying. For these reasons, Fabiola is requesting a loan to install potable water in her bathroom, kitchen, and laundry room to be able to stop drinking dirty water from the well.

loans.use: to install potable water in her bathroom, kitchen, and laundry room, so she can stop drinking dirty water from the well

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a bathroom for her house, which she needs urgently because she doesn't have the conditions now.

loans.name: Blanca Rosmira

texts.es:
Blanca, con 55 años de edad, es separada y madre de hijos mayores de edad. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora, un visionaria y buena negociante. 

Siempre ha trabajado como comerciante, vendiendo verduras en el municipio de Medellín y, desde hace poco tiempo tiene su propio negocio.  

Ha sabido superar tiempos difíciles en el comercio y sueña con comprarse su casa propia y tener un negocio que perdure en el tiempo; es por ello que Blanca acudió a solicitar un préstamo, el cual utilizará para comprar surtido e inventario de insumos de verduras y realizar una adecuación locativa a su negocio. 

Blanca es una mujer muy organizada aunque ha tenido que enfrentar la competencia comercial del sector.  

La suma de todos sus esfuerzos le brindan a toda su familia una calidad de vida excelente.
texts.en:
Blanca, 55 years old, is separated and is the mother of two adult children. She is characterized as a very responsible and hard-working woman, a visionary and a good businesswoman. 

She has always worked as a businesswoman, selling vegetables in the municipality of Medellín and since a short while ago, she has had her own business. 

She has known how to overcome difficult times in the business and dreams of buying her own house and having a business that stands the test of time. It is for this that Blanca approached to ask for a loan, which will be used to purchase an assortment of inventory of vegetable supplies and do some improvements to the business's retail space. 

Blanca is a very organized woman although she has had to face business competition in the sector. 

The sum of all of her efforts offers her whole family an excellent quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of inventory of vegetable supplies and do some improvements to the business's retail space.

loans.name: Milagros Group

texts.es:
Marivel es una mujer de 28 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo de 5 años, y su negocio es la venta de alimentos y productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio. 
Ella es emprendedora, optimista, de buena actitud, comprometida con su trabajo, generosa, amable, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su Trabajo lo realiza en la comunidad ‘Tundy’ ubicado a 25 kilómetros al sur este de la ciudad, los lugareños se dedican principalmente a labores agropecuarias, los jóvenes y niños pasan rápidamente a un espacio laboral para poder apoyar a sus familias, dejando truncados sus estudios. Normalmente los trabajos que desempeñan están relacionados a labores en los chacos, cuidado de ganado y niñeras o ayudante de albañiles en la ciudad. Estas condiciones están enmarcadas como trabajos riesgosos y llevan a los niños, niñas y adolescentes a posibles situaciones de explotación laboral.
Marivel es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello largo negro lo usa amarrado, estatura mediana, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y en el comercio mayormente habla español (la primera de la izquierda, fila de atrás, viste solera rosa y sostiene a su hijo en brazos). La necesidad de cubrir los gastos de su hijo la llevó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de comida, venta de verduras, venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de desayunos, venta de bisutería, venta de cosméticos, servicio de transporte y centro de llamadas, para solicitar un préstamo para mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad como; pan, azúcar fideo, arroz, refrescos, galletas, productos de limpieza, etc., en su tienda de barrio que debido a la falta de comercio en el área no tiene mucha competencia. Actividad que realiza de forma independiente todos los días de la semana en horario del día, “mi negocio me dá la oportunidad de ver crecer a mi niño y estar todo el tiempo con él…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que puede cuidar a su hijo, la desventaja es la distancia de sus proveedores y de su tienda. Su sueño es abrir una empresa distribuidora para realizar ventas por mayor, ella desea ampliar su negocio realizando la compra por mayor de abarrotes y material escolar para la venta en su tienda, ya que existe una escuela cercana y existe demanda de esos productos. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Marivel solicita un préstamo para la compra de abarrotes y material escolar para surtir su tienda y con los beneficios pagar los gastos preescolares de su hijo.
texts.en:
Marivel is a 28-year-old woman, single, who has a 5-year-old son, and her business is selling food and basic products in her neighborhood store. 

She is enterprising, optimistic, has a positive attitude, is dedicated to her work, generous, friendly, responsible and very hard-working. Her work is located in the Tundy community, located 25 kilometers to the southeast of the city. The local people work primarily in agricultural work, the young people and children enter the workplace quickly to be able to support their family, cutting their education short. Normally, the work that they do is related to work in the farms, taking care of cattle, and as babysitters or bricklayer assistants in the city. These conditions are classified as dangerous work and bring the children and adolescents into possible situations of work exploitation. 

Marivel has dark skin, dark eyes, long black hair that she keeps tied up, is of medium stature, medium physique, her native language is Guaraní which she speaks in the place and in business she primarily speaks Spanish (she is the first one on the left in the back row, she is wearing a pink tank top and has her son in her arms). The need to cover her son's expenses brought her to form a bank of people with businesses such as food sales, vegetable sales, second-hand clothing sales, breakfast sales, costume jewelry sales, cosmetic sales, transportation service, and a call center, to ask for a loan to improve their businesses.  Her business is selling food and basic items such as bread, sugar, beans, rice, soft drinks, cookies, cleaning products, etc., in her neighborhood store which, due to the lack of business in the area, doesn't have much competition. She does the work independently every day of the week during the day. "My business gives me the opportunity to see my son grow and to be with him all the time..." she says. The advantage of her business is that she can care for her son, the disadvantage is the distance of her suppliers to her store. Her dream is to open a distribution business to make bulk sales. She wants to expand her business, purchasing groceries in bulk and school supplies to sell in her store, since there is a school nearby and there is demand for these products. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the three years that she has been doing this work. 

For these reasons, Marivel asks for a loan to purchase groceries and school supplies to stock her store and, with the profits, pay her son's preschool expenses.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and school supplies to stock her store and with the earnings, pay her son's preschool costs.

loans.name: Geronima

texts.en:
Geronima works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Geronima requested a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Geronima has been in this business for 17 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Janice requested a PHP 24000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee and other personal care products.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Janice has been in this business for 17 years now, and also earns additional income from tailoring.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee and other personal care products

loans.name: Lindita

texts.en: Lindita has not had electricity for a very long time now.  She is seeking your compassion to help her financially. She has been photographed with the scrap plastics that she has collected to sell.

loans.use: to pay for electricity arrears

loans.name: Yuliana Migdonia

texts.es:
Yuliana, con 32 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos y responsable de su hogar junto con su esposo. 

Desde hace 3 años, se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, una sala de belleza que inició como alternativa para generar recursos que le permitieran velar por el bienestar de su familia, trabaja sola todos los días durante 6 horas, la actividad la aprendió tomando clases en una academia de belleza y poco a poco fue adquiriendo más conocimientos y perfeccionando sus técnicas, lo que le ha permitido darse a conocer en el sector por la calidad de su servicio. 

Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar los diferentes utensilios e insumos al por mayor (tratamientos capilares, tinturas, shampoo, acondicionador, entre otros), también comprara un lava cabezas así estará en la capacidad de prestar un mejor servicio, pues los clientes estarán más cómodos, lo que le ayudará a mejorar sus ventas y los ingresos que percibe. 

Yuliana con su perseverancia y proyección hacia un futuro, desea hacer crecer su salón de belleza, en el que pueda generar más oportunidades de empleo para madres cabezas de familia, dando como resultado un mejor bienestar no sólo para su familia, sino que aportará para que otras personas puedan disfrutar de mejores condiciones para vivir.
texts.en:
Yuliana, 32 years old, is the mother of two children and is responsible for her home along with her husband. 

For the past 3 years, she has worked in her own business, a beauty salon that she began as an alternative to generate resources which would allow her to care for her family's well-being. She works alone every day for 6 hours.
