She learned the work by taking classes at the beauty school and little by little she acquired more knowledge and improved her techniques, which has allowed her to be known in the sector for the quality of her service. 

Currently, she is asking for the support of the loan to purchase the different tools and supplies in bulk (hair treatment, dyes, shampoo, conditioner and more), and also she will purchase a shampoo station and so she will be in the position to offer better service, since the customers will be more comfortable, which will help her to improve her sales and the income that she sees. 

Yuliana, with her persistence and projection into the future, wants to make her beauty salon grow, in which she will be able to generate more job opportunities for female heads of household, giving as a result better well-being, not only for her family, but also so that other people can enjoy better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase the different tools and supplies in bulk (hair treatment, dyes, shampoo, conditioner and more).

loans.name: Jose Adan

texts.es:
Adán, de 77 años de edad, no posee ningún grado académico, actualmente está casado y tiene tres hijos, de los cuales solo uno vive en su casa, su esposa junto a él tienen un pequeño negocio familiar.

Adán, se dedica a elaborar pan artesana, pero es un agricultor nato que desde muy pequeño trabajaba como agricultor junto a su padre, actualmente trabaja siempre como agricultor y también junto a su esposa administrar la venta de pan.

Adán, está solicitando el crédito para invertido en la compra de bandejas y material de construcción para la construcción de un horno artesanal más grande, ya que el que tienen es muy chico y no les da abasto.

El sueño que tiene Adán, es poder ampliar su negocio, ya que sus ganancias le ayudan para cubrir los gastos del hogar y también hacer mejoras en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Adán, 77 years old, doesn't have any academic education, currently is married and has three children, of whom only one lives in his house. Along with his wife, he has a small family business. 

Adán works making artisan bread, but he is a natural-born farmer who since he was very small worked as a farmer with his father. Currently, he continues working as a farmer and also, with his wife, runs the bread sales. 

Adán is asking for the loan to invest it in the purchase of trays and construction material to build a larger traditional oven, since the one they have is very small and is not enough. 

The dream that Adán has is to be able to expand his business, since with its earnings, it helps him to cover the household expenses and also to make improvements on their house.

loans.use: to purchase trays and construction material to build a larger traditional oven.

loans.name: Jose Elias

texts.es:
El señor José de 46 años de edad vive con su conyugue, tiene casa propia  y el radica en la ciudad de Nacaome Valle, se dedica desde hace 05 años a su negocio, Compra y vende cerdos, también cada mes destaza un buen cerdo grande y gordo para vender carne.
Don José  es un Hombre trabajador con muchos deseos de salir adelante también se dedica a pintar casas y tiene una pulpería con su esposa, y agradece a  PRISMA, por la oportunidad que le está brindando de acceder a un crédito.
Don José está solicitando el préstamo para remodelación de la porqueriza y compra de 2 cerdos de raza para criar y engordar. Con el apoyo del crédito él  pretende aumentar y mejorar su negocio. 
Don José solicita 10,000 lempiras para remodelación de su porqueriza, y con el apoyo de este préstamo espera invertirlo y mejorar más sus ingresos, para darle una mejor vida a su familia.
Don José su sueño es que en su próximo crédito  con prisma y KIVA comprar más cerdos pequeños y criar en gran numero para ir desarrollando su negocio y hacerlo más fuerte y rentable.
San Lorenzo, Valle – Marzo 2015.
texts.en:
46 year old José lives with his partner and has his own house. He is from the city of Nacaome Valle. He has been running his business for 5 years. He buys and sells pigs and every month he butchers a large, fat pig to sell meat.
José is a hardworking man with a great desire to get ahead and he also works painting houses and has a grocery store with his wife. He is grateful to PRISMA for the opportunity he is being offered to get a loan. 
José is requesting a loan to renovate his pig sties and to buy 2 pigs to raise and fatten. With the support of the loan he will grow and improve his business. 
José is requesting $475 to renovate his pig sties and, with the help of this loan, he hopes to invest in his business and further improve his income so that he can give his family a better life. 
José's dream is to use his next loan from from PRISMA and Kiva to buy more small pigs and to raise a large number of them so that he can develop his business and make it stronger and more profitable.
San Lorenzo, Valle - March 2015.

loans.use: to renovate his pig sties and to buy 2  pigs for his business

loans.name: Maria Dilfa

texts.es:
La  Señora María de 50 años de edad es soltera radica en la ciudad de Nacaome Valle, se dedica desde hace 05 años a la venta de tortillas por mayor, ella  a los restaurantes donde venden comidas y golosinas, Doña María  es una mujer  trabajadora  con muchos deseos de salir adelante, y agradece a  PRISMA, por darle la oportunidad de este crédito.  
Doña María está solicitando el préstamo para compra de Maíz y Leña. Con el apoyo del crédito él  pretende aumentar su materia prima para poder producir más tortillas y así vender más.
Doña María solicita 7,000 lempiras para invertirlo en su negocio con esta aumentara su capital para producir más tortillas lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos.
Doña María  sueño es comprarse una casa en un futuro ya que le gustaría vivir de una forma más digna.
San Lorenzo, Valle – Marzo 2015.
texts.en:
María, 50 years old, is single and from the city of Nacaome Valle. She has worked for 5 years selling tortillas in bulk to the restaurants where they sell foods and sweets. María is a hard-working woman with great desire to get ahead and is grateful to PRISMA for giving her the opportunity of this loan. 
  
María is asking for the loan to purchase corn and firewood. With the support of the loan, she plans to increase her raw material to be able to produce more tortillas and, so, sell more. 

María asks for 7,000 lempiras to invest them in her business. With this, she will increase her capital to produce more tortillas which will allow her to improve her income. 

María's dream is to purchase a house in the future since she would like to life in a more respectable way.

San Lorenzo, Valle – March 2015.

loans.use: to purchase corn and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Antonia works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. Antonia has borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets and maintenance for her fishing business.

Antonia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets and maintenance for her fishing boat

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es:
Sandra se ha caracterizado entre sus clientes como una mujer amable y carismática, con 34 años de edad, se dedica a atender su propio negocio, pues tiene una venta de comidas como tamales, empanadas, chorizos, entre otros que comenzó hace aproximadamente 3 años en su casa.

Su experiencia en la cocina la obtuvo a través de su madre y el conocimiento empírico. 

El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para comprar insumos como carne, arroz, aceite, pollo, maíz, harina, entre otros, así tendrá más variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes y satisfacer los diferentes gustos y necesidades; lo que le generará mejores ventas e ingresos en su negocio para seguir luchando y cumplir su propósito a mediano plazo, que es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, en la que pueda compartir con su familia y que su negocio le genere mayor rentabilidad para dar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sandra has been characterized by her customers as a kind and charismatic woman. She is 34 years old and is making a living through her own business she started three years ago in her house, selling tamales, filled pastries (empanadas), and pork sausages (chorizos), among other things. 

Her experience in the kitchen comes from her mother, hands-on experience and observing.

The loan she is requesting supports her to buy ingredients such as meat, rice, oil, chicken, corn, flour, and so on, so she can offer a bigger variety to her customers and satisfy different wants and needs, in order to generate more sales and a better income from her business. This supports her to keep on fighting to reach her goal in the medium-term, which is to improve her living situation, to the point where she can share with her family and her business to become more profitable, so she can offer her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meat, rice, oil, chicken, corn, flour, and so on, so she can offer a bigger variety to her customers

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 29 years old, a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Melanie has a buy and sell livestock business in the Philippines. Melanie requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more livestock to sell.

Melanie has been in this business for two years. In the future, Melanie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to sell.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Elisa works hard to support her family.

She has a repair shop business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fishing.  Elisa is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to  purchase additional materials and spare parts for her repair shop business.

Elisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and spare parts for her shop

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
Con su perseverancia, sazón y buen servicio, Gustavo ha tenido una gran acogida en su barrio desde que abrió su restaurante hace 20 años con gran esfuerzo y con un deseo en su mente, el de salir adelante y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

Trabaja en compañía de su esposa (Ver Foto) que es un gran apoyo para el en este negocio.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar pollos para venderlos ya preparados para la cocción a sus clientes.

Con esto podrá continuar cocinando y preparando las delicias que con sus manos trabajadoras ha venido ofreciendo y sirviendo a los habitantes del municipio de Caparrapi.

Su principal dificultad es el Alto costo de los insumos.

Apoya a Gustavo con su negocio y has que su vida sea mejor con un préstamo!
texts.en:
With his perseverance, seasonings and good service, Gustavo has had a great welcome in his neighborhood since he opened his restaurant 20 years ago with great efforts and with a desire in mind, that of getting ahead and improving his family's living conditions. 

He works in the company of his wife (see the photo) who is a great support for him in this business. 

The loan that he is asking for is to purchase chickens to sell them to his customers prepared for cooking. 

With this, he will be able to continue cooking and preparing the delicacies that with his hard-working hands he has been offering and selling to the residents of the municipality of Caparrapi. 

His primary difficulty is the high cost of supplies. 

Support Gustavo with his business and make his life better with a loan!

loans.use: to purchase chickens to sell them to his customers prepared for cooking.

loans.name: Marifi

texts.en:
Marifi has been operating her transportation business for three years now. She owns one jeepney and she used her previous loan to buy spare parts and pay the maintenance on the vehicle. She was able to improve her profit through the loan assistance, which she also has successfully repaid. The business is her major source of living.  This is why the unit must be in good condition every single day.

Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan so she can continue the operation of her transport business. She is requesting an amount of PHP 15,000 to pay for the maintenance of the jeepney unit and to buy spare parts she needs at the same time.

In the future, Marifi hopes that she could buy more jeepney units. More units means more profit and an increase in profit will result in improving her life. She meets her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her jeepney.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia, a 55-year-old micro-entrepreneur from Intramuros, Manila, Philippines, has run her market stall for thirty years, and she makes a good income from this. Since it is a big responsibility for parents to provide for family needs, especially for three children, she and her husband are determined to work hard to provide their children with a better education than they currently have.

She sells meat products in the community market. She buys quantity of meat products and other stuff like raw fish and vegetables. Then she sells them per kilo. What she gains form the sales she uses for their daily budget for home expenses. Some funds are kept as a revolving fund for everyday supplies. 

But what profit she gets is not enough. Therefore, Cecilia is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan assistance to purchase more quantities and stocks of meats, fish, and vegetables. She will use her loan to increase her sales and her additional revenue to improve the general living condition of her family.

Cecilia hopes to expand her stall and improve her profit from the business even more. She also dreams of seeing her children someday finish their schooling so they can have better security in the future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase more quantities and stocks of meats, fish, and vegetables.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 50 years old and married with eight children. With two of them in school, Rosalinda works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, noodles, etc.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 4 years.

In the future Rosalinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, noodles.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma works hard to support her family. Emma is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets.

Emma has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Emma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets

loans.name: Jose Albeiro

texts.es:
Al hablar de José no se puede evitar notar que es un agricultor de nacimiento criado y formado con los hermosos valores del campo como lo son la humildad y el trabajo, siendo estos dos los más representativos de los agricultores de Colombia. 
José no conforme con los ingresos que obtenía como jornalero decidió iniciar con su propio sembrado de maracuyá en el municipio de Mariquita.

José solicita un crédito para la Compra de fertilizantes orgánicos para el cuidado de sus cultivos y semillas de maracuyá.
Con este apoyo podrá sacar adelante e impactar de manera muy favorable su economía familiar.
texts.en:
When talking to José, you can't help but notice that he is farmer born and bred, with the beautiful values of the countryside - hard work and humility being the most representative values of the Colombian farmers. 
Not being content with the wages that he earned as a day laborer, José decided to grow his own passion fruits in the municipality of Mariquita.
José is requesting a loan to buy organic fertilizers to care for his passion fruit crops and seeds.
With this support, he will be able to get ahead and improve his family's economic situation.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers to care for his passion fruit crops and seeds.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes, a 53-year-old micro-entrepreneur from Pasay City, Philippines, has been operating their transportation business for 20 years, and she makes a good income from this. Together with her husband, Joseph, who is at the same time a tricycle driver, she is determined to work harder to provide for her family. Her children are helping her generate income for their everyday needs. 

Her tricycle unit basically carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. This is where she gets her income and usually she earns a minimum of PHP 500 every day.

Mercedes wants to apply for a PHP 22,000 loan assistance to continue operations of their business. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and accessories and also for the maintenance of their motorcycle. Aside from their tricycle, she also operates and maintains a room for rent business as shown in the above picture.

In the future, she wants to have another unit of tricycle and rooms for rent, and she hopes that her family is always in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and accessories and for the maintenance of their motorcycle.

loans.name: Noela

texts.en:
Noela is 66 years old, married and has three children. To provide her family needs and to help her husband, she engaged in a sari sari store business to earn income. She decided again to take a loan to buy additional goods for the store to sell and be able to increase her store inventory and generate more income.

Noela wants for the future to expand her business to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is a mother of two children. At the age of 44, she became engaged in a sari sari store business to earn a living and help her husband to provide for her children's needs. 

She decided again to take a loan to purchase grocery items to sell in the store and to increase the inventory of the store to generate more income

Gilda wants for the future to invest other businesses in addition to her current business.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items to sell in the store.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a married woman. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 33 years old and has three children, who are currently in school.

Judith has a jeep transportation business in the Philippines. Judith requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional spare parts, gasoline and maintenance for her business.

Judith has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts, gasoline and maintenance for her business

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is 56 years old, married with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Eden has a food vending business in the Philippines. Eden requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Eden has been in this business for four years. In the future, Eden would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Jonabell

texts.en:
Jonabell is 32 years old and married with five children, four of whom are in school. Jonabell works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like noodles, canned goods, egg, sugar, etc.

Jonabell has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Jonabell would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like noodles, canned goods, egg, sugar.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Sonia is 35 years old and both of her children are in school.

Sonia has a business buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Sonia requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more livestock to sell.

Sonia has been in this business for two years. In the future, Sonia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to sell.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Evangeline works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Evangeline is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell for her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. Evangeline hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Jeddy

texts.en:
Jeddy works hard to support her family. Jeddy is married and has a candy-making business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Jeddy has been in this business for 4 years now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She runs a business buying and selling nipa roofing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of nipa roofing to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like a general store.

Maricel dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of nipa roofing to sell.

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
Maria, una mujer de 56 años de edad llena de sueños y aspiraciones en su vida, vive en una finca en el municipio de Bello y se gana la vida con la producción y venta de pollos y huevos.  
Con este trabajo intenta sostener a su familia compuesta por su hijo.
Es un trabajo que ha venido ejerciendo desde hace aproximadamente 5 años con el fin de salir adelante.

Pide un apoyo económico para la compra de pollos, gallinas ponedoras, alimento y materiales para su galpón.

Con este préstamo podrá tener un negocio más sostenible y consolidado.

Con un préstamo que hagas hoy podrás mejorar la vida y el negocio de Maria!
texts.en:
56 year old Maria is full of dreams and aspirations for her life. She lives on a farm in the municipality of Bello and she earns a living raising and selling chickens and eggs. 
She tries to support her family (she has a son) with this work. 
She has been doing this work for about 5 years with the goal of getting ahead. 
She is requesting economic support to buy chickens, laying hens, food, and materials for her barn.
With this goal, she will have a more sustainable, consolidated business. 
With the loan that you make today, you can improve Maria's life and business!

loans.use: to buy chickens, laying hens, food, and materials for her barn.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy drinks

loans.name: Mohira

texts.en:
Mohira is an active girl. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1994. She is living in small town with her family. She is a communicative, hardworking and honest person. Recently she has been working in a school. 

She wanted to have her own business. She participated in a three-day training provided by IMON to women who are interested to be a good entrepreneur and know how to do business. Mohira has had many years of practice sewing traditional women's clothes and wanted to continue her activity doing that business. 

She is planning to do business and save up money to her further education. She asks a loan from KIVA lenders to buy a sewing machine to sew traditional women's dresses. She hopes to have permanent clients and gain income from her activity.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to sew traditional women's dresses.

loans.name: Sydney

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Sydney works hard to support her family.

She has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Sydney is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her bicycle for her bicycle transport business.

Sydney has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her bicycle

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 59 years old, married, and has six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Nilda has a business buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.

Nilda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more livestock to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of household goods to sell. She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like raising pigs.

Gina dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods to sell

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 25 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Mary Jane has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from e-loading (a mobile prepay service).

Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream - to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Lenit Maria

texts.en:
Lenit Maria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a personal products business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy more items like body lotion, perfume and other personal care products.

Lenit Maria successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing her business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like body lotion, perfume and other personal care products.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman with ten children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Susan is 48 years old and has three children who are in school.

Susan has a business buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Susan requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more livestock to sell.

Susan has been in this business for five years. In the future, Susan would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to sell.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios works hard to support her family. Remedios is widowed.  She buys and sells fruit for her business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fruits to sell.

Remedios has been in this business for 20 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. Teresita is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing supplies.

Teresita has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Teresita would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing supplies

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 48 years old and married with five children. With three children still in school, Vicenta works very hard to provide for them.

Vicenta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Vicenta has been in this business for 5 years. 

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia, 33 years old, is married and she works from home as a tailor. She has been in this business for two years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income. When Nazia was not generating an income, her family was going through a severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Her husband was the sole breadwinner of the family, so Nazia felt it obligatory to change her family’s living standards and started working from home. 

Nazia's hard work helped her establish a good clientele but she was having difficulty in fulfilling large orders. She contacted with BRAC Pakistan and applied for a loan to buy stocks of threads in different colors, packs of buttons, needles and laces in order to meet the demands of her customers without fail. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her four children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of threads in different colors, packs of buttons, needles and laces.

loans.name: Nasira

texts.en:
Nasira is a 40-year-old lady, living with her spouse and four children in Lahore, Pakistan. She wants to make some savings so that she can provide better living facilities to her children but it seems impossible in the absence of a profitable source of income.

Her husband has been driving an auto-rickshaw for many years; his income is insufficient to feed the entire family. He has to maintain the auto-rickshaw body but he does not have sufficient cash in hand to fix the problem. 

Therefore, Nasira has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can replace the auto-rickshaw body with new one. 
She hopes that she will be able to make enough savings by the time her children are getting married. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a new rickshaw body.

loans.name: Davronjon

texts.en:
Davronjon is a handsome boy. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1994. He is living in a small town in a family of workers. He was an active student at school and graduated with excellence. He had a dream to enter University and get a higher education. He made a choice to major in geology, than decided to widen his knowledge and was interested to study medical biology. 

He is used to studying and being active in order to become a good specialist and be useful to his motherland. His parents are simple workers. His mother is a teacher at a secondary school and his father is an emigrant. It is hard to find a good place to work because the average salary here is not enough to feed a family monthly. 

They did not have money to pay his tuition fees. Davronjon asked for a loan from KIVA lenders to pay his higher education costs and finish his studies in order to become a specialist. He hopes to achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to pay his higher education costs and finish his studies in order to become a specialist.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy soda

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en:
Rahima is a strong woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1965. She is living in small village with attractive mountains, fresh nature and poor water. She is married and has three children. 

She has many years of experience in agriculture. She planted cereals and potatoes. She is well known among agrarians and friends. 

She needed to open a new business in order to support her husband financially. She takes care about her family and participated at three days of training for startup clients. She is planning to buy livestock and start a new business. 

Rahima asked a loan from Kiva lenders to buy livestock. She awaits your kindness. This loan will help her to live better.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Asrorjon

texts.en:
Asrorjon is an active boy. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1993. He is living in a remote district with his family. He had a dream from his school years to study at university. He wants to open his business in the field of food production and entered university to get knowledge and be a specialist. 

Now he is studying and specialising as a food technologist and is one of the active students in his class. He is recommended by teachers and students as an honest person. Before opening his own business he wants to work in domestic production factories to have experience in his field. 

However, his family does not have money to pay tuition fees for his studies, so he tries to get as much as he can. Asrorjon is requesting financial support from KIVA lenders to pay his tuition fees. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Umida

texts.en:
Umida is a hardworking woman. She was born in southern part of Tajikistan in 1987. She is living in small village where agriculture is the most common business. She is married and has one child. Her husband did not find a good place of work with enough salary to feed his family and had to go abroad to earn. 

She has two years of experience doing business in agriculture. She bought agricultural products like tomatoes, cucumbers, and greens from rural places and sold them to village and domestic small stores. It was hard for her every time to sell products, because she received little money from this activity.

She decided to plant agricultural products in her small nearby house yard and sell her harvest in domestic markets. She appealed to IMON to buy seeds  of vegetables to plant and to start doing business in agriculture. 

She hopes to be supported and her first business will get her more money to live better.

loans.use: to buy seeds of vegetables to plant and to start doing business in agriculture.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn would like you to know her full appreciation and thanks because her previous loan has indeed helped her in buying additional products for her business. She has faithfully repaid an amount of PHP 50,000, which she used to buy additional inventory. 

Still, Marilyn would like to improve her sales more. So, she is humbly requesting another PHP 50,000 loan which she will use to purchase more merchandise. Hopefully, her customers will buy more items if she has more products displayed in her store. 

At some time in the future, Marilyn wants to renovate her house and be able to save for her children's education. If they finish their studies someday, it will give them great security for better lives ahead. 

Marilyn meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for ready-to-wear products and merchandise like polo shirts for men and women.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 55 years old, married with four children.  

Juliet is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Juliet requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Juliet has been farming rice for three years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Juliet would like to save enough money to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en:
Shumaila is a 29-year-old married woman.  

She has been doing embroidery on a machine at home for the past five years to support her family. In fact her husband is also doing same business at home but earns an insufficient income to support the family. So that is why she helps her husband in his tasks regarding the embroidery; she herself sells embroidered dresses in her town. By now she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. She has become expert in embroidery on a machine and wants more raw materials for embroidery so that she can easy cope with the increasing demand for her arts. 

She is a mother of three sons and two daughters. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales. She wishes to utilize a portion of her revenues to provide a quality education for her children.

Shumaila thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase raw material for embroidery.

loans.name: Muqadas

texts.en:
Muqadas is a 27-year-old married woman and a mother of two sons. She is a hardworking and independent mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services at her home. She has been doing this for the past few years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. 

She has been doing a tailoring business at home for many years with the help of her sister-in-law. She wants to buy an additional sewing machines for her sister-in-law, but she does not have enough cash in hand.

Therefore, Muqadas has requested a loan for her tailoring business so that she can easily buy a sewing machine for her sister-in-law. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Andres David

texts.es:
Andres es un joven emprendedor y dinámico de 19 años de edad, estudiante universitario y comerciante independiente; ya que desde hace 2 años comenzó a vender alimentos en una tienda de abarrotes con el fin de generar ingresos para aportar a la economía de su hogar y para pagar sus estudios.

El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para fortalecer su negocio, pues invertirá el dinero en la compra de surtido al por mayor de granos, dulces, galletas, comprara un equipo de sonido para su negocio y surtido de licor, además realizara algunas reformas locativas, brindando mayor variedad y un mejor servicio a sus clientes, lo que hará más rentable su negocio.

Trabaja con un familiar durante 8 horas diarias.

Andres tiene el firme propósito de sacar adelante su proyecto productivo, pues quiere convertirse en una empresaria exitosa y garantizar una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar para su grupo familiar y sabe que con los prestamistas de Kiva y la Corporación Interactuar puede lograr todo eso y más.
texts.en:
Andres is a young, dynamic entrepreneur who is 19 years old, goes to university, and has his own business. It's already 2 years since he began selling food in a grocery store with the goal of generating income with the goal of contributing to the household economy and paying for his studies. 
The loan that he is requesting will strengthen his business. He will use the money to buy grains, candy, and cookies wholesale, to buy a sound system for his business, and to stock it with liquor. He will also make some repairs, offer a greater variety of products, and better service to his customers, which will make his business more profitable. 
He works 8 hours a day with a family member. 
Andres has the clear goal of making his project a success. He wants to become a successful businessman and to guarantee a better quality of life and wellbeing for his family. He knows that, with the help of the Kiva lenders and the Corporación Interactuar he will be able to achieve all this and more.

loans.use: to buy grains, candy, and cookies wholesale and to buy a sound system for his business, and to supply it with liquor, and to make some repairs.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Rowena works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. 

Rowena is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase gasoline, fishing net, etc. for her fishing business.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline, fishing net, etc.

loans.name: Allah Rakhi

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi is a 49-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son has owned an enterprise of stitching and selling embroidered dresses in nearby towns for many years. He has been recruiting skilled persons to do embroidery work for daily wages; he also brings some material home for Allah Rakhi because she helps him in embroidery work. He is very expert in his profession; he is especially famous for bridal dresses. People like his arts and appreciate his efforts. 

He wants to meet the demand of bridal dresses. That is why he wants to buy stock of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors in advance. He requires some capital to buy the desired inventories but does not have sufficient cash on hand. Therefore, Allah Rakhi humbly requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan. Through this loan her son will be able to buy stock of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors. 

Allah Rakhi is very glad and thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase stock of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors.

loans.name: Reena

texts.en:
Reena is 33 years old and living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of one child.

She owns a beauty parlor and is an expert in makeover services. Most of her clients are from the neighborhood and appreciate her services. With the passage of time her beauty products have been diminishing and now she wants to buy more beauty products for her beauty salon. 

Therefore, Reena has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so she will be able to buy new cosmetics products such as facial cream, bleach cream, nail polish, hair color, lotion, etc.

She wants to establish a parlor in the main market of town because she wants to enhance her income. Reena thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase new cosmetics products such as facial cream, bleach cream, nail polish, hair color, lotion, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Mutabar

texts.en:
Mutabar is a strong woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1977. She is living in a small village near mountains with poor water but a fresh and pretty atmosphere close to nature. She is married and has six children. Because her family is big, she and her husband need to work together. 

In order to start a business, Mutabar appealed to IMON and participated to training for startup clients. She decided to open her business in agriculture by keeping livestock. She has experience in this field from her childhood. She has good conditions to keep livestock. 

She requests a loan to buy small livestock and do business. She awaits Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to buy small livestock and do business.

loans.name: Dúo Dany De Santo Tomas Group

texts.es:
Dúo Dany de Santo Tomas
Este dúo está formado por doña Celinda Noemí, ella tiene 44 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de pollo amarillo, pollo blanco , papas, pechugas empanizadas, medallones, alitas ahumadas, en su pollería llamada mi pollito, desde ya hace dos años, ella está solicitando el crédito para la inversión de compra de pollo en general para surtir un poco mas su pollería ya que con el capital q trabaja ya no le es tan suficiente, y necesita surtirlo más,espera que le puedan dar el apoyo que nececita para seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
Group: Dúo Dany de Santo Tomas
This duo includes Celinda Noemí. She is 44 years old and works selling chicken, potatoes, breaded chicken breasts, chicken medallions,and smoked wings, in her poultry store called "My Little Chicken". She has been doing this for 2 years. She is requesting a loan to buy chicken to supply her poultry store as the capital she has earned from her work so far isn't enough and she needs more supplies. She hopes that she can get the support she needs to continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy chicken meat.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina is a strong woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1977. She is living in a small city with her family. She is divorced and has two children. She brings up and feeds her children alone. Madina is a responsible, hardworking and honest person. 

In order to live without any scarcity she decided to work and earn money. She rented a place in the market and wished to open a grocery store. 

Unfortunately, her money was not enough to buy goods. She appealed to IMON and participated in a training for Start-up businesses. Madina requested a loan to buy grocery products for her store. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders. This loan will help her to earn money and feed her family.

loans.use: to buy grocery products for her store.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 50 years old and single.

She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal for years and also earns an income from a general store.

Violeta requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional charcoal to sell.

Violeta has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Melende

texts.en:
Melende is 42 years old and married with three children who are in school. Melende works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines. Melende has been in this business for six years. 

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like spices, chips, canned goods, soft drinks, etc.

In the future Melende would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like spices, chips, canned goods, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a hardworking entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines. She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like buying and selling vegetables. 

Esther requested a PHP 1,7000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell.

Esther dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy calves and start a new business

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion is 63 years old, married, and has eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Asuncion has a food-processing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. 

Asuncion requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials and ingredients like peanuts, sugar and plastic jars.

 In the future, Asuncion would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients and materials  like peanuts, sugar and plastic jars.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is 61 years old, married, and has seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Paz has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 17 years.

Paz requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more items like blouses, pants, school uniforms, and other ready-to-wear clothing. In the future, she would like to save money to provide a good future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like blouses, pants, school uniforms, and other ready-to-wear clothing

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Remedios has been in this business for three years now.

Remedios requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 48 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Eva runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Eva would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Pablo Emilio

texts.es:
Pablo es un hombre con mucha experiencia en el campo. 

Es humilde y sencillo, tiene un gran don de gente y energía suficiente para poder cualquier cultivo a producir.

El tiene un cultivo de caña de azúcar el cual trabaja todos los días en el municipio de Tierra Alta.

Gracias a sus años de experiencia y enseñanzas que le dio su padre desde niño, tiene plena capacidad para trabajar y para asesorar en estos temas a los demás agricultores de la zona que necesiten ayuda con su producción. 

El solicita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, semillas y pesticidas, de esta manera inyectara capital a su actividad y mejorara sus cosechas de una manera significativa enfrentando la dificultad más grande que tiene que son el clima tan cambiante que afecta su cosecha.

Tiene mucha fe en su negocio y grandes esperanzas en las personas solidarias que apoyan a los campesinos trabajadores del Colombia como lo hace la Corporación Interactuar.

Apoya a un humilde agricultor para que pueda sacar adelante sus tierras con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Pablo is a man with a lot of experience farming. He is humble and simple, and he has great people skills and sufficient energy to be able to grow any crop. He has a sugar can crop, which he tends to everyday in the city of Tierra Alta.

Thanks to his years of experience and the teachings his father has given to him since he was young, Pablo is well-equipped to work and advise other farmers on agricultural topics that live nearby and need help with their production.

Pablo is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, seeds, and pesticides to inject capital into his business and significantly improve his harvest in the face of his biggest difficulty, which is the ever-changing weather that affects his harvest.

Pablo has a lot of faith in his business, and great confidence in the caring people who support the peasant farmers of Colombia like Corporación Interactuar does.

Support this humble farmer so that he can the job done on his land with a loan!

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, seeds, and pesticides to inject capital into his business.

loans.name: Abondia

texts.en:
Abondia is 59 years old, married and has three children. To earn a living, she does fish vending in the market and earns an income of 4,000 PHP a month. It helps the family a lot for their daily needs.

Abondia decided again to take a loan to buy more fish to sell so that she can generate more income. She wants to have her own fishing net and fishing boat for fishing in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia works hard to support her family.

Cecelia is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy an additional bundle of fishing net.

Cecelia has been in this business for 1 year now. In the future, Cecelia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional bundle of fishing net

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 31 years old and married with three children.  With two children in school, Analiza works very hard to provide for them.

Analiza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Analiza would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 35 years old, married and has four children, three of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs, in the Philippines. Maribel requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds and vitamins.

Maribel has been raising pigs for 1 year now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maribel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 42 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. Alicia works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 10 years.

Alicia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like chips, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc. In the future, she would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like chips, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Jerley Celestina

texts.es:
Jerley, radicada zona rural del municipio de Sincelejo, siempre se ha desempeñado en el sector agropecuario al lado de su familia donde aprendió estos menesteres. 

Lleva unos 3 meses con su propia cría de cerdos de engorde para la venta y distribución en varias zonas del su pueblo, actividad que aprendió a través de su hermano mayor quien la instruyo.

Sueña con mejorar el número de cerdos para criar y solicitó a la Corporación Interactuar un crédito con el que adquirirá varios Porcinos y los insumos para la alimentación y sostenimiento de estos.

Las ganancias obtenidas por el aumento de sus animales será mucho mayor lo que le permitirá tener un mejor nivel de vida sin tanta dificultad económica.

De este negocio dependen sus estudios universitarios.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener una casa propia y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Jerley lives in a rural area of the Sincelejo municipality. She has always worked in pig agriculture with her family. She learned the work from them.
She has had her own hog business for three months. She raises them to fatten for sale and distribution in various areas of her village. She learned this work from her elder brother.
She dreams of improving the number of hogs she has to raise, and requested a loan from Corporación Interactuar with which she will acquire various hogs and supplies to care for them.
The income she will make by increasing her stock of hogs will be much higher, and this will allow her to have a greater standard of living without so much economic difficulty.
Her university studies depend on this business.
Her greatest dream is to have her own home and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy various hogs and supplies to care for them.

loans.name: Emerita Argentina

texts.es:
La señora Emérita de 65 años de edad es soltera radica en la ciudad Nacaome Valle, se dedica desde hace 01 años  al negocio de renta de video juegos en su casa de habitación, Ella es una mujer trabajadora con muchas ganas de salir adelante.
Doña Emérita solicita L. 6,000 para comprar Pan, refrescos, sopas, churros, y elaborar golosinas ya que se acerca la semana santa y donde ella radica hay un rio el cual es muy visitados por turistas y ella está viendo una oportunidad de negocio en la semana mayor. A su negocio llegan muchos jóvenes del centro educativo y vecinos de la comunidad ya que los juegos que ella renta son del gusto de los jóvenes, como se puede ver en la fotografía los juegos permanecen rentados varias horas al día.  Ella agradece a Prisma por este crédito. 
Doña Emérita con el apoyo de este préstamo espera mejorar sus ingresos y obtener mejores utilidades para tener una vida mejor.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo 2015.
texts.en:
Mrs. Emérita, age 65, is single. She lives in the city of Nacaome Valle, and for one year has had a business renting video games in her home. She is a hard-working woman with a great desire to succeed.

Emérita is requesting 6,000 lempiras to purchase bread, pop, soup, and churros, and to make candy. Holy Week is approaching, and where she lives there is a river that is well-visited by tourists. She sees a business opportunity for this week. 

Many young people from the education centre come to her business, as well as neighbours, because her video games are well-liked by youth. As can be seen in the photo, the video games are rented many hours per day. Emerita is grateful to Prisma for this loan.

With the support of this loan, Emerita hopes to improve her income and obtain more options to have a better life.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - March 2015.

loans.use: to purchase bread, drinks, soup, and churros, and to make candy.

loans.name: Guljahon

texts.en:
Guljahon is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1994. She is living in a small village with her family. She is married, and her husband is an emigrant.

She wants to open her own business and appealed to IMON to participate in startup training to know more about business and what kind of business will be more effective to have now. Guljahon is a talented and skillful person. She can sew and considered it would be easier to do business in the sphere of serving people that she can do.

Guljahon is asking for a loan to buy a sewing machine and start her business. She hopes to sew beautiful traditional items for Tajik women and have permanent clients every day. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy sewing machine and start her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mill for maize.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: La Sra. Hilda es una viuda de 38 años de edad que vive actualmente sola. Tiene 2 hijos que dependen de ella, uno de los cuales se encuentra estudiando en el nivel primario y otro en el nivel secundario. Vive en el departamento de Chuquisaca y trabaja en la ciudad de Monteagudo. La actividad principal de la Sra. Hilda es el comercio de verduras. Trabaja arduamente en su actividad de comercio de lunes a domingo para cubrir los gastos de alimentación, ropa, servicios básicos y otros gastos en los que incurre el hogar. Es por eso que requiere el financiamiento de un crédito que será destinado a la compra  de verduras para ampliar el tamaño de su negocio, con dicha compra la cliente aumentará su actividad de comercio y por ende podrá incrementar de manera eficiente sus ingresos y mejorará las condiciones de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Hilda is a 38-year-old widow who currently lives alone. She has two children who depend on her, one of whom is in elementary school. The other is in high school. Hilda lives in the Chuquisaca department and works in the city of Monteagudo. She sells vegetables. 
She works hard in her business, every day of the week, to feed and clothe herself and her family and to them with the basic necessities and household costs.
For this reason, she needs a loan. She will use it to purchase vegetables to expand her business. With this purchase, her clientele will increase and her business will expand. She will be able to increase her income and improve the living conditions of her entire family.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 47 years old, married and has four children. She wants to help her husband in providing their living. That is why she engaged in a fish vending  business to earn profit and sustain the daily needs of her family. She borrowed again to purchase materials for fishing boat repair, so that they can be able to catch more fish and have more sales in the market.

Jocelyn's plan for the future is to buy another fishing boat, to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for fishing boat repair.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a young woman living in Nairobi's slums and in search of an opportunity to improve her life.  She started working as a sales agent for iSmart Kenya, where she earns an income selling green energy products like clean cookstoves and solar lamps in her community.

She is learning valuable job skills in sales, customer service and professionalism that will help her throughout her lifetime.  Please help Alice in her quest for financial independence by funding this Kiva loan.

loans.use: to pay for green energy products to sell in informal settlements in Nairobi

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es:
Alexander es un joven muy trabajador y con un gran corazón campesino que ha sido fortalecido con la humildad y la sensatez que distingue a los habitantes del municipio de Sonsón.

Vive en una finca con sus padres, quienes han sido su más grande apoyo y maestros de la vida. Aprendió de de la agricultura a través de su padre y  empíricamente, es decir a través de la práctica y la observación de otras personas. 

Su crédito lo piensa usar en la compra de insumos agropecuarios como semillas de arveja, productos para el control de plagas, y abonos para realizar mantenimiento y sostenimiento a sus cultivos.

Gracias a este crédito, la economía y  calidad de vida de su familia mejoraría pues podrá aumentar sus ingresos. 

Alexander sueña con tener una mejor vivienda en un futuro y tener un negocio que sea sostenible.

 ¡Impacte la vida de Alexander y su familia con un crédito!
texts.en:
Alexander is a very hardworking young man, with the great heart of a peasant farmer who has been strengthened by the humility and good sense that distinguishes the residents of the city of Sonsón.

He lives in a house in the country with his parents, who have been his greatest support and the best teachers in his life. He learned how to farm through his father and through empirical observation, or in other words, through his own experience and the observation of other people.

Alexander plans to use his loan to buy agricultural supplies such as pea seeds, pest control products, and fertilizer to maintain and sustain his crops.

Thanks to this loan, the financial well-being of his family and their quality of life will likely improve since he will earn more income.

Alexander dreams of owning a better home in the future and of having a sustainable business.

Make an impact on the lives of Alexander and his family with a loan!

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as pea seeds, pest control products, and fertilizer to maintain and sustain his crops.

loans.name: Jose Ramon

texts.es:
EL señor  José de 49 años  de edad es casado radica en la ciudad de Nacaome Valle y se dedica a la venta de PAN desde hace 08 años sus ventas son en diferentes aldeas donde se transporta en un Vehículo vendiendo Pan.
Don José  está solicitando el crédito ya que quiere invertir mas en compra  de este alimento que día a día lo consumen los Hondureños ya que es una tradición consumir pan con café a diario.
Don José es un hombre muy trabajador con muchos deseos de salir adelante y agradece a Prisma por la oportunidad de acceder a un crédito.  
Don José solicita el préstamo por L. 6,000 para la compra de PAN como semitas, pan blanco, galletas, polvorones, campiranas, marquesotes y pan de yema. Con el apoyo del crédito él pretende aumentar sus productos  y mejorar sus ingresos.
Don José su sueño es que en su próximo crédito mejorar mas su vivienda y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. 
San Lorenzo, Valle - Marzo 2015
texts.en:
José, age 49, is married and lives in the city of Nacaome Valle. He has sold bread for 8 years. He sells in various neighbourhoods, using his vehicle to transport and sell bread.
José is requesting a loan because he wants to invest more in the purchase of bread. This is a product consumed by Hondurans day in, day out; it is a tradition to eat bread with coffee daily.
José is a very hard-working man with a great desire to get ahead. He is grateful to Prisma for the opportunity to get a loan.
José is requesting a loan of 6,000 lempiras for the purchase of bread such as white bread, cemita, biscuits, shortbread, campirana bread, sweetbread and yema bread. With this loan, he intends to expand his products and improve his income.
José's dream is that his next loan will improve his home and provide his family with a greater quality of life.
San Lorenzo, Valle - March 2015

loans.use: to purchase bread: white bread, cemita, biscuits, shortbread, campirana bread, sweetbread and yema bread.

loans.name: Dúo Lirio De Los Balles Group

texts.es:
Dúo lirio de los valles 
Don Jose luis trabaja de panadero y como actividad secundaria se dedica a la agricultura. Tiene sembrado maíz, frijol, y hace poco empezó a sembrar chile pimiento y chile picante tiene varios tablones en donde las plantas ya están floreando, el quiere sembrar más hortalizas y solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, abono químico, orgánico y foliares, ya que su sueño es seguir creciendo como agricultor.
texts.en:
Dúo lirio de los valles 

Don Jose Luis works as a baker, and as a second job, he makes a living as a farmer. He plants corn and beans, and just recently started to plant red peppers and hot peppers. He has various plots of land where his crops are flourishing right now. He would like to plant more vegetables, and he is requesting a loan to buy seeds, chemical fertilizer, organic fertilizer, and compost. His dream is to continue growing as a farmer.

loans.use: to grow more vegetables.

loans.name: Alene

texts.en:
Alene is 39 years old, married with seven children.

Alene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, cooking oil, etc .

Alene has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 1 year and also earns an income from farming rice and E-Loading.

Alene aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, cooking oil, etc

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 40 years old and married. She runs a general store in the Philippines. Corazon has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles, and other personal care products. 

Corazon requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Hosea

texts.en:
Hosea, 50, is a smallholder dairy farmer from Shamata village in Ndaragwa, Kenya. He owns a one acre piece of land where he stays and works. His family is composed of him, his wife and 3 children, aged between 19 and 27.
 
For 36 years, Hosea has been farming for a living. Currently, he owns 2 cows named Queen and Kadogo (informal Swahili word meaning 'little'). This year, Hosea is planning to grow the number of stock and expand the cowshed. He is seeking a loan investment from Kiva lenders to accomplish this.

With your loan, Hosea will be able to purchase a high yielding dairy cow. The quantity of milk Hosea supplies to his customers is projected to increase by 30 to 50 percent with the new acquisition. The increased income will help him to raise his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and expand his cowshed

loans.name: Bequi Patricia

texts.es:
La Señora Bequi  de 28 años de edad,  tiene 3  hijos  ella tiene el apoyo total de su esposo, radica en la ciudad  de Choluteca al sur de Honduras, y se dedica desde hace 8 años  al negocio de venta de ropa nueva y sandalias tiene el negocio ubicado en el mercado, y los fines de semana sale a vender a las meloneras cuando las meloneras pagan sus planillas ella visita a los empleados y les vende ropa y sandalias ya que en esos días los clientes tienen dinero y pueden comprar sus productos de contado.
Bequi está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de ropa nueva como blusas, camisas, pantalones, calzonetas, camisetas, buzos y sandalias, con el apoyo de este préstamo ella  desea salir adelante con su negocio y hacerlo crecer.
Bequi su sueño es comprar un local para tener una tienda donde puede vender sus productos y tener variedades de productos.

Choluteca, Honduras - Abril del 2015.
texts.en:
La Señora Bequi is 28 years old, and she has 3 children. She has the total support of her husband and has settled down in the city of Choluteca in southern Honduras. She has made a living selling clothing and sandals for the past 8 years. She has a business located in the local market, and on weekends she travels to sell to workers in the melon industry. When the melon workers receive their pay, she visits them to sell clothing and sandals since the customers have money then and are able to buy her products with cash.

Bequi is requesting a loan to buy new clothes such as blouses, shirts, pants, underwear, T-shirts, sweatsuits, and sandals. With the help of this loan, she would like to move forward with her business and grow it.

Bequi's dream is to buy property so that she can have a store where she can sell a variety of her products.

Choluteca, Honduras - April 2015

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, pants, underwear, T-shirts, sweatsuits, and sandals for her business.

loans.name: Ana Lisa

texts.en:
To earn a living, Ana Lisa engages in banana production so that she can provide for the needs of her one child. At the age of 44, she is a successful business woman earning 5,000 PHP a month from her banana production business and that helps her family for living. 

Ana Lisa decided again to take a loan to buy fertilizer for her banana farm that will result in a good harvest and generate more sales of bananas in the market.

In the future, Ana Liza wants to expand her banana plantation area.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her banana farm.

loans.name: Abubakar

texts.en:
Abubakar is a sales agent working for iSmart Kenya, an organization with a mission to create jobs for youth and women in the slums. 

Abubakar has completed iSmart's sales and marketing training and is working as a door-to-door sales agent in Nairobi's slum communities. 

iSmart's best-selling product is the clean cookstove, which has an efficient design that saves customers money by reducing the amount of charcoal needed by half. These cookstoves also reduce toxic smoke emissions and are better for the customer's health as well as the environment.  

Please help Abubakar earn a living and bring these beneficial products to others in his community.

loans.use: to pay for green products to sell in informal settlements in Nairobi.

loans.name: Sirga

texts.en:
Sirga is a generous woman who was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1975. She is living in a small village surrounded by mountains and is married and has four children. They live in a big family. 

Sirga supports her husband and does household chores and keeps the family. However, the children are growing and needs are also increasing. 

In order to improve their quality of life, Sirga decided to work or to do a business. Because of her age, she could not find a good place to work. Then she decided to start a business. She appealed to IMON and asked advice on how to start a business. She was provided with a three-day training course for startup clients. 

The condition in her house has allowed her to keep livestock and she considered buying calves and keeping them for further trading. 

Sirga requested a loan to buy calves and start her activity. She hopes to be supported. The loan will help Sirga to start a new business and promote a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy calves and start her activity

loans.name: Reza

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Reza works hard to support her family.

Reza has a sugarcane business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from raising pigs. Reza is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her sugarcane business.

Reza has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.en:
Hermelinda is 60 years old and has six children. Hermelinda is married and one of her children is still in school.

Hermelinda is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Hermelinda requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Hermelinda has been this business for six years now and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy, a smallholder farmer from the Kisii area of Kenya, is passionate about dairy farming. He started dairy farming 20 years ago and still carries on today on his 2.5 acre farmland located next to a river. Currently he owns 4 dairy cows, 40 heads of poultry and has planted approximately 5,000 trees.
 
Still feeling plenty of youthful energy, Kennedy knows he can do more. He is therefore seeking a loan to purchase an additional dairy cow. Increasing the number of cows and employing the best modern techniques for feeding and health management are the only ways a dairy farmer can increase his farm's productivity and hence income.
 
Kennedy will use the increased income generated from his investment with your loan to improve his family's welfare and his children's education. Kennedy's family is composed of his wife, Margaret, and 5 children aged between 3 and 15. Tuition expenses are his highest annual cost.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Bebedor

texts.en:
Bebedor is a married woman with one child who is still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Bebedor is 22 years old.

Bebedor has a food vending business in the Philippines. Bebedor requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients such as meat, spices, soy sauce and utensils for her food production business.

Bebedor has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meat, spices, soy sauce and utensils for her food production business

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys works hard to support her family. Gladys is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Gladys requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of ingredients to sell.

Gladys has been in this business for five years now.

Gladys would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ingredients to sell

loans.name: Emilda

texts.en:
Emilda is 48 years old and married with eight children. With three of her children in school, Emilda works very hard to provide for them.

Emilda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Emilda has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Emilda would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Lemmah

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lemmah works hard to support her family.

Lemmah has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Lemmah is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell in her buy-and-sell rice business.
