Lemmah has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Noah

texts.en:
Imagine investing in a venture and reaping nothing at the end of the day. This is the sad story of Noah, a youthful 40-year-old Mzee (old man) - a wise farmer whose neighbors and fellow farmers respect as a mentor. He farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills near Eldoret in the northern Rift 
Valley region of Kenya. 

Noah's farming experience dates back to 2005. Like many other farmers in the region, maize is a staple crop which he has been planting for as long as he can remember. With time, the fertility of his land has started to dwindle and whenever he plants maize, the yields decrease with each cropping season. Noah has also had a problem with weeds. 

Today he is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy fertilizers, pesticides and good quality seeds. Through this loan, he is going to increase his crop production and this will translate into an improved level of income. This loan will permanently change his standard of living, and he thinks there is no doubt that one can find rewarding employment in farming.

If there is a smallholder farmer that you should consider lending to, then that farmer is Noah. Kindly help him out!

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides and good quality seeds

loans.name: Levelyn

texts.en:
Levelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a furniture making business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her furniture making. She has been in this business for 11 years now.

In the future, Levelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her furniture making business

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is 58 years old, married and has one child.

Leticia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Leticia requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Leticia has been in this business for six years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Norbilita

texts.en:
Norbilita is a dealer of a collection of personal products, and she sells items like beauty soap, body spray, toothpaste, lotion, deodorant and powdered soap. She is a 53-year-old married woman with three children from Loon, Bohol. She has been engaged in this kind of business for 3 years now.  

Norbilita is in need of capital to sustain her business. She has requested a loan in the amount of 12,000 PHP to buy stock like powdered soap, toothpaste and lotion. With this she will be able to cater to her customers' orders and deliver on time. She will be able to pay her obligations and balance her finances. Thus her daily income will start to improve and she can start to expand. 

Norbilita is determined to work hard with this loan and to become more sustainable in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy stock like powdered soap, toothpaste and lotion

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is very much thankful to Kiva and to all lenders. He was able to improve his profit from his junk shop business through the financial assistance given to him. He already paid the loan, and he seeks another loan to be used for his Piso Net (similar to an Internet cafe) business.

He desires to also increase his earnings from his Piso Net business, so he is asking again for an amount of PHP 30,000. Romeo will buy two additional Piso Net units he needs to make this happen. Simultaneously, he could sustain the needs of his family through the help of this assistance.

Romeo hopes to grow and expand soon. He desires also to have more time for the Lord and family. He always pray for good health and strength for every member of his family. He meets every week with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy two more units for his Piso Net business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Compra de maquinas de costura para ampliar su taller, recibir mayor cantidad de pedidos y mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su pequeño hijo.

loans.name: Joelita

texts.en:
Joelita is 55 years old and married with nine children, one of whom is in school. Joelita works very hard to provide for them.

Joelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Joelita has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items, such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 59 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Susan has a food-production business in the Philippines. Susan requested a PHP 9,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Susan has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Susan would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a married woman who is 53 years old with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Erlinda has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in the market.

Erlinda has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in the market

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en:
Aiza is a 36-year-old married woman with two children who are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Aiza has a food production/vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business. She has been in this business for 3 years. 

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona works hard to support her family. Chona is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like clothes, threads, tailoring chalk, etc.

Chona has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Chona would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like clothes, threads, tailoring chalk, etc

loans.name: Dinnah

texts.en:
Dinnah is a repeat client to the institution. She is married and has five children. Four of her children attend school. 

Dinnah has a primary a job that she has done for 15 years. However, the salary she gets from this job is not enough to meet all her financial needs. Therefore, she decided to join UGAFODE for financial assistance to supplement her salary. 

Dinnah applied for a loan of UGX 3,000,000 to renovate her house and pay tuition for some of her children. Dinnah hopes with financial assistance from UGAFODE she will be able to improve her standard of living and be respected in society.

loans.use: to  renovate her homestead.

loans.name: Demia

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Demia works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending and raising pigs. Demia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy an additional bundle of fishing net and other equipment for her fishing business.

Demia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional bundle of fishing net and other equipment.

loans.name: Munfiat

texts.en:
Munfiat is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1985. She is living in a historical small town. 

She is married and has two children. Her husband is in Russia. He seldom sends money; it depends on his part-time work. 

Munfiat, as a strong woman, does business herself in order to feed their family until her husband comes. For almost two years, she has done business in a domestic market. She trades men’s wear such as shirts, sweaters, pants, sweatshirts, jumpers, etc. 

The season is coming, and Munfiat wants to buy a new assortment of men’s clothes. She is asking a loan from Kiva lenders to buy men’s clothing. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy men’s clothing

loans.name: Doien

texts.en:
Doien is 33 years old and married with one child who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Doien has a food-production business business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Doien has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 61 years old and married. She has ten children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, milk, coffee, noodles, etc.

Elena has borrowed and paid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, milk, coffee, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester works hard to support her family. Ester is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of fish to sell.

Ester has been in this business for 32 years now.

In the future, Ester would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of fish to sell.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina works hard to support her family. Christina is married and has a butcher shop business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more meat to sell.

Christina has been in this business for 20 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more meat to sell.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin, 30, is a brilliant and resilient smallholder mixed-farmer from Suneka, located in the Kisii area of Kenya. Even in his young age, he is still the caring family man who is committed to his good-looking wife, Verah. 

For the past six years, the couple's primary income sources have been milk, eggs, crops and some personal business. Edwin is seeking a loan to purchase a high-yielding dairy cow. The cow he wants may be pricier than dominant breeds, but he will get real value for his money when it comes to milk production. Edwin will also be able to get more cow dung for manure and fuel. With your loan, he will kill two birds with one stone: increased milk production and reduced costs. This will greatly boost his profit margin and thus his income. 

When asked, "How will this loan benefit your family?" Edwin replied, "My family will get food and more income and thus better living."

Kindly help out an enterprising man with a desire to succeed with a loan!

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry and construct shelter for them.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Matilde is 45 years old and married with one child who is school. Matilde works very hard to provide for them.

Matilde runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Matilde has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Matilde would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Hezel

texts.en:
Hezel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Hezel has been in this business for 15 years. Hezel earns additional income from fishing.

Hezel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Melvin Patricio

texts.es:
Melvin se ha dedicado a la carpintería gran parte de su vida, pues desde muy temprana edad inició trabajando como empleado en algunas carpinterías y ebanisterías donde aprendió a realizar la actividad. 

Melvin al ver que su trabajo estaba muy mal remunerado decidió independizarse y montar su propio taller de carpintería donde gracias a la buena calidad de sus trabajos ha podido tener una gran cantidad de clientes. 
Trabaja con 2 empleados durante 12 horas todos los días.

Melvin se encuentra casado y es padre de 2 hijos, a quienes siempre les ha querido ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades de progreso. 

Debido a que tiene dificultades de capital, ha tenido que rechazar algunos pedidos de sus clientes por la poca capacidad para conseguir las materias primas necesarias. 

Con el ánimo de mejorar esta condición, aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de materias primas como madera, pegante, clavos, entre otros, para la fabricación de grandes pedidos de sus clientes. 

Melvin aspira que el préstamo le permita elaborar estos pedidos sin que se afecten sus ingresos mensuales. 

Además, Melvin espera que el negocio le genere ingresos con los cuales pueda ofrecerles a su esposa y sus 2 hijos una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Melvin has worked in carpentry a large part of his life. He started working as an employee at a very early age in some carpentry and cabinet makers where he learned the business. Melvin seeing that his work was poorly remunerated, decided to go out on his own and open his own carpentry shop where thanks to the good quality of his work, he has been able to amass a good quantity of clients. He works with two employees twelve hours every day.

Melvin is married and is the father of 2 children to whom he has always wanted to offer a better quality of living and better opportunities to progress. As he has problems with capital he has had to decline some orders from clients due to his limited capacity to obtain the needed raw materials. With the desire to improve this situation he is hoping for a loan that allows him to buy raw materials like wood, glue and nails amongst others to manufacture large orders from his clients.

Melvin hopes that the loan will help him to fill these orders without affecting his monthly income. Melvin also hopes that his business generates income so that he can offer his wife and children a better quality of living and more opportunity to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like wood, glue and nails amongst others to make large orders for his clients.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a 67-year-old client, who is married with four children. She operates a retail shop at a rural trading center in Nyarushanje, which she has operated for over 25 years. Her major challenge is limited capital. Therefore, Miriam decided to join UGAFODE for financial assistance so as to add capital to her business. She applied for a loan of UGX 2,500,000 to buy more sugar, posho, soap, and rice so as to serve more customers. This will increase her sales and profit.

Miriam appreciates UGAFODE and Kiva lenders for the generosity.

loans.use: to restock her retail shop.

loans.name: Isnaida

texts.en:
Isnaida is 27 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of household goods to sell.

Isnaida has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of household goods to sell

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is 37 years old, married and has five children. She wants to help her husband in providing for her children's needs; that's why she engages in a fish-vending business and earns income of PHP 5,000 per month — that helps her family a lot for their daily needs. 

She borrowed a loan again to buy spare parts for the fishing boat to be able to continue catching fish and having more fish to sell in the market to earn more income.

Riza wants for the future to buy a new fishing boat for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for the fishing boat.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 58 years old and married with five children.

Letecia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Letecia has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from fattening pigs.

Letecia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah is a smallholder farmer from the Kapsowar area of Kenya who keeps dairy cows for their milk. Some of the milk produced is consumed by his family, but most of it is for sale. This year, Jonah is determined to improve his family's livelihood by diversifying his agri-business.

Jonah is seeking a KES 40,000 loan to purchase sheep and fence the edges of his farm. With the sheep, he will get additional income from selling wool and mutton. The new products will also help him mitigate the business risk of offering only a single product. The fence will help control sheep movement because, unlike cows, sheep are extremely mobile. He is afraid of losing his stock, so the fence will prevent them from straying into the forest neighboring his farm. 

He hopes the investment will bring enough return to uplift his family's livelihood.

loans.use: to buy sheep and fence his farm

loans.name: Ubaldo Antonio

texts.es:
Ubaldo es un campesino de 59 años de edad, trabajador y humilde, que desde niño aprendió a realizar todas las labores del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres. 

Esto le ha permitido progresar y, hoy en día posee cultivos de zanahoria y papa, cultivos que atiende todos los días y las cosechas son vendidas en la plaza de mercado del municipio de Chinu, adicionalmente, realiza labores de jornalero en diferentes fincas de la región, pues con ello complementa los ingresos con los que vela por el bienestar de su familia.

Con el apoyo del crédito solicitado en la Corporación Interactuar, comprará insumos agrícolas al por mayor como abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes y otros, con esto seguirá cuidando sus cultivos y tendrá una mejor cosecha, más productiva y asi mejorará los ingresos a la hora de vender sus productos.

Ubaldo, con su espíritu emprendedor, su pujanza y tenacidad, quiere seguir luchando para cumplir el sueño de tener una finca propia, en la que pueda cultivar mucha más variedad de productos y así mejorar la rentabilidad del negocio, garantizando una estabilidad económica para su familia.
texts.en:
Ubaldo is a 58 year old farmer. He is hard-working and humble. He learned to do all the labor in the fields since he was young thanks to the teaching of his parents. This has allowed him to get ahead and today he has crops of carrots, and potatoes. He tends the crop every day and his harvests are sold in the plaza of the municipal market in Chinu. He also works as day labor on different farms in the region as it compliments the income that he uses for the well-being of his family.

With the help of a loan from the Interactuar Corporation he will buy agricultural inputs wholesale like manure, pesticide, fertilizer and others. Doing this he will continue to care for his crops and have a better and more productive harvest which will improve his income when he goes to sell his product.

Ubaldo with his entrepreneurial spirit , his drive and tenacity wants to continue to strive to fulfill the dream of having his own farm where he can grow a much greater variety of products and thus improve his profits, guaranteeing economic stability for his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs wholesale like manure, pesticide, fertilizer and others.

loans.name: Dorys Isabel

texts.es:
Laboriosa y soñadora, son dos palabras que describen perfectamente a Dorys, una mujer trabajadora y de familia, que hace lo que este a su alcance para ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y esposo.

Se dedica a la cría y venta de cerdos en el municipio de Chinu.
Esta es una actividad muy común en esta región y gran parte de sus habitantes la practican.

Ella posee gran conocimiento en esta materia y considera que necesita un pequeño impulso para incrementar sus ventas y aumentar su negocio, es por esta razón que solicita un auxilio económico para invertirlo en la compra de materiales para el mantenimiento del corral donde alberga sus animales como madera y palma.

Con este préstamo podrá continuar con su actividad que es la única fuente de ingresos de su familia.

Se siente agradecida con los prestamistas de Kiva y con la Corporación Interactuar que hacen posible que su negocio crezca y mejore.
texts.en:
Dorys is a hard-working woman and a dreamer. She does everything in her power to give her children and husband the best quality of life. 

She makes a living breeding and selling pigs in the municipality of Chinu, a common activity in the region. She has a lot of experience in the field and feels she needs a small push to increase her sales and expand the business. This is why she is requesting financial assistance to buy materials to maintain the pen where she keeps the animals, such as wood and palm. 

Thanks to this loan she will be able to keep working and to support her family with their only income source. She is grateful to Kiva lenders and Corporacion Interactuar for making it possible for her business to grow and improve.

loans.use: to buy materials for the maintenance of her pen, where she keeps her animals, such as wood and palm.

loans.name: Sarun's Group

texts.en:
Sarun’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sarun makes a living cultivating rice, and he also does extra work as a tailor and construction worker to support his family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Tek's Group

texts.en: Tek’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Tek makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Francisco Miguel

texts.es:
Francisco vive con su pareja y tienen 6 hijos, vive felizmente junto con su familia en zona rural del municipio de Chinu.

En la actualidad ya cumplió 30 años de estar trabajando con la cría de cerdos de engorde, actividad con la que ha intentado sobrevivir y sacar adelante a su familia para que nunca les falte nada. 

Ha tenido dificultades económicas que han afectado su negocio y que lo han obligado a detener sus actividades en ciertas ocasiones. 

Sueña con mejorar el lugar para la cría de sus animales y también con tener una planta de engorde de cerdos, por esto pasa la solicitud de un préstamo, el cual invertirá en la compra cerdos de engorde los cuales tienen muy buena aceptación por la buena crianza y mantenimiento de los mismos. 

Su calidad de vida  y la de su familia se incrementará en la medida que aumentan las ventas de sus animales y alcance las metas establecidas para  un futuro no lejano.

Con el apoyo de este préstamo Francisco podrá continuar trabajando y podrá darle a su familia todo lo mejor.
texts.en:
Francisco lives with his wife and has 6 children. He lives happily together with his family in a rural part of the municipality of Chinu.

Today he is celebrating 30 years of working raising pigs, a business where he has tried to survive and get ahead with his family so that they have everything they need. He has had economic difficulties which have affected his business and has forced him to stop his work on occasion.

He dreams of improving his space for raising his animals and to also have a pig fattening plant. So he is requesting a loan which he will invest in buying pigs which he has had good success in raising and caring for. His quality of living and that of his family increase as the sales of his animals increase and will reach his established goals in the near future. With the help of this loan Francisco will be able to continue working and be able to provide his family with the best.

loans.use: to buy pigs which he has good success in raising.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lourdes works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from  raising pigs. Lourdes is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like fish, canned goods, vegetables, meat, etc., for her restaurant business.

Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like fish, canned goods, vegetables, meat, etc.

loans.name: Tadeo

texts.en:
Tadeo is a repeat client to the institution. He is married with 7 children.

Tadeo carries out cattle fattening as his major source of income. He has carried out this business for over 25 years. However, he was affected by limited capital to buy more cows to expand his business and meet all of his family's financial obligations. Tadeo decided to join for financial assistance, which enabled him to educate his children and meet his entire family's financial obligations. 

Tadeo is now applying for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to buy more cows to increase milk production because most of his children have completed school. Tadeo thanks Ugafode for financial assistance, which enabled him to educate his children, and encourages Ugafode to continue serving low income earners.

loans.use: To expand and improve his business by purchasing cattle for milk production

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew, 55, comes from Chepchoina village in Kitale, Kenya. Thirty years ago, Mathew married.  Four years later, he started farming as a means to make extra income for his growing family.  Today, he has 11 children, and his 10 acre farm has four dairy cows, 30 heads of poultry and trees on it. 
Despite all this activities, his farm land still has a lot of room to be explored. Mathew is seeking a loan of KES 30,000 to buy supplies to start crop farming on the remnant acreage. 
Making best use of all the space on his land will make him produce at optimum and use the returns to grow the business and improve the family's livelihood.

loans.use: to grow crops on his farm

loans.name: Argemiro Antonio

texts.es:
Argemiro, radicado en zona rural del municipio de Chinu, siempre se ha desempeñado en el sector agropecuario al lado de su familia donde aprendió estos menesteres. 
Lleva 5 años con su propia cría de cerdos de engorde para la venta y distribución en varias zonas del su pueblo. 

Sueña con mejorar el número de cerdos para criar y solicitó a la Corporación Interactuar un crédito con el que adquirirá varios Porcinos y los insumos para la alimentación y sostenimiento de estos.

Las ganancias obtenidas por el aumento de sus animales será mucho mayor lo que le permitirá tener un mejor nivel de vida sin tanta dificultad económica.

De este negocio dependen sus 4 hijos y su a quiénes ayuda mucho con los gastos de su hogar y con su estudio.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener una casa propia y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Argemiro lives in a rural part of the municipality of Chinu. He has always worked in agriculture alongside his family who taught him this work. He has been raising pigs on his own for 5 years to sell and distribute in various parts of his community.

He dreams of improving the number of pigs he raises and is requesting a loan from the Interactuar Corporation with which he will acquire a variety of pigs and supplies to feed and care for them. The profits obtained from the increase in animals will be much higher which will allow him to have a higher living standard without so much economic difficulty.

His 4 children depend on this business and ir will help him a lot with the household expenses and their studies. His biggest dream is to be able to have his own house and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to acquire a variety of pigs and food and sustenance for them.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a man dedicated to his work. At age 33, he spends every day of the week, Monday through Sunday, in his mixed farm, tirelessly working. James is, one of the most hardworking and dedicated men on planet earth. He is based in Kahuhia, a remote village in the Thika area of Kenya. He is happily married to Mercy, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with two lovely children. For the past 20 years he has been engaged in mixed farming, and through selling milk, eggs and a variety of food crops he has earned a decent income. Like many farmers in his village, he also plants trees on his farm to complement the region's natural forests. Although James makes profits selling his farm produce at the market, the biggest challenge he faces is lack of water to irrigate his farm and water for home consumption. James comes from an area where there is no water connection and he is always forced to walk for a long distance for this “precious commodity." James faces challenges carrying water on his back because of his failing health. 

James is seeking a loan to buy a water tank and water pipes. Most of the farmers in Kenya depend on rain-fed agriculture but James wants to change that notion and start irrigation farming. Through the loan he intends to harvest rain water (which always goes to waste) and store it in the tank. He intends to buy pipes that will be used to pump water from the river directly to his farm. With your loan, James will be saved the trouble of walking a long distance in search of water, and he will have enough water for home consumption. Irrigating his farm will boost productivity since water is an important requirement in the germination of crops. James is very excited about this project and hopes his dream will be achieved through the loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders. Increased productivity means increased income and this will translate to improved living standards. He will use the additional income to improve and secure the future of his children. James’s hope for the future is to live a fulfilling life.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank and water pipes.

loans.name: 08-03-01 Tây Sơn 3 Group

texts.en:
Hương has a retail business selling clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes to resell. Hương has been involved in this business for 5 years. The main hardship that Hương faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Hương is 35 years old and she is married with 2 children. Hương is the group leader of the 08-03-01 Tây Sơn 3 solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. Hương lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Hương joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Hương has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. 

With her business profit, Hương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria works hard to support her family. Maria is married and has a  fruit and vegetable business in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of fruits and vegetable to sell.

Maria has been in this business for 10 years now.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of fruits and vegetable to sell

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en:
Cleofe is 39 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, Cleofe works very hard to provide for them.

Cleofe runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, personal product and other groceries.

Cleofe has been in this business for 4 years now. 

In the future, Cleofe would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, personal product and other groceries

loans.name: Jeorina

texts.en:
Jeorina is 27 years old and is married.  She has two children.  Jeorina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jeorina has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from clothing sales.  Jeorina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 38 years old and married with seven children, four of whom are in school. Lorena works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal.

Lorena has been in this business for 4 years. 

In the future Lorena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 36 years old. She is married and has one child who is in school.

She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Marivic requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Marivic has been raising pigs for 6 years now and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Marivic would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is a new client to the institution. He is married and has three children and one dependent. He has two children who attend school. 

Elias deals in coffee trading and has a motorcycle taxi as his major sources of income. He has done his businesses for 13 years. However, he cannot compete favorably in the market due to limited capital. Elias joined UGAFODE for financial assistance and he applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to boost his business of coffee trading. 

Elias thanks UGAFODE for the financial assistance which he hopes will enable him to expand his business.

loans.use: to boost his coffee trading business by buying coffee for trading.

loans.name: Upendo Wa Akina Mama Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Eunice, a member of Upendo Wa Akina Mama group. She is twenty-seven-years old, married and a mother of two children.

The group joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2012 and have gone through training on Group Formation, Saving and Resource Mobilization, Enterprise Development, Financial Management, Value Addition & Focus on Environment. Eunice does poultry keeping and also operates a kiosk selling food stuffs. She has benefited much from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training that enabled her start keeping chicken and run her business well.

Eunice is borrowing from Kiva to expand the poultry business by buying more chicks and chicken feeds. This will increase her income from the sale of chicken. The anticipated income will assist in improving her living standard and she will be able to provide for her family's basic needs.

Eunice is grateful to Kiva and her lenders and promises to repay on time.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and chicken feeds to help boost her poultry farming.

loans.name: Ukala Tukile W.g Group

texts.en:
The lady seated in the photograph is Hellen, 38 years old, married and blessed with 4 children who are all in school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in the year 2014 to benefit from savings mobilization and enterprise development training.

She is involved in a ballast selling business to earn a living. She is borrowing from Kiva to buy more ballast to increase her stock for her ballast selling business for increased income.  She will also be able to meet the demand of her customers and earn more income that she will use to pay for her children's food and clothing.

Hellen is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy more ballast to increase stock in ballast selling business for increased income to enable her pay for her children's food and clothing.

loans.name: Enock

texts.en:
Enock is a repeat client at the branch. He is married and has seven children.  All of his children are in school. However, he has two grandchildren, both of whom are in school, so he pays for their tuition.

The cattle trade is his primary source of income. But his major business challenges are fierce competition and limited capital.

Therefore, he decided to join UGAFODE. He is seeking a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 UGX to supplement his capital and to be able to better compete in the market. Enock thanks UGAFODE for financial assistance, which has enabled him to expand his business and educate his children. From now on, he is concentrating on expanding his business. Enock appreciates your support towards to his growth.

loans.use: To expand and improve his business by buying more cows for trading purposes

loans.name: New Africa Group

texts.en:
Josephat, who is in his late 40's, is married, with one daughter who is still at school.  He has been running a retail shop business for three years now.  He works from 7.30am to 10pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Josephat's second loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to increase the shop inventory and he managed to meet his customers' demand.  He is doing fine and has managed to pay back his loan successfully.  He used the profit to pay school fees, loan repayment and covered household expenses.  He will use this loan to buy shop inventory like sugar, beans, flours, cooking oil,rice etc.  He dreams of extending his shop. 

Josephat will share this loan with his loan group New Africa which consist of eight members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy shop inventory like sugar, beans, flours, cooking oil, rice, etc.

loans.name: 13.03.03 Quảng Thành Group

texts.en:
Mrs Liên works in agriculture, raising poultry. Liên has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future. Liên is 52 years old and she is married with four children. 

Liên is the group leader of the 13.03.03 Quảng Thành solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. This is Liên's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. The main hardship that Liên faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Liên hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Sokun

texts.en: Sokun is 24 years old and single. He lives in the Siem Reap Province in Cambodia. Nowadays, he studies management and is in his second year. Sokun has also worked in the tourism field since 2012, making an income of $8 each day. Due to a shortage of finances to pay his second year tuition fees, he needs a loan. This loan will help him have enough finances to go through the second year at the university successfully. After graduation, he dreams of working in a bank with a reasonable salary and he wants to save money to build a proper house for his parents.

loans.use: to pay his second year tuition fees

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard engages in selling dried fish. He has a stall situated inside the marketplace. He is a 36-year-old single  man, residing in the town of Loon, Bohol. He has been a dried fish vendor for 4 years already. He has insufficient funds to sustain his existing livelihood.

He  is asking for a loan to buy supplies like fish and salt. These supplies will be used in producing more dried fish to sell. This will  enable Bernard to slowly augment his daily earnings. Thus, he could pay his obligation and start to handle his finances. He could now  set aside some savings and able to expand his business.

He is very grateful for the loan he will access. He could now be able to continue to operate his business and he is hoping that he could handle it properly for a sustainable living.

loans.use: to buy supplies like fish and salt

loans.name: Joylyn

texts.en:
Joylyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase plastic bags, fish, etc., for her business.

Joylyn has been in this business for nine years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase plastic bags, fish, etc., for her business

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.  She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like selling clothes and frozen foods, and farming sugarcane businesses. 

Dina dreams that one day, she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is a hardworking, woman entrepreneur with six children.

She runs an herbal medicines business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of herbal medicines to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fattening pigs. 

Valentina dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of herbal medicines to sell.

loans.name: Milenda

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Milenda works hard to support her family.

She has a beuaty salon business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a buy and sell used clothing business.  Milenda is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase more materials and equipment for her beauty salon business.

Milenda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials and equipment for her salon.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 43 years old and has three children. Elvie is married and has two children who are in school.

Elvie is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Elvie requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Elvie has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elvie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Rasheeda

texts.en:
Rasheeda is 56, a mother of five children, and is living with her children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  She is receiving a loan for her son who owns a business of selling  vehicle tires.  He is a young and energetic person.  Through this business, he generates income for his family.

Her husband has grown old and weak. He gets rest at home due to weakness. Her son wants to buy more vehicle tires to grow his business, but he does not have a sufficient amount to buy more tires.  Therefore, Rasheeda contacted Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan and presented her humble request for taking a loan for her son so that he will buy more tires to resell. 

Rasheeda seems very happy after taking this loan. She thanks Kiva and hopes that the lenders will take an active part to support her.

loans.use: a loan helps Rasheeda's son in purchasing vehicle tires for reselling.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Janice is 32 years old and has one child in school.

Janice has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Janice has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Janice would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is the age of 49. She is married and living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
 
Her husband owns a livestock trading business and does most of his trading within the city. He purchases goats, billy goats, bull calf, heifers etc. from rural areas and sells them in the city. He has to feed and look after his livestock which is very tough for him in his old age. He works and earns money for the survival of both of them. 

He does not have other sources to generate income for his family. He has to wait until Muslim sacrifice day (Eid-Ul-Azha) for generating maximum income. He uses this profit amount for the whole year. He wants to buy stock of fodder to feed his cattle but he does not have enough cash remaining. Therefore, Rehana has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy fodder's stock to feed his cattle.

Rehana is very pleased after taking this loan and thankful to BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to help her husband in purchasing fodder's stock to feed his cattle.

loans.name: Jose Amilcar

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y dos hijos con edades de 10 y 2 años, tiene como negocio una tienda de productos varios y ofrece a sus clientes el servicio de transporte a toda hora del día, sus labores inician muy temprano cada día.
Invertirá en nueva mercadería para ofrecer a sus clientes un mejor inventario, comprara, aceite, detergentes, jabón, bebidas, papel higiénico, entre otros productos que sus clientes necesitan, pretende mantener a sus clientes satisfechos y mejorar la competitividad del negocio.
Espera tener nuevos ingresos que serán de utilidad para hacer mejoras en su vivienda y comprar un nuevo vehículo.
texts.en:
José lives with his spouse and two children who are aged 10 and 2. He has a store selling various products as well as offering his customers transport services around the clock, his work starts very early every morning.

He will invest in various products so that he can offer a larger range for his customers, he will buy oil, detergents, soap, drinks, toilet paper and other products that his customers need. He wants to keep his customers satisfied and make his business more competitive.

He hopes to have more income which will be useful for making improvements to his home and to buy a new vehicle.

loans.use: to buy oil, detergents, soap, drinks, toilet paper and other products that his customers need

loans.name: Matunda S. H.g Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Joyce, who is sixty-four-years old and married with four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in the year 2014 to benefit from training on enterprise development and financial management. 

Joyce practices farming to earn a living. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase farm inputs, e.g., a sprinkler, hosepipes and storage sacks. This will help increase production resulting in more income to enable her to pay for construction of modern housing and quality health care for her family.

Joyce is grateful to Kiva and her lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, e.g., a sprinkler, hosepipes and storage sacks for increased production and income.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en: Trinidad is 56 years old, married and has five children. She is managing a small store for income. Her spouse is sick and he needs continuous medication. She needs income to sustain her family. She is asking a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, biscuits, soap, shampoo and noodles to sell. This will help increase sales capacity and provide for a continuous flow of income. She hopes to save additional revenue for her family's emergency expenses.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, biscuits, soap, shampoo and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, biscuits and bread to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 47 years old, married, and supports seven family members. She has been a small-scale farmer for the last 10 years and the business earns her a monthly income of KES 8,000.

Alice has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya, which she plans to use to buy farm tools and inputs such as fertilizers so as to improve her agricultural produce for sale in the market. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and to educate her children.

Her future hope and dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy farm tools and inputs such as fertilizers so as to improve her agricultural produce for sale in the market.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 26,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like farming sugar cane.

Teresa dreams that one day, she will be able to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Narces Antonio

texts.es:
Con su gran empuje y perseverancia, Narces ha salido adelante y ha podido educar y sostener a su numerosa familia conformada por 9 hijos y su esposa.

Siempre ha buscado la manera de obtener ingresos para su familia, tanto así que ha pasado por numerosos trabajos en el municipio de Chinu.

Hoy en día, después de haber decidido por su independencia hace 16 años, trabaja en la fabricación de artículos y objetos artesanales en el material llamado cañaflecha.

Por esta y muchas más razones solicita un préstamo para compra materia prima como cañaflecha e insumos como agujas y pegas.

Con este préstamo podrá asegurar la sostenibilidad de su negocio y por ende de su familia.

Si prestas a este crédito estarás aportando al progreso y empuje Colombiano!
texts.en:
With great effort and perseverance, Narces has advanced and been able to educate and sustain his large family, which is composed of nine children and his wife. Narces has always sought the best means of obtaining income for his family. Thus, he has tried numerous jobs in the municipality of Chinu.

Today, after deciding to become independent some 16 years ago, he works at fabricating artisan objects made from the material known as “canaflecha” (a local cane used in weaving hats, bracelets, etc.).

For these and many other reasons, Narces is requesting a loan to purchase primaary materials such as canaflecha, as well as inputs like needles and glues.

With this loan, he will assure the sustainability of his business and, as a result, his family. If you choose to support this loan, you will be supporting a Colombian enterprise striving towards progress!

loans.use: buy primary materials such as a local cane used in artisan work, and to purchase inputs, including needles and glues.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu is a woman with one child whom in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marichu is 44 years old now.

Marichu has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like shirts, etc. .

Marichu has been in this business for 23 years. In the future, Marichu would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shirts, etc.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 25 years old with one child in school. Mary Ann works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Ann runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like noodles, canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 4 years now. 

In the future, Mary Ann would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like noodles, canned goods, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a smallholder mixed farmer from Ganga location in Chuka area of Kenya. John married 20 years ago and he has three children between 4 and 16years old.  He started farming 21 years ago to make additional income on top of his job's salary. Today, his two acre land has three cows, 13 heads of poultry, banana crops and a retail outlet where basic household items are sold. He is seeking a KES 50,000 to buy a chaff cutter for chopping fodder and mixing his animal feed. This asset will help him improve his animals' feed intake. 

Investment in a chaff cutter will not only result in higher milk production, for John, but also much improved family livelihood.

loans.use: to buy a chaff cutter

loans.name: Nhóm 02-Phố Xuân Minh-P.đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hương operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish and shrimp. Hương has been involved in this business for five years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish and shrimp to resell.

Hương is 33 years old, and she is married with two children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 02-Phố Xuân Minh-P.Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Hương joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Hương has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. The main hardship that Hương faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and shrimp to resell.

loans.name: Meridita

texts.en:
Meridita is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Meridita is 30 years old and has two children who are in school.

Meridita has a buy and sell used shoes business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy sacks of used shoes to sell.

Meridita has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Meridita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of used shoes to sell

loans.name: Nhóm 09 Thôn 10 Quảng Lưu Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoa operates a food stall/restaurant selling cake, sweets, sugar, and milk. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cake, sweets, sugar, and milk to resell.

Hoa is 46 years old and she is married with 4 children. Hoa is the group leader of the Nhóm 09 Thôn 10 Quảng Lưu solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Quang Xuong District, a rural area in Thanh Hoa Province.

This is Hoa's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Hoa has been involved in this business for more than ten years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is lack of capital. In the future, Hoa hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more cake, sweets, sugar, and milk to resell

loans.name: Wikwatyo Museo W.g Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Mercy, a member of Wikwatyo Museo W.g Group. She is 46 years old, is married and has three children, two of whom are currently attending school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 to benefit from training on enterprise development and financial management.

Mercy operates a beauty salon and is borrowing to buy more beauty products (e.g. hair braids and oils) to enable her to meet her customers' needs. This will increase her income and therefore allow her to pay for her children's tuition fees.

Mercy is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products (e.g. hair braids and oils) to enable her to meet her customers' needs and increase income to pay for her children's tuition fees

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Myrna is 48 years old and has two children who are in school.

Myrna has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Myrna requested a PHP 4000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Myrna has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Myrna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Naomi. She is 33 years old, married and a mother of three children.

She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa and has undergone all the six modules of training, namely group mobilization, saving mobilization, enterprise development, financial management, value chain and market linkage, and focus on environment.

She is a horticultural farmer and also has a retail shop. The two business activities assist her in meeting family needs. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds to help boost her farming business. This will lead to more profits that she will use to meet family expenses.

Naomi is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds that will help boost her farming business.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Natividad is 63 years old now.

Natividad has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Natividad requested a PHP 4000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed like garments, etc..

Natividad has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Natividad would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed like garments, etc.

loans.name: Nhóm 10-Phố Xuân Minh-P.đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Mrs Yến has a service business of cutting hair. Yến has been involved in this business for five years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more tools and devices to do her hair-cutting service.

Yến is 27 years old, and she is married with no children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 10-Phố Xuân Minh-P.Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Yến joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Yến has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. The main hardship that Yến faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Yến hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more tools and devices to do her hair-cutting service.

loans.name: Johana

texts.en: Meet Johana, a 53-year-old farmer from the Kapsowar region of Kenya. Johana lives in a very traditional home, characterized by granaries and older huts. He practices mixed farming, but his focus is more on the dairy side of his business. The high milk demand and good prices in the Kapsowar market is an incentive for farmers, including Johana, to step up their milk production and sales. Johana is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to buy a high-yield dairy cow. He is also going to use a portion of the money to insure the cow to cover uncertainties. Your loan will help a lot to increase Johana's milk supply to clients. Additional income from this investment will help him to scale up his business and meet his family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy a high-yield dairy cow.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Riza is 37 years old and has one child in school.

Riza has a raising pigs business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Riza has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Riza would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes works hard to support her family. She is married and has a retail business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. 

Lourdes has been in this business for 20 years now. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ready-to-wear clothing.

In the future, Lourdes would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ready-to-wear clothing

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Joel lives with his beautiful wife in Kapsowar, a small rural town in Kenya. The Kapsowar area is also referred to as the mango region of Kenya because half the mangoes consumed are from that region. He has been farming for the past five years and has never looked back. To earn a decent and honest living, he sells milk, eggs, and a variety of food crops.

Joel is satisfied with the returns he gets through farming. However, he wants to diversify and start horticulture farming. The main challenge he faces is accessing funds. He is kindly requesting a loan to start horticulture farming. To access funds, Joel joined Juhudi Kilimo, an institution that supports smallholder farmers with both financial and technical solutions. When asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo, he answered, “They assist small-scale farmers.”

Through horticulture, he will be able to improve his living standards and secure the future of his school-going children. In the long run, the ultimate goal for Joel is to permanently improve his family’s livelihood.

loans.use: to diversify and start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Ndemi Maendeleo Ya Wanaume Shg Group

texts.en: The person with his hand raised in the photo is Henry, sixty-eight years old, married, and blessed with seven children. Through Hand in Hand Eastern Africa's training he has gained skills on how to keep records, and he has been able to keep records for his enterprise. He is a mixed farmer growing maize, beans, sweet yellow passion fruits and mangoes, and he also does dairy farming. He is taking out a loan to boost his mixed farming enterprises by buying dairy feeds and pesticide for his crops. He looks forward to receiving more income from improved farm output. Henry will be able to pay school fees without difficulty and provide food and clothes for his family. He is grateful to Kiva for the help and support.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, such as dairy feed and pesticide, to help boost his farming.

loans.name: Carlos Arturo

texts.es:
Carlos es un Padre muy responsable de 2 hijos, ha tenido que pasar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando con su familia. 

Hace un tiempo montó su venta de huevos, para lo cual tiene una cantidad de gallinas que le permiten tener ciertas ventas. 

Sueña con ver su negocio crecer y sabe que con la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar y de las personas que apoyen su oficio podrá lograrlo.

Es por esto que busca un préstamo que le permita comprar más gallinas para poder incrementar su capacidad de producción de huevos y así responder a la demanda de sus clientes por los huevos.

De esta manera sus ventas se incrementarán considerablemente, además de que su negocio resurgirá y podrá salir adelante. 

Carlos también desea tener un gran negocio donde pueda utilizar toda la capacidad que pueda para sacarlo adelante y así ofrecerles a sus hijos un futuro económico estable.
texts.en:
Carlos is a very responsible father to two children. He has had to go through a great deal of adversity during his lifetime, although he has always had the strength to get ahead and to continue making progress with his family.

A while ago he set up his stall selling eggs, for which he has a number of hens which allow him a certain number of sales. He dreams of seeing his business grow and knows that with the help of Corporación Interactuar and the people who give support he will be able to achieve this.

This is why he is requesting a loan which will allow him to buy more hens to increase the amount of eggs he can produce and thus meet his customers demands.

This way his sales will increase considerably, and his business will be revived and he will be able to get ahead.

Carlos also wishes to have a large business where he can do everything he can to get his business off the ground and thus offer his children a stable economic future.

loans.use: to buy more hens to increase the amount of eggs he can produce and thus meet his customers demands.

loans.name: Nhóm 09-Phố 15-P.đông Sơn Group

texts.en: Mrs. Nhàn operates a food stall/restaurant where she sells fruit. She is applying for a loan to buy more fruit to sell. Nhàn is 38 years old, married, and has two children. Nhàn is the group leader of the Nhóm 09-Phố 15-P.Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of six members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa Province. In 2013, Nhàn joined the Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Nhàn has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that Nhàn faces in her business is a lack of capital. With her business profit, Nhàn hopes that her family will be healthy and happy, that her business will do well, and that she will be able to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and maize seeds to plant, so he will get a better harvest, feed his family and sell the remainder, so he can educate his children.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 49 years old and married, with five children to feed. She is engaged in a fish vending business together with her husband. She decided to take a loan to buy materials for fishing boat repairs so that they can continue catching more fish and make more sales in the market.

In the future, Lilian wants to purchase a  new fishing boat for expansion of her business.

loans.use: To buy materials for fishing boat repairs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts for service and maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is 42 years old and married. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Lea runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from rice retailing. Lea has requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, spices, coffee, milk, noodles, sugar, soft drinks, and personal care products.

Lea has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Ma. Juliena

texts.en:
Ma. Juliena works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 11 years now.

Ma. Juliena requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

In the future, Ma. Juliena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a married woman with eight children. She is 46 years old and four of her children are currently in school. 

Mary Jane is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has had a fish vending business in the Philippines for three years. She has requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Mary Jane would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ludelyn

texts.en:
Ludelyn is 34 years old and married with two children.  With both of her children in school, she works very hard to provide for the family.

Ludelyn runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has been in this business for 3 years. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell.

In the future, Ludelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en: As a married parent of three children, Perlita works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from raising pigs. Perlita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business. Perlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda is 39 years old and married. She works in agriculture, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Minda has been this business for 2 years now, and she has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Minda requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Priscah

texts.en: Priscah is a woman living in an informal settlement in Nairobi. She has come to iSmart in search of a job so that she can earn money to support herself and her family. At iSmart, Priscah sells life-improving products like solar lamps and clean cookstoves. She earns a commission on each sale that she makes. Please help Priscah earn a living and bring these beneficial products to others in her community.

loans.use: to pay for green energy products to sell in informal settlements in Nairobi.

loans.name: Mukadas

texts.en:
Mukadas is a gentle woman. She was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1972. She is living in a small town with her family. She is married and has four children. She is an active, bright, and responsible person. 

Mukadas has loved working in agriculture since childhood. Her family planted potatoes and cereal; she was also interested in and helped them with this activity. She wants to have her own business in agriculture. She is planning to buy livestock and start a business. They have good conditions in which to keep livestock.

Mukadas appealed to IMON and requested financial support from KIVA lenders to buy livestock for starting a new business. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy livestock for starting a new business

loans.name: Armelyn

texts.en:
Armelyn is 47 years old and married with six children, two of whom are in school. She earns a living by farming rice and corn in the Philippines. Armelyn has been farming rice and corn for 4 years and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

Armelyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.en:
Consuelo is 52 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Consuelo runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Consuelo would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ngwate Ngutwike S.h.g Group

texts.en:
The man raising his hand in the photo is Joseph.  He is 39 years old and has four children.  His wife passed away in 2012. 

He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in November 2011 to benefit from the training, especially on the savings mobilization, enterprise development and financial management.

Joseph is involved in poultry keeping, especially indigenous chicken.  He also does vegetable farming. He is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase more indigenous chicks to add stock to his poultry business.  This will increase his sales of eggs and chickens. 

With the anticipated increased income, he will be able to meet his family basic needs (goods, clothing and paying school fees).

He is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more indigenous chicks so as to add stock to his poultry business.

loans.name: Eulofia

texts.es: La señora Eulofia vive en Entre Ríos, Cochabamba en una casa alquilada, ya que decidió independizarse de sus padres para poder salir adelante por sí misma. Ella emigró del departamento de Chuquisaca hacia la zona del trópico para buscar mejores condiciones de vida. Cuando llegó, no tenía ningún inmueble pero por su esfuerzo y sentido de servicio fue acogida por la gente con la que vivía en ese entonces. Posteriormente, comenzó a trabajar en distintos rubros en los que se desempeñó de manera destacable, porque puso su mejor esfuerzo, siempre con el sueño de progresar. De esta manera, gracias a su sacrificio logró adquirir una pequeña propiedad agrícola donde actualmente produce yuca, que está cultivada en una superficie pequeña debido a que los recursos con los cuales cuenta actualmente no le permiten ampliar su producción a una superficie mayor. Por esto decidió solicitar un apoyo para ampliar su producción y realizar un mantenimiento a su cultivo de yuca, de esta manera lograra obtener mejores ingresos con los cuales podrá comprarse una vivienda y vivir más cómodamente.
texts.en:
Eulofia lives in a rented home in Entre Ríos, Cochabamba, since she decided to become independent from her parents to move forward on her own. She emigrated from the Chuquisaca Department to the Tropic zone to look for a better quality of life. When she arrived, she had no property, but due to her efforts and sense of service, she was welcomed by the people whom she lived with back then. Later, she started to work in different jobs which she performed outstandingly because she put forth her best effort, always dreaming of progress. 

This way, thanks to her sacrifice, she managed to acquire a small agricultural property where she currently produces cassava. It is grown in a small surface as her current resources do not allow her to expand production to a greater surface. For this reason, she decided to request support to expand her production and to carry out maintenance to her cassava crops. This way, she will obtain better income with which she will be able to buy a home and live more comfortably.

loans.use: to expand her production by maintaining her cassava crops in order to obtain better income and be able to buy a home.

loans.name: Yaseica Paola

texts.es:
Yaseica es una mujer muy entregada a su trabajo pues a sus 23 años de edad trabaja incasablemente todos los días de la semana de lunes a domingo en su negocio de salsamentaria. 

Madre de 2 hijos que depende totalmente de ella ve una oportunidad de una entidad que le brinda la confianza de tener un crédito para mejorar su negocio y soñar con su fábrica de producción de alimentos y hacerle creer que es posible alcanzar este sueño. 
Le dedica 10 horas diarias a su negocio.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido de licores, alimentos y un asador para la preparación de comidas. 

Con la ayuda de este crédito la señora Yaseica producirá mas alimentos y le permitirá obtener mejores ingresos para cada día darle mejores oportunidades de vida a sus dos hijos
texts.en: Yaseica is a woman who is very devoted to her work.  At 23 years old, she works incessantly every day of the week from Monday to Sunday in her deli business.  She's a mother of two children who totally depend on her.
