She sees this as an opportunity from this organization that is giving her the confidence of having a loan to improve her business and to dream of having a food production factory and to make her believe it is possible to achieve this dream.  She works 10 hours a day at her business.  She is requesting a loan to purchase an assortment of liquors, food, and a grill for preparing food.  With the help of this loan, Yaseica will produce more food and this will allow her to obtain better income so that each day she can give better opportunities in life to her two children.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of liquors, food, and a grill for preparing food.

loans.name: Nhóm 10-Kp14-Ngọc Trạo Group

texts.en:
Nga operates a food stall/restaurant selling processed food and has been involved in this business for 5 years. The main hardship that Nga faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more food to sell.

Nga is 31 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Bim Son, a semi urban town in the Thanh Hoa province. She is the leader of a 4-member group, the Nhóm 10-Kp14-Ngọc trạo solidarity group.  This is Nga's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

In the future, Nga hopes for her business to do well, to build a new house, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase more food to sell.

loans.name: Akaki

texts.en:
Akaki lives in Dusheti with his wife and their four children. 

He needs to work hard in two jobs to make a living for his family. Firstly, he works as a cabinet maker. Secondly, he has a chicken farm. 

With the help of this loan, Akaki will expand the chicken farm by buying young chicks, feed, and vitamins. It takes about 45 days for the chicks to grow up and four to five kilograms of feed. The chicken meat and eggs will be sold at the local market.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and feed for his chicken farm in order to increase his family's income.

loans.name: Antonia Regina

texts.es:
Antonia con 41 años de edad, vive en unión libre y es madre de 3 hijos. Durante su vida productiva se ha dedicado a diversas actividades de manera independiente, con lo que ha generado ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. 

Hace un tiempo, comenzó a realizar la actividad de comercialización de cerdos, pues los compra, los cría, engorda y posteriormente los vende según el peso adquirido por el animal, esto le permite obtener los recursos para continuar con el cuidado y sustento de sus hijos. 

La titular es una mujer luchadora, pujante, se esmera cada día para salir adelante motivado por su familia, esto la impulsó a solicitar el crédito con la Corporación Interactuar, para invertirlo en la compra de cerdos y lechones, así podrá tener disponibilidad suficiente para cumplir con los pedidos que le solicitan y mejorará su margen de utilidad e ingresos. 

De esta manera, Antonia espera avanzar un paso más hacia el cumplimiento de su sueño principal, que es formalizar su negocio y montar un expendio de carne, que sea rentable y perdurable en el tiempo y lograr una estabilidad económica para darle a sus hijos la oportunidad de una mejor educación y tener buenas condiciones de vida.

Mejora la vida de esta colombiana con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Antonia is 41 years old, lives with her partner and has 3 children. Throughout her adult life she has made a living doing different jobs in an independent manner which has enabled her to make an income to support her family. 

A while ago, she started to sell pigs which involves her buying them, raising them, fattening them and then selling them depending on the weight the animal reaches. This jobs means she is able to obtain the resources she needs to continue looking after and supporting her children. 

Antonia can be described as a vigorous fighter, who is motivated by her family to try to do her best each day to keep moving forward. This is what has driven her to apply for a loan with the Interactuar Corporation. She will invest it in buying pigs and piglets so she will be able to have enough pigs available to meet the demand of her customers and therefore improve her profit margins. 

Antonia hopes that this will help her to take a step closer towards making her biggest dream come true. Her dream is to formalise her business and set up a small butchers which will be profitable in the long run, enabling her to have enough economic stability to give her sons the opportunity to have a better education and a good quality of life. 

Improve this Columbian's life by giving her a loan!

loans.use: to buy pigs and piglets to stock her business.

loans.name: Nhóm 13-Phố 5-P.đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs Nhâm raises poultry and has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Nhâm faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more chicks to raise and sell.

Nhâm is 60 years old and married with 2 children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in the Thanh Hoa province. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 13-Phố 5-P.Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of 3 members.  

In 2013, Nhâm joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Nhâm has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

With her business profit, Nhâm hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks to raise and sell.

loans.name: Reinalda De Jesus

texts.es:
Con su sonrisa y gran corazón, Reinalda ha tenido una gran acogida en su vereda desde que vende alimentos a los jornaleros y campesinos que visitan su pequeño restaurante en casa hace 3 años con gran esfuerzo y con un deseo en su mente, el de salir adelante y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

Alterna este oficio con la cría de pollos y gallinas que en muchas ocasiones son insumos para sus platillos.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar insumos e ingredientes como harina, maíz, carne, aliños, entre otros.

Con estos ingredientes podrá continuar cocinando y preparando las delicias que con sus manos trabajadoras ha venido ofreciendo y sirviendo.

Apoya a Reinalda con su negocio y has que su vida sea mejor con un préstamo!
texts.en:
For the past 3 years Reinalda has been selling food to the labourers and farmers who visit her in her small restaurant in her house and her service, with her smile and her big heart, has been very well received. She makes a big effort motivated by the dream she has in her mind: moving forward and improving the living conditions of her family. 

She alternates this job with raising chickens and hens which end up being, in many cases, the ingredients for the dishes that she makes. 

The loan that she is requesting will be used to buy supplies and ingredients like flour, corn, meat, seasonings etc. 

Having these ingredients will mean she will be able to continue cooking and preparing the delights that she offers and serves up with her own hard-working hands. 

Support Reinalda with her business and help improve her life with a loan!

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients like flour, corn, meat, seasoning etc.

loans.name: Domingo Enrique

texts.es:
El señor Domingo desde muy joven se dedica a las funciones del campo tales como agricultura y cría de animales, actividades que le enseño su padre para que saliera adelante en su vida.

Hoy en día su actividad principal es la venta de equinos, tiene como objetivo mejorar su capital comprando un caballo y un burro que le permitan abastecerse y generar mejores ingresos, y esta es la razón por la cual solicita un préstamo.

Es padre responsable y amoroso con sus hijos, vive en una finca con ellos y su esposa quien ha sido su más grande compañía.

Sueña con poder otorgarles a sus hijos una educación de calidad para que más adelante se puedan defender solos y sean independientes.

Todos los días asiste su negocio y procura por hacer las cosas muy bien y sabe que con la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar podrá llegar muy lejos.
texts.en:
Since Domingo was very young he has worked in the area of agriculture and breeding animals, occupations that his father taught him so that he could advance his life. 

Presently his main business is the sale of horses. His objective is to improve his capital purchasing a horse and a donkey which will allow him to stock up and generate a better income. This is the reason he is asking for the loan. 

He is a responsible and loving father to his children, and lives on a farm with them and his wife who has been his best companion. 

He dreams that he will be able to give his children a quality education so that they can take care of themselves and be independent in the future. 

Every day he goes to work and makes sure that things get done well, and he knows that with the help of Corporacion Interactuar he will be able to get far.

loans.use: to purchase a horse and a donkey that will allow him to stock up and generate a better income

loans.name: Mary Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y poder ofrecerles una buena educación a sus 4 hijos son las metas que motivan a levantarse y trabajar duramente a la señora Mary, quien con su negocio de cría de gallinas ponedoras y cerdos ha logrado ser útil y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. 

Mary buscando ser más competitiva, más prospera frente a la competencia, perdurar en el tiempo, mejorar las ventas, tener mayor existencia en su granja quiere solicitar un crédito para comprar cerdos y gallinas ponedoras para asi tener una producción de huevos y carne más alta y ser una distribuidora a considerar en la vereda del municipio de Momil.
texts.en:
What motivates Mary to get up in the morning and work hard is her goal of improving her housing conditions and being able to offer her 4 children a better education. By setting up her business raising egg-laying hens and pigs, she has managed to make herself useful and help her husband with the household expenses. 

Mary's aim is to be more competitive and more prosperous up against the competition as well as having a business which stands the test of time, improving her sales and enjoying a better existence on her farm. She wants to request a loan to buy pigs and egg-laying hens so she can increase her production of meat and eggs and become a highly-considered distributor in her village in the Momil district.

loans.use: to buy pigs and egg-laying hens to be able to have an higher production of eggs and meat.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Ruth works hard to support her family.

She has a used clothing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dry goods. Ruth is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell for her used clothing business.

Ruth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rosmiry

texts.en:
As a married woman, Rosmiry works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Rosmiry is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of household goods to sell for her general store business.

Rosmiry has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 52 years old and married with seven children, one of whom is in school. Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries.

In the future Jocelyn would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new griddle.

loans.name: Pedro Miguel

texts.es:
Pedro es un veterano con mucha experiencia en el campo. 
Es humilde y sencillo, tiene un gran don de gente y energía suficiente para poder cualquier cultivo a producir.

El tiene un cultivo de plátano y yuca el cual trabaja todos los días para vender sus cosechas en la plaza de mercado del municipio de Tierra Alta, adicionalmente trabaja en la ganadería.

Gracias a sus años de experiencia y enseñanzas que le dio su padre desde niño, tiene plena capacidad para trabajar y para ayudar en estos temas a los demás agricultores de la zona que necesiten ayuda con su producción. 

El solicita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, semillas de plátano y pesticidas, de esta manera inyectara capital a su actividad y mejorara sus cosechas de una manera significativa enfrentando la dificultad más grande que tiene que son el clima tan cambiante que afecta su cosecha.

 Tiene mucha fe en su negocio y grandes esperanzas en las personas solidarias que apoyan a los campesinos trabajadores del Colombia como lo hace la Corporación Interactuar.

Apoya a un humilde agricultor para que pueda sacar adelante sus tierras con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Pedro is a man with many years of experience in the countryside.  He is modest and unassuming.  He has a great gift for people and enough energy to be able to have whatever he grows be productive.

He cultivates banana and yucca.  He works every day to sell his produce in the market in the municipality of Tierra Alta.  He also works in ranching.

Thanks to his years of experience and the teachings that his father gave him since he was a child, he has full capacity to work and to help other farmers in the area who need help with their production.

He is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, banana seeds and pesticides and in this way inject capital into his business and improve his harvests in a significant way while facing the great difficulty of the changing climate which affects his harvest.

He has a lot of faith in his business and great hope in the caring people who are helping those who work in the fields of Colombia like the Corporacion Interactuar is doing.

Support a humble farmer with a loan so that he can make progress with his farming!

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, banana seeds and pesticides and in this way inject capital into his business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 53 years old, married to Ogega and she supports 8 family members. 

She has been a dairy farmer for the last 20 years and the business earns her a monthly income of KES 13,000.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya.  She plans to purchase a dairy cow to enable her to increase the number of litres of milk supplied to her clients daily and to meet their demand. 
 
She hopes to use the anticipated profit to repay the loan and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow to enable her to increase the number of litres of milk supplied to her clients daily and to meet their demand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a cow so as to increase the number of litres of milk produced per day for supply to her customers.

loans.name: Rosy

texts.en:
Rosy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Rosy has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from food vending and raising pigs.

Rosy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Oscar Rene

texts.es:
Oscar, es casado, vive con su esposa, ambos administran un negocio de venta de comida desde hace 8 años, así generan ingresos para subsistir, lo desempeñan con mucha satisfacción y responsabilidad para conservar su buena popularidad en la comunidad.
Pensando en ofrecer mejor variedad de comida hace la solicitud de un préstamo para invertirlo en verduras, condimentos, bebidas, carnes, granos básicos, leña, gas, etc., continuara elaborando la comida que tanto gusta a sus clientes.
Aspira a mantener una imagen de persona responsable y trabajadora entre sus vecinos, también desea continuar trabajando para reducir las necesidades que tiene en su hogar.
texts.en:
Oscar is married and lives with his wife. Together they have been running a business selling food for eight years, and making a living out of it. They carry it out with a lot of satisfaction and responsibility to preserve their great popularity in the community.

They are planning on offering a greater variety of meals. Therefor he is requesting a loan to invest in vegetables, seasoning, drinks, meat, basic grains, firewood, gas, and so on. He will continue to cook the meals, his customers like so much.

He aspires to maintain his image of being a responsible and hard-working person among his neighbors. He also wishes to continue to work to reduce the needs of his household.

loans.use: to invest in vegetables, seasoning, drinks, meat, basic grains, firewood, gas, and so on. He will continue to cook the meals, his customers like so much.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Grace, 35 years old, married and blessed with three children.

She does banana farming. Through Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training she acquired skills on enterprise development, financial management, savings and resource mobilization. She has been able to improve her farming through production of quality products which has enabled her to earn more profits from the local traders within the area. This has enabled her to improve her living standards and take good care of her family.

Grace is borrowing a Kiva loan to expand her farming by buying vegetable seeds which are currently in high demand in the area and thus earn more profit.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as vegetable seeds to help expand her farming.

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
Rosa es Humilde y trabajadora, una mujer guerrera que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al cuidado de sus hijos, vive en el municipio de Momil, donde se gana la vida con la preparación de alimentos variados como almuerzos y desayunos para los trabajadores del campo colombiano.

Trabaja sola todos los días durante todo el día, pues su trabajo es constante y variado.

Sus alimentos son conocidos por los vecinos de la vereda, quienes visitan su restaurante porque saben que podrá comer de una manera deliciosa.

Rosa ha decidido mejorar su negocio y aumentar sus ventas, por esta razón acude a un préstamo para comprar ingredientes e insumos para sus recetas como carne, verduras, granos, entre otros, además comprar algunos utensilios de cocina para mejorar su trabajo.

Este préstamo le permitirá sacar adelante su negocio para obtener así los ingresos necesarios que le den la oportunidad de continuar sosteniendo a su familia y su negocio.

Apoya a esta mujer con un préstamo y haz realidad sus sueños!
texts.en:
Rosa is humble and hard-working. She is a fighter who has spent a long part of her life caring for her children. She lives in the municipality of Momil, where she makes a living preparing various foods such as breakfasts and lunches for field workers.
She works alone every day during the day, but her work is constant and varied.
Her food is known by the locals. They visit her restaurant because they know they will be able to eat delicious food.
Rosa has decided to improve her business and increase her sales. For this reason she has requested a loan for the purchase of ingredients and supplies for her recipes, such as meat, vegetables, and grains. She will also purchase some kitchen utensils to improve her work.
This loan will allow her to get her business ahead in order to obtain an income to give her an opportunity to keep supporting her family and her business.
Support this woman with a loan and make her dreams reality!

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies such as meat, vegetables, and grains, and to buy kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: La señora Hilda de 41 años de edad es casada y tiene tres hijos. Ella vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba, donde se dedica a la actividad pecuaria junto con su familia (producción de leche), para lo cual cuenta con 19 cabezas de ganado y una experiencia de 21 años. Es a través de esta actividad que la familia obtiene sus ingresos, ademas de los que genera su esposo como albañil de construcción. La señora es una persona muy responsable y ahora se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para la compra de insumos secos, ya que las recientes lluvias e inundaciones de la zona afectaron su actividad gravemente, dando lugar a que pierdan gran parte de su forre en los terrenos junto con las cosechas de alimentos correspondientes. Adicionalmente, los intentos de recuperación de cosechas para alimentar al ganado provocaron gastos fuertes inesperados para la familia. Si la Sra. Hilda no cuenta con este crédito no podrá seguir con el ritmo de producción necesario, y tanto ella como su esposo tienen  muchas ganas de superar esta dificultad, para mantener su nivel de ingresos y satisfacer las necesidades de su familia siempre velando por su bienestar.
texts.en:
Hilda is 41 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in the city of Cochabamba, where she makes a living raising cattle with her family (milk production), for which they have 19 heads of cattle and 21 years of experience. It is through these activities that the family obtains its income, in addition to that earned by her husband as a bricklayer.

She is a very responsible person and now she sees it necessary to ask for a loan to purchase dry supplies, as recent rains and floods in the area have seriously impacted her business, resulting in losing a large part of the cover on her land and together with it the corresponding food crops. Additionally, attempts to recuperate crops to feed the cattle resulted in a difficult economic expense for the family. If Hilda does not have this loan, she cannot continue with the production rate necessary. Both her and her husband are eager to overcome this difficulty, in order to maintain their level of income and meet the needs of the family, always looking out for their welfare.

loans.use: to purchase dry supplies, as recent rains and floods in the area have seriously impacted her business.

loans.name: Vijana/ Wazee Group

texts.en:
The woman raising her hand in the photograph is Wayua, a member of Vijana/Wazee Group. She is 51 years old, married and the mother of five. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in the year 2013 to benefit from the training, especially on enterprise development and financial management. Before the training, she was a housewife and after the training, she started a business selling fruits and vegetables.

Wayua is borrowing from Kiva to buy more fruits and vegetables such as cabbages, tomatoes, mangoes, pawpaws and passion fruit to add stock and meet her customers' demands.

She is very grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support which will enable her to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables such as cabbages, tomatoes, mangoes, pawpaws and passion fruit so as to add stock and meet her customers' demands.

loans.name: Semy

texts.en:
Semy works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing nets.

Semy has been in this business for 12 years now.

In the future, Semy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets

loans.name: Maiuni Wendano Shg Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photograph is Jacinta.  She is married and has 3 children. She operates a hardware store.
The objective of Jacinta joining Hand in Hand Eastern Africa is to gain knowledge on enterprise development and record keeping. She is borrowing the loan to buy more stock and to introduce more items in her hardware store, such as nails, water pipes, iron sheeting and cement. She hopes this will help meet customer's rising demand and thus more income.  She is happy for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy a stock of nails, water pipes, iron sheeting and cement to help meet customers demand.

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 6,750 through NWTF to purchase gasoline, wood, bamboo, and fishing net for her fishing business.

Virgie has been in this business for three years. She earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish and raising pigs.

Virgie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline, wood, bamboo, and fishing net.

loans.name: Ana Edelmira

texts.es:
Edelmira, de 42 años de edad, estudio solo segundo grado, pues su familia no contaba con los recursos para que ella continuara estudiando.- Ahora, está casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, tienen cuatro hijos, tres de ellos estudian y el otro les ayuda a trabajar.

Edelmira, se dedica al comercio desde hace tres años, aprendió este oficio porque necesitaba una fuente de ingresos para sacar adelante a sus hijos, también en su casa vende gelatina, flanes, choco-bananos y charamuscas, su hijo mayor siempre le ayuda en las actividades que ella realiza.

Edelmira, necesita el crédito para comprar camisas, pantalones, centros y ropa interior para ambos sexos. 
 
Ella sueña, con poner un negocio de ropa en su casa, pues por el momento sale a vender en los caseríos cercanos.- Además, sueña con apoyar a sus hijos, hasta que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Edelmira, age 42, only attended school until grade 2 as her family did not have the resources to keep her in school. She is now married and her husband works in agriculture. They have four children, three of whom are in school and the other of whom helps her work.
Edelmira has worked in business for three years. She learned this work because she needed a source of income to support her children. She also sells from home jello, flan, choco-bananas and candy twist. Her eldest son always helps her with her business.
Edelmira needs this loan to purchase shirts, pants, belts, and underwear for both genders.
She dreams of starting a clothing business in her home. At the moment, she goes out to sell in nearby hamlets. She also dreams of supporting her children until they become professionals.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, belts and underwear for both genders.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy ingredients for traditional juice drinks made from boiled fruit, vegetables and other foods to increase her production and sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a store for farm supplies.

loans.name: Franciscah

texts.en:
Franciscah is 47 year old, married and she supports 10 family members. She has been operating her retail shop for the last 10 years. The business earns her a monthly income of KES 18,000.

Franciscah has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya, which she plans to use to buy more stocks for her shop. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and to open a retail branch in the area.

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy more stocks in her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more packets of seeds and sacks of fertilizers for better agricultural production and to meet the demands of clients for food in the market.

loans.name: Gakoigo Business Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Rehab, 36 years old, married and living with her three children. She is a member of Gakoigo Business Women Group, which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HIH EA) in 2014.

Rehab has undergone HIH EA training on enterprise development and financial management. She is now able to manage her business well and account for her income. She has previously benefited from the HIH EA enterprise incubation fund, which she used to start a banana selling business targeting the local customers. The enterprise has grown and she plans to reach a wider market to supply her bananas. She is borrowing from Kiva to expand her business by buying more stock of bananas. This will help improve her profits, thus helping to cater for family needs with ease.

Rehab is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bananas that will help improve sales and thus more profits.

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en:
Noreen is 26, and she is married. She lives with her husband and a child in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Noreen purchases clothes at cheap rates with the help of her husband, and then sells them in her locality. She has been doing this for many years. She has enough experience to know the clothing business very well. She wants to utilize her experience and generate more profit, but she needs to take a loan due to her poor financial condition. 

Due to summer weather, the demand for lawn clothing has increased. Noreen showed an interest in taking a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy a variety of lawn clothes to sell. She hopes that she will utilize this loan positively and that she can grow her business. Her dreams are to provide a better living standard and charming clothes for her children.

loans.use: to purchase lawn clothing for resale from her home

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 44 years old, married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Wilma has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Wilma requested a PHP 21,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Wilma has been in this business for six years. In the future, Wilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Bomoniwat

texts.en: Bomoniwat is 28 years old and married, with twin children in his care. Currently, he is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in law. He is also working in an organization as a kid trainer, making around USD11 each day. His wife is 26 years old and she works as a cleaner in a hospital, earning around USD13 a day. Bomoniwat would like to request a loan and he will use it to pay his first-year tuition fee. This loan will help him finish the first year successfully. In the future, he hopes to find a good job and support his children to earn bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to pay his first-year tuition fee

loans.name: Parvina

texts.en: Parvina is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1987. She is living in a small town with her family. She is single. For about six years, she has been doing business in the domestic market selling religious books and also traditional hats. She has a sister who supports and helps her to do business. She is a responsible, hardworking and honest person. She is polite with customers and has permanent clients every day. She wants to enhance her goods and buy books, also to order traditional hats. She asks a loan from Kiva lenders to buy traditional hats and religious books. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy traditional hats and religious books

loans.name: Hamidan

texts.en:
Hamidan is a 51-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children. She knits handmade embroidery in her home. She knits mirrors over aligned designs printed on cloth. Her craft is very famous in her locality. She sells her knitted craft in the market and generates income for her family.

Now she wants to enhance her current business, but due to lack of money she finds it difficult. Therefore Hamidan has requested a loan from Kiva lenders. She hopes that through this Kiva loan she will be able to buy thread of various colors and mirrors. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase thread and mirrors for knitting crafts.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is 25 years old, married and supports a family of 4 members. He has been supplying charcoal for the last 3 years and earns KES4,000 per month. 

Joshua has applied for his first loan of KES25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy more charcoal stock and to build a shade for marketing his products. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children to a high level.

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal stock and to build a shade for marketing his products.

loans.name: Nhóm 11_Hiệp Khởi_Đông Tiến_Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs Khẩn works in agriculture raising cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

Mrs Khẩn is 49 years old and she is married with 4 children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 11_Hiệp Khởi_Đông Tiến_Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 

This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Mrs Khẩn has been involved in this business for 5 years.
The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Mrs Khẩn hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more baby cattle to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Nhóm 21_Toàn Tân_Đông Tiến_Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hiệp has a retail business selling cake, sweets, sugar, milk, etc. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cake, sweets, sugar, milk, etc. to resell.

Hiệp is 42 years old, married, and has four children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 21_Toàn Tân_Đông Tiến_Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of four members. 

In 2013, Hiệp joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. She has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Hiệp has been involved in this business for five years. The main harship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hiệp hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase cake, sweets, sugar, milk, etc. to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle windscreen and other maintenance products

loans.name: Teo

texts.en: Teo lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 3 children and all go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She operates a pub in a shop that she rents. She has been in this business for the last 5 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested for a loan from MCDT – SACCO to buy crates of beer, soda, boxes of water and spirits. Her major challenge includes seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to educate her children to university level. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy crates of beer, soda, boxes of water and spirits .

loans.name: Nhóm 06 Đông Tân Đa Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tiến works in agriculture raising fish and shrimp. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby fish and shrimp to raise and sell in the future.

Tiến is 53 years old, married, and has two children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 06 Đông Tân Đa lộc solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

This is Tiến's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tiến hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby fish and shrimp to raise and sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a mother of four children. She wants to earn a living to help her husband in providing their family's needs.

She is engaged in fish vending and her husband is the one who does the fishing. To earn more income, she decided to borrow a loan again to buy materials for additional fishing nets so that her husband can catch more fish and she can sell more fish in the market also.

Elena wants in the future to buy a new fishing boat for business expansion.

loans.use: to buy materials for the additional fishing nets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs for higher production

loans.name: Yokonia

texts.en: Yokonia is a 38 year old married man, with two children who attend school. Yokonia does cattle fattening and has a motorcycle taxi (boda boda) as his major sources, which he done for over 10 years. However Yokonia has been hindered by limited capital to expand his projects. He decided to join Ugafode for financial assistance and he applied for a loan of UGX 1,500,000 to buy another motorcycle in order to boost his business of boda boda and earn an increased income. Yokonia thanks Ugafode for the financial assistance it extends to the active poor, which has improved their standards of living.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Hesbon

texts.en:
Hesbon is 45 years old, married and supports a family of 5 members. He has been operating his cafe for the last 25 years and earns KES15,000 per month.

Hesbon has applied for his first loan of KES25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow to supply milk to his cafe. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children.

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to supply milk to his cafe

loans.name: Nhóm 08 Mỹ Điền Đa Lộc Group

texts.en:
Toàn works in agriculture raising fish and shrimp. She is applying for a loan to purchase more baby fish and shrimp to raise and sell in future.  Toàn has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Toàn is 47 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the leader of a 5-member group, the Nhóm 08 Mỹ Điền Đa Lộc solidarity group. 

In 2014, Toàn joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Toàn has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. The main hardship that Toàn faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Toàn hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby fish and shrimp to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Marta Elena

texts.es:
Marta, ofrece nuevos productos que son del agrado de sus clientes y su familia está siempre unida y sus condiciones de vida son mucho más dignas.
Solicita un nuevo crédito por la buena atención que se le brinda y por los beneficios que recibe al invertirlos en su negocio, comprará golosinas, azúcar, sal, pastas, cereales, aceite, bebidas. etc., reactivara su negocio para tener ingresos importantes con los que sale adelante junto a s familia.
texts.en:
Marta offers new products that are liked by her customers. Her family is always united and their living conditions are much more dignified. 

She is asking for a new loan for the good care that she provides and she invests the profits in her business. 

She will purchase candy, sugar, salt, pastas, grains, oil, drinks, etc. She will re-energize her business to get better important income with which she can get ahead together with her family.

loans.use: to purchase candy, sugar, salt, pastas, grains, oil, drinks, etc. She will re-energize her business to get better important income

loans.name: Libia Ether

texts.es:
Libia, junto a su esposo ha podido formar una unidad familiar y productiva bastante fuerte, ya que no solo prima el amor si no también los deseos de salir adelante y progresar como familia.

Ella se dedica a la cría y venta de cerdos y pollos de levante, es una actividad aprendida de su esposo quien actualmente se dedica a esta actividad y ha sido la principal fuente de ingresos durante mucho tiempo.

Ella pide un auxilio económico para comprar algunos cerdos pequeños e irlos cuidando y criando para posteriormente venderlos y así poder mejorar su producción y ampliar su mercado.

Es una mujer soñadora y con gran voluntad, tanto así que ya piensa en grande y desea tener una marranera con gran capacidad.

Tiene gran ilusión y expectativa con este proyecto y confía en el buen corazón de los prestamistas de Kiva para crecer como empresaria.
texts.en:
Libia, together with her husband, has been able to form a strong and productive family unit, not only giving priority to love but also to the desire to move forward and progress as a family.

She works at the raising and selling of pigs and chickens.  It is an occupation that she learned from her husband who currently works at this and it has been the principal source of income for a long time.

She is asking for economic help to buy some little pigs to take care of, raise and sell, and thus be able to improve production and increase her market.

She is a woman who dreams and has great determination, so much so that she thinks big and would like to have a large pig farm.

Libia has great hope and expectations with this project. She is confident in the good hearts of the Kiva loaners and that she will be able to grow as a businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy some small pigs to care for and raise in order to sell them afterwards

loans.name: Yajaira

texts.es:
Madre de 5 hijos y con un gran deseo verlos convertidos en todos unos profesionales es el motivo que llena de entusiasmo y animo la señora Yajaira de 36 años de edad a trabajar incansablemente en su criadero de carneros pues aspira que con este humilde empleo brindarles una educación universitaria a todos sus hijos ya que no quiere verlos en un corral realizando estas funciones.

Ya que su deseo es poder brindarles una buena educación a todos sus hijos necesita de una actividad capaz de generar los recursos suficientes para cubrir estos gastos y sin descuidar los gastos primordiales del hogar.

Se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para la compra de carneros pequeños los cuales criara y engordara para su posterior venta. 

Yajaira está muy motivada con este gran proyecto ya que sus hijos demuestran buenas actitudes estudiantiles y disposición para triunfar y hacer que sus padres se sientan más que orgulloso de sus hijos
texts.en:
The mother of five children, she has a great desire to see each one of them become professionals. This is the motivation that fills Yajaira, age 36, with the enthusiasm and energy to work untiringly in her sheep-raising operation. With this humble occupation, she aspires to provide all of her children with a university education, since she doesn't want to see them in an animal pen doing this work. 

Since her desire is to provide a good education to all of her children, she needs work that can generate sufficient resources to cover these costs, without neglecting the basic expenses of the household. 

She sees the need to request a loan to buy lambs, which she will raise and fatten up to sell later. 

Yajaira is very motivated by this great project, since her children have a good attitude in school and the desire to succeed and to make their parents more than proud of them.

loans.use: to buy lambs which she will raise and fatten up to sell.

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.en: Mamlakat is a bright woman. She was born into a family of workers in 1972. She is living in one of the big districts in the northern part of Tajikistan and is married with four children. She, from early childhood, was a hardworking and responsible woman who loves her family. She has been busy in agriculture for almost 30 years and helps her husband financially to feed their family. She keeps livestock and knows well her activity. She is planning to buy additional livestock and nurture them for further selling. She hopes to have a good business and earn money to live better.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock and nurture them for further selling

loans.name: Nhóm 10 Thôn 1 Hoa Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs Như works in agriculture raising pigs. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

Mrs Như is 44 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 10 Thôn 1 Hoa Lộc solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 

In 2014, Mrs Như joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution and has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Mrs Như hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: 33 Thắng Tây Ngư Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hiền operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to resell. She is 43 years old and is married with 3 children. She is the group leader of the 33 Thắng Tây Ngư Lộc solidarity group, which consists of 7 members. 

In 2009, Mrs Hiền joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 7 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Mrs Hiền has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is lack of capital.

With her business profit, Mrs Hiền hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of dried foodstuffs

loans.name: Jessan Marie

texts.en:
Jessan Marie is 24 years old, with a partner who helps her for a living. She has one child to provide for daily needs. She is engaged in fish vending with the help of her partner, who does the catching of fish and she sells it to the market. She is borrowing again to buy additional fishing nets, so that they can catch more and more fish to sell in the market and be able to increase their income.

Jessan Marie wants to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional fishing nets for fishing.

loans.name: 27 Phú Hòa Hưng Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thu works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry to resell. She is 47 years old and is married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the 27 Phú Hòa Hưng Lộc solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. 

This is Mrs Thu's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution and she has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is lack of capital.

With her business profit, Mrs Thu hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future
